Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Al-Bukharī
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O children, since I have fulfilled this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, and by its completion its end has been reached, and by its chapters and its explanations it seems to me that I should supplement it with this treatise, which deals with manual operations, i.e. surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the art of manual operation is prostrate in our region and time, almost entirely neglected, so that its science has perished, and its traces are hidden; and nothing remains of it but a few brief descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have been altered by their owners, leading to errors and misinterpretations such that the meanings of these descriptions are obscured and the force and art of this manual operation are prolonged.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I should revive this with the arrangement of this treatise according to the method of exposition, explanation, and abbreviation; and let it come with the forms of cautery tools and other instruments of the work, as well as their addition in the explanation, and their preparation, which is necessary for this cause.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause why there is not found a good artisan of manual operation in this our time is that the art of medicine is long, and its practitioner must first be exercised in the science of anatomy, which Galen understood to mean knowing the joints of the members and their shapes, as well as their conjunctions and separations; and having knowledge of the bones, nerves, and tendons - their numbers and arrangements; and of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and the places where they emit.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And thus says Hippocrates with his own name that it is not a little thing in work, but especially in the art of manual operation.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said in the introduction of this book that whoever is not knowledgeable about what we have said regarding anatomy will certainly fall into error, which has caused many deaths among men, as I have seen many times; for some are formed in this science and yet depart from it without knowledge or experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor incision an escrophulous abscess in the neck of a woman, and cut some arteries of the neck so that much blood flowed out, causing the woman to die suddenly.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who took it upon himself to remove a stone from a man who had reached that state, and the stone was large, but he came and removed that stone with a piece of bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I had already predicted that he would die, and saw that because of the size of the stone and the disposition of his illness.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who was paid twelve ducats from our land to perform surgery, and he undertook the case of a blacksmith who had fractured his thighbone; but because of his ignorance, the doctor prepared the fracture with splints and wedges with great force, without leaving room for expansion.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And he set the bone according to his desires, and set it in traction, and left it like that for some days, commanding that they loosen the bandages; but it was done in such a way that the thighbone became inflamed with pus, leading to its ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him and prepared to loosen the bandages, but there was no calm or relief from his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But the corruption was already established in the member, so that I could not stop it, and the corruption continued to spread throughout the limb until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who pierced a cancerous abscess, and it became ulcerated within a few days, causing the evil to spread throughout the man's body.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	This is because the cancerous ulcer is full of black bile, so it should not be treated with fire alone, but rather with something that can counterbalance it in the affected member.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, my children, it is necessary for you that manual operation be divided into two parts: one for operations that are associated with health, and another for those where danger lurks in the most severe dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already mentioned this throughout the entire book wherever an operation involving error and fear is discussed, so that you should guard against it and leave it alone, so that foolish men do not find an opportunity to speak and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Therefore, take up your arms with diligence and protection from God, and treat your illnesses with happiness and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way to achieve health and success with the grace of God; leave behind difficult illnesses that are hard to cure; show your arms against what makes you afraid, so that your faith and your name may not waver. For it is more pleasing to remain in glory, and thus it will be later on earth and in heaven for your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	For as I have said in some of my books:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	“Do not treat serious illnesses unless you are skilled doctors.”
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Here begins the division of the book, and first the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	Chapter One is ordered here concerning the weights of the instruments, their forms and the irons for cauterization, and what is necessary in surgery.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	Chapter Two on dry and wet cupping, perforation, and extraction of arrows and similar instruments, all ordered with their forms.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	Chapter Three on reduction and dislocation, and treatment of torticollis and similar conditions; ordered with weights and forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cautery with fire and sharp medicine, and a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is necessary that I speak about the qualities of those who perform cautery and its instruments, and in what complexion it is prohibited to perform cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the discourse on the qualities of the surgeon performing cautery and its instruments is long and complex, subtle by science, and secret. Many wise men have already spoken about it, and they disagree among themselves; but for me, a brief mention will suffice to avoid lengthiness.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery is beneficial for all complexions universally, both with matter and without matter, except for two complexions which are dry without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the dry and hot complexion with matter, opinions are divided. Some say that cautery is beneficial for it, while others say the opposite, that cautery is not suitable for illnesses caused by heat and dryness, since fire has the qualities of heat and dryness, and it would not be appropriate to treat a dry and hot illness with something that is also hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	"And he says that which is contrary to that, that by cautery it is done rightly in all dry and hot illnesses that come into the bodies of men, because when you compare the body of man and its humidity to the composition of fire, you find the body of man cold."
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	"And I say according to the speech of that one, that I have experienced this many times in practice."
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	"But it is not necessary that he should come upon this who has already been examined and practiced in the chapter of cautery by recent exercise, and knows the diversity of the composition of men and the condition of illnesses in their members, and their causes, accidents, and duration."
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	"But in other compositions there is less fear of you, and especially in hot and humid illnesses, because all doctors agree on these and are not disagreed about the judgment with cautery in those."
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	"And know, my son, that concerning the secret of curing by cautery with fire and its goodness, it is about cautery in burning medicine, because fire is simple, whose action only reaches the member that is cauterized, and does not harm the other member joined to it except with little damage."
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	"But the action of burning medicine reaches those members which are close to it, and often it brings illness to the member with difficult healing, and often it departs."
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	"But fire, because of its sublimity and goodness of substance, does not do this except to superfluate. And it is already known to us through experience and the length of service in study with the art about the truth of causes; and for that reason I am excused from the length of the sermon. And if it were not that my book is not read by you in this pause, to you would be hidden the secret concerning fire, and the quality of its operation on hearts and its expulsive power through which it expels illnesses, demonstrated with philosophical speech, which would sharpen your wits."
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	"And know, my son, that they disagree about the time in which it is convenient to perform cautery and consider the best time to be in spring."
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	"And I say that cautery is convenient at all times because the harm caused by accidental time is submerged in the benefit of what is attracted by cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary remedies for pains, strong and fistulas, which cannot tolerate delay because it is feared that malice may come, which is greater than little harm entering through time."
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	"And also do not keep this in your minds, my son, for that is not esteemed except by the common people and foolish doctors, because it is said that there are illnesses that are cured by cautery at any time, and they pause there."
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	"And the cause is not as they think for this reason, because cautery is only in place of medicine that alters the complexion and dries out the humidity which are the cause of pain."
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	"But nevertheless cautery is superfluous over medicine because of the volatility of its value and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord."
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	"And it is possible that its illness returns at some hour of time according to the complexion of the sick person and the location of his illness, and the virtue of cautery and what has been prepared in his body from the aggregation of superfluities therein, and what has been brought to him in its acquisition through foods and similar causes; but the illness in which cautery is administered is a subtle illness in members with few superfluities and humidities, thus like cautery for toothache and similar ones it is possible that that pain does not return in him, but this happens rarely."
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	"And moreover common speech says that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is true speech because there is nothing else that they understand in it, because they believe that there is no cure that profits by medicine nor by any other cause before cautery."
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	"And the cause is contrary to this; and the intention that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is only when administering the means of cure in certain illnesses, and those medicines do not confer benefit, and therefore cautery is administered at the end of the disease, and it profits there."
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	"And from here on I say that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the intention which the vulgar and many foolish doctors understand."
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	"And they said in ancient times that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance."
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	"And they said that the place of cautery does not make a scar, as it is not absolutely true, because I have already proved and demonstrated that this is only done in some bodies without the others, and cautery with gold is good and better than with iron as they said; but however when you perform cautery with fire with gold, it is not declared to you, because it becomes ignited according to the quantity that you want due to the heat of the gold, and prepares to receive friction; and if you adjust over it ignition the gold will be melted by the fire, and some thin sheets fall into the fire for the occupation of the artisan."
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	"And therefore cautery with iron should be done more gently and more prudently to the correctness of operation."
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	"And I have already ordered this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head among the feet, so that later when asking for something about it, you can find what you want."
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	"On cautery for headache due to coldness and humidity."
Le capitol primier.	Chapter one.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	"This cautery confers benefit to the humidity and coldness on the second accident of which these two causes are the root, such as excess of phlegm and flux calledorrhea from the head to the parts of the eyebrows and ears flowing, and excess of sleep, and toothache and headache, and universally all illnesses that come from coldness, such as paralysis, soddenness, and apoplexy, and similar ones in those illnesses."
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	"The form of this cautery is as follows: first command the patient to be evacuated with laxative medicine purging the head for three or four nights according to what you require based on the virtue of the patient, his age and his habit."
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	"And then command him to shave his head with a razor and then make him sit between your hands on a cushioned bench and have him hold his breath."
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	"And then place the blade of your palm next to the bridge of his nose between his eyebrows."
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	"But however, when your finger has reached the middle place, mark that spot with a point and then heat the olive cautery which is of this form:"
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	"And then place it on the marked spot in such a way that it descends slowly while your hand becomes gradually contracted and you rotate it."
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	"And then raise your hand lightly and look at the spot and if you see that some of the bone is already exposed on the head like the size of a grain of barley, then raise your hand; but if it does not return to its place with that iron, take another one which has cooled down so that what I have said to you can be seen."
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	"And then take some salt and dissolve it on the spot and leave it there for three days."
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	"And then place a piece of cotton dipped in honey around the edge and leave it there until the scar from the fire has healed."
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat the spot with fourfold ointment until it is healed."
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	"And it was said that when the wound remains open, it is better to bind the arm, for it is thus better and more healing."
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	"And some of them said that the spine should be cauterized within the bone, and that the cautery should be held until it burns any part of the spinal cord."
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	"Therefore it should be scraped with this bone which is burnt, and therefore it should be treated."
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	"And others said that when the cautery reaches the end of it, it should press firmly onto the bone until the bone cracks, and this is the method of small cauterization."
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	"They consider that place where the vapors of the head expire."
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	"And if the wound remains open for a long time, it should be treated until it is consolidated."
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	"More than that, I have not seen these two kinds of cauterization in any person, except in some men according to their fear; and let it be, it seems better with health when they are; for the head is weakened by the solution of continuity from such a wound as we have testified in other members, and more so when the head of the sick man is of weak nature."
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	"And the first kind of cauterization is safer and better in my opinion, and for that reason it is healthier."
Capitol segon.	"Chapter Second."
Del cauteri del cap.	"Of the Cautery of the Head."
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	"When there occurs chronic and long-lasting pain in the entire head, and this is prolonged illness, and remedies are used such as lotions, poultices, compresses, plasters, bandages, cataplasms, and similar things, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery that does not prove beneficial for any of those causes, then consider whether the head of the sick person is of strong constitution in its nature; and if it is not weak but rather robust, then cauterize with another cautery, but not too much."
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	"And properly cauterize there on the horn of his head with a cautery until the bone is broken."
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	"Incise the bone and expose the quantity of bone that we have mentioned, and cauterize there with a cautery at the last part of the head where it is called 'vas', which is the place where cupping glasses are applied."
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	"And ease your hand in this, and do not expose the bone, for by doing so it causes much more pain than all other cauteries of the head."
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	"And I tell you this cautery in its place, for it is necessary to use the cautery with which one cauterizes the horns of the head and the occiput, which is more subtle than that with which one cauterizes the middle part of the head; and this is the form of it."
Capitol ters.	"Chapter Third."
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	"Of Cautery for Non-Classical Migraine."
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	"When there occurs sudden pain in the part of the head or a prolonged pain within the ear, let it be evacuated with medicines that clear the head, and let the other treatment that I have mentioned in the sections on diseases be administered, and if it does not help at all, then cautery is to be performed in two ways: either cautery with an acrid burning medicine or with iron."
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	"But cauterizing with a burning medicine is to take one handful of saltwort, and grind that up finely, and separate the extremities of it on both sides."
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	"And properly incise the location of the pain in the temple with a sharp lancet until it reaches the bone, but so that it remains concealed."
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	"And then strain over it with a tight bandage by means of continuous compression, and leave that for the space of three hours; and properly remove the bandage and squeeze out the saltwort, and let the wound heal for two or three days, and then compress again on the submerged spot until the place becomes hard."
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And finally cure it with an ointment until it is healed."
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	"And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines which I have written about in the second book on burning medicines."
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	"But cautery with iron is performed in this way: first, heat a cautery of the following shape:"
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	"And it is called 'clavis clavorum', for the head of it is like the shape of a nail with some curvature, and in the middle part of it there is a small elevation."
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	"And then place it on the location of the pain and hold your hand steady—so that the cautery does not stick to what is left—and turn the hot iron gently with speed."
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	"And if much of it sticks to the bone in this way, then raise your hand for fear that the artery which is left should not stick, lest blood flow."
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then immerse the spot in saltwater and place it there, and leave it for three days; and then compress it with mustard plaster, and finally cure it with an ointment until it is healed."
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	"And if you wish, cauterize with the point of the cutting instrument according to this cautery, and beware of incising an artery in this migraine which is properly non-ancient."
Capitol quart.	"Chapter Fourth."
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	"Of Cautery for Ancient Migraine."
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	"But when you are treating migraine with what we have said about the previous treatment and also what we have said in the sections on diseases, but that treatment does not help, and if the disease is such that it does not respond to what has been said about the first cautery with medicine or cautery with fire, then heat the cutting cautery until it becomes red-hot, since you will mark out the location of the pain with a line of its length, or else guess where it is; and then place your hand for a moment and press down hard until you incise the artery and reach the bone."
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	"However, it is necessary for you to guard against damaging the continuation of the mandible, which is moved during mastication, and that the cartilage should not stick and the nerves which move it should not be damaged, and that no spasm occurs."
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	"And if it is about the caution and care regarding the flow of blood from the artery that is opened, since there is fear in its opening, especially for one who does not know what he is doing and is not studious and skilled; and let the operation begin."
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	"And I will bring to mind the regulation of accidental bleeding from an artery according to its manner in its proper place in this book."
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	"And if you see that this disease does not respond to this cautery and that the patient's constitution is tolerable, then cauterize him in the middle of the head as we have described, and cure the wound until it is healed."
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	"And if you wish, administer the cautery which we have mentioned in the chapter on arresting bleeding with cautery using two tweezers, since this is better cautery and more effective."
Capitol .v.	"Chapter Fifth."
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	"Of Cautery for Earaches."
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	"When in the ear there is pain from friction and it is treated with laxative causes and other treatments which I have mentioned in the section on diseases, but the pain does not subside, then heat the cautery, and this is called 'punctum', of which this is the shape:"
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	"And then make punctures around the ignition, and let it be moved around the entire ear like a wheel is turned, or in the circuit of each one if the pain is in each."
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	"And go along with the cautery of the radius of the ear little by little until you have felt out the spot with the tip."
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	"And if you make ten punctures all over the ear and it still hurts, then treat the spots until they are healed."
Capitol .vi.	"Chapter Six."
De cauterizacio de turtura.	"The cautery of a tumor."
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	A tumor that is cured by cautery is only one of the species which comes about from blood, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	"Avoid cautery of the species that occurs due to dryness or spasm of the nerve."
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that species of tumor with herbs and capperdines and guarguarisms, and your treatment does not work, then you must cauterize the disease with three cauteries: one at the root of the ear, the second a little below the temple, and the third at the junction of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	"And pause your cautery where it meets its opposite, for softening occurs only in the part that appears to be healed."
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	"And the manner of cauterization is that you cauterize it with a cautery in the right of the tip of the ear, a little above the horn of the head, and on the temple, its length being according to the length of the aforementioned finger, and then pause your hand with cautery until about half of the substance of the cautery is consumed."
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	"And this is the manner of the cautery, which is specific to surgeons, and its form is flat on one side."
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	"But nevertheless it is more subtle than that which you have seen; and it is necessary to cut away excessive roughness with a knife."
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	"And then cure the place with what is usually applied until it heals."
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of the cauterization of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and treated with what we have said, and the patient's medicine does not agree, then cauterize them with four cauteries: over all the horns of their head; and with a cautery on the middle of the head, as we have said; and with a cautery in the throat.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of cauterization is done as has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And once cauterized over the mouth of the stomach, it becomes more severe; and then it should be treated with what proceeds from you.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On cauterization for forgetfulness caused by phlegm.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Let the patient be given large jars and pills to swallow at the beginning.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	"Then shave the patient's entire head and place it on the cushion described in the treatise of plasters."
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	"And pause that some times, for that is the manner of cautery."
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	"Then do this according to that method which I have already described."
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	"And then, if he is healed well with these, otherwise do three cauteries on the last part of his head, which should be descending from the most elevated part of the head towards the lowest part of the neck."
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	"And pause between each cautery the thickness of a finger, and then dress the cautery with that which is produced."
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	"But if you want to add and the illness is tolerant of it, then do one cautery in the middle place; but if you want greater addition, then cauterize those over both horns."
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	"Dress that while it is healing; and let the cauteries be olive-shaped according to the form given before."
Capitol .ix.	"Chapter IX"
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	"Of Cauterization of the Parietal Bone and of Softening of the Whole Body."
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	"Therefore, if you proceed in moistening the head with compresses and with that which we have said; and then shave the head of the patient, and then cauterize it with one cautery in the middle place of the head, and with one cautery over all the horns of the head, and with one cautery over the last part of it, and with three cauteries over the spine of the neck."
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	"And if it is necessary in the illness of moistening the body too much and the illnesses tolerate it and the illness is strong, then cauterize those with four cauteries over the spine of the back, and afterwards with one cautery where the muscle of the neck has been fought, and raise the hand higher."
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	"And then dress that while it is healing, and let this be an olive-shaped cautery."
Capitol .x.	"Chapter X"
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	"Of Cauterization for Epilepsy."
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	"It is not cauterized in epilepsy unless the epilepsy is due to phlegm."
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	"It is necessary that you clean the patient's brain at the beginning of treatment and in another cure, as stated earlier when the patient is severely ill except for their refusal of medicine."
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	"And if it is a child who does not tolerate medicines, then administer purgatives and masticatories to aid digestion, beforehand for several days, with care in food preparation."
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	"And then shave the patient's head and cauterize it with one cautery in the middle of the head according to the previous method, another on the back of the head, and cauterize each horn of the head separately."
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	"And if the patient is strong and tolerates it, then cauterize them with those same cauteries mentioned earlier, having first paralyzed and softened the body over the vertebrae of the neck and back."
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	"And apply cautery with olive oil as previously described."
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	"But if the patient is a child, then pause cauterization using this method."
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On cauterization for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humidity and thick phlegm, then cauterize them with those same cauteries we have mentioned earlier, having first caused paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is declining excess and the body of the patient is humid, then give them to drink that which cleanses the brain according to what has been mentioned earlier in the division on this topic.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And also shave the patient's head, and then apply a plaster made from tortoise appropriately prepared around its circumference, and then place it in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient keep quiet, and be held down on all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a liniment, and afterwards it is appropriate to apply an ointment made from sheep's fat.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm this over the fire with moderate heat according to the measure that the patient can tolerate when it is applied to them.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then place it in the middle of the patient's head within the circle, and let it remain until it has cooled down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this with the patient once a week until they are healed, with the other regimen of lu being followed for their health; or if you wish, cauterize them with small points according to their condition, but always keep your hand on such an ordered cautery: this is a species of cautery which moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then apply that ointment compounded in wax or grease of swans.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On cauterization for water descending into the eye.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it has been declared that water is beginning to descend into the eye according to the signs which I have mentioned earlier in the division on this topic, then begin and give the patient to drink something that cleanses their head, and keep them from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And have them sit in a warm bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command him to shave his head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head; and also cauterize it with two cauteries on both temples if it is the beginning of water descending into both eyes, or on one side if it is only one eye.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Make incisions with a cautery along all the veins and arteries that are near the neck, and let the cauteries be in that length at the level of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful not to cause fluxes of blood when cauterizing, and if you see any fluxes of blood, stop them with some medicine that is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with skill in the extraction of arteries and the removal of those, and caution regarding fluxes of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	Sometimes it is cauterized on both sides of the two bones near the neck with two very pointed cauteries.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On cauterization for old lacrimation (excessive tearing).
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When lacrimation from the eyes is excessive and continuous, through the veins and arteries that are in the manifest location of the head externally, and it has been verified that this is a superfluity of bloody humors, then cauterize it with the cautery which we have mentioned in the chapter on the beginning of water descending into the eyes, and also with one cautery in the middle of the head and two cauteries on either side of the temples, and two cauteries on either side of the two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need to add more, then cauterize it also on all sides of the cheekbone over the extreme end of the eyebrow with small cauteries.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On cauterization for bad odor from the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you try to treat it with what we have mentioned in the division and your treatment does not succeed, then prepare and give the patient cochlias (shellfish) to drink for three nights; and also shave his head, and cauterize him with a medium cautery and an olive cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And also cauterize it with a clove cautery with two cauteries on both eyebrows just above the hair.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to cut that artery (the nasal artery).
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	This is the form of the clove cautery:
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On cauterization for relaxing eyelids.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid is relaxed due to illness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery using this lunar cautery, and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	"If you wish, cauterize that above both eyebrows using two cauteries placed apart, away from the temples."
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	"And let the length of each cautery be according to the quantity of the eyebrow."
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	"Press not too hard with the cautery, but according to the amount that one-third of the eyelid should be burnt."
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	"Regarding cauterization of the eyelashes when they grow inward and strike the eye."
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	"When the eyelashes grow inward and touch the eye, cauterization should be performed in one of two ways: either by cautery or with medicated fire."
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	"If cauterization with fire is chosen, tell the patient beforehand to lengthen his eyelashes like those that are plucked out, until they become long and hard. And if they touch the corner of their eyes, then stretch the eyelids with a bandage so that they may not be harmed while the eyelashes grow."
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	"When they have grown long and hard, then place the patient's head on a high table, and holding a tent-like instrument over the eyelids with one hand, make an incision with a scissor-like tool near the base of the eyelashes."
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	"And then place cotton soaked in egg white or mucilage of pomegranate seeds on the eye."
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	"Then ignite the cautery of which this is its shape."
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	"Then cauterize the figure that you have drawn, gradually in several views until the surface of the cord appears like the leaf of myrtle."
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	"The sign of health of your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and its hairs raised above the puncture."
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	"Then raise your hand and leave that for three days. Afterwards, pause over that place with the border until the scar has disappeared."
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"Then dress it with ointment until it is healed."
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	"But if the hairs return for some cause, then remove them again and if the eyelid becomes softened, do the cautery once more just as you had done initially."
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	"But if the hairs do not return on the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural position and covered up so that the hairs do not touch the eye."
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	"But during cauterization with medicine, order the patient to let their hairs grow until they are prolonged and covered up, and then make a paper or cloth shape like the leaf of myrtle."
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	"Then take known soap and live coals separately. Take both quickly, mix them well together with haste so that they do not cool down. Then spread this mixture onto the paper which has been made in the shape of a myrtle leaf, place it on one or both eyes. Let the eye area be covered with cotton wool soaked in egg albumen and let the patient lie still with their head on their back."
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	"Then place your finger on the medicine and press it gently without moving it until the patient feels the biting sensation of the medicine, for this sensation is like that of fire."
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	"Then when you perceive that the sensation of biting has begun, then remove the medicine and wipe it with your little finger; then when the sensation of biting has stopped, then remove the medicine and wash the eye with water. Then observe if sometimes the eyelid is raised as it should be washed away by the contraction with fire or incision, for then it will be well done. And if not, apply the medicine again to the place where the medicine did not adhere, until it becomes covered up completely."
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	"Then place your finger on the site with its edge until the thread of adhesion is eliminated, then heal it with ointment or with another means so that it is healed."
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	"And it is necessary for you to guard with vigilant diligence that no residue of the medicine falls into the eye. And if the eyelid becomes softened after several days and some cause of the hairs touches the eye, then apply your medicine again to that place where the eyelid is softened, exactly as you did at the beginning. And then avoid it until it is healed."
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	"And this is the shape of a myrtle leaf."
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	"And know that men's eyes are diverse according to their size and smallness, and therefore your contraction should be made accordingly."
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	"And it will not be hidden from those who study this art correctly."
Capitol .xvii.	"Chapter XVII."
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	"Of the cautery of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye."
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula as we have mentioned in our division of diseases and your treatment does not succeed, then you must cauterize it in this manner: Command the patient to place their head on their left side, and hold their head with some servant between your hands so that it is not moved or agitated by their head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place cotton soaked in oil or wool grease on the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	"And then ignite the cautery whose form is as follows:"
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	"whose shape is hollow like a reed or an eagle's feather pen at one end where the cautery is made."
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	"And if you wish, it should be penetrating within the other extremity."
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	"And if you want it to come out like this:
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	"However, that which is cauterized is better for one's work."
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	"And then press the fistula if it is open and remove from it pus and moisture."
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	"But if it is not open, then open it and squeeze out the pus."
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	"And then place the cautery, which should be well ignited, on it, and hold it with your hand but a little below the cautery at the opening of the nostril, so that you do not burn your hand or cause the patient discomfort. Then pause the cautery in the gristle of the nostril and cauterize that."
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	"And then if at the beginning of your cautery it enters the bone, that is good. But if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice if necessary, and leave it like that for three days, and then apply a cloth with dry ointment around it until it is healed."
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	"But if eleven days have passed and it has not healed, then apply a caustic medicine that will expose the bone and rasp it according to what is convenient in its chapter."
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	"And here is another method of cauterizing a fistula that was first described: enter the opening of the fistula and dig into it with a thin camphor stick that has this shape: And on that, pour in the quantity of one dram of molten lead. Then hold it with your hand with good retention, so that the molten lead does not reach the skin of the patient; and cover the area around the opening of the fistula with powdered egg whites or water, because the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it wonderfully."
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	"And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cautery and treatment, that is good. But if not, then it is necessary to perform a tracheostomy and reduce the fistula into the throat according to what will come in its proper place."
Capitol .xviii.	"Chapter xviii."
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	"On the cautery of the opening of the buttocks."
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	"Fissures often occur on the lips, more commonly in infants."
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	"So when you treat those fissures with what we have said in the divisions and your treatment does not help, then use a small cautery knife in this manner that is shown to us:"
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	"And it should be concave like a needle's tip."
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	"Approach the incision carefully into those fissures until the cautery reaches the center of the fissure."
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	"And then dress it with cerote until it is healed."
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	"On the cautery of a fistula in the mouth."
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	"When an abscess forms on the uvula or palate or on the roots of teeth and it breaks open, and it becomes old, and pus flows out forming a fistula, and you treat it but it does not heal, then you should cauterize with fire according to the size received in the fistula. Then put that burning iron into the track of the fistula, and hold your hand so that the hot iron reaches the center of it. And after doing this once or twice, then dress it with what we have said for its treatment until it is healed."
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	"And if the bone is resected and it heals, then that is good. But if not, then it is necessary to discover the place and remove the rotten bone according to what comes up in its chapter."
Capitol .xx.	Capítol sobre la reduccion de luxaciones en les articulacions.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	"Treatment of teeth by cauterization and softening of veins."
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	"When veins are softened by humidity and teeth are aching, if you treat them with medications and they do not improve, then pause the head of the patient on your thigh, and promptly bring the cautery instrument here described, so that you place the cautery cup over the tooth and insert it quickly into that area, removing your hand a little before the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth."
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	"And promptly remove your hand, and again apply the cautery several times according to what you desire."
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	"And then the patient should rinse his mouth with salt water and keep it for an hour, and afterwards spit it out, because the aching tooth is fixed, the softened gum is strengthened, and the humidity that causes decay is dried."
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is caused by coldness or decay, if it does not yield to medicine, then cautery in that case is done in two ways: either cautery with the border of a cow's horn, or cautery with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Take the border of a cow's horn, heat it in the fire; then quickly take it out and wrap it around the end of an iron rod. Then heat that border-horn quickly, and apply it to the aching tooth without delay while it is still hot.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat this several times until the power of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	If you wish, dip wool or cotton in the border mentioned above and place it on the aching tooth, then hold over it a red-hot iron until the iron reaches the front of the concavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But in any case, the cautery with fire must be done carefully and slowly, making sure that neither the coal nor the iron is too hot to touch, so as not to cause injury to the mouth of the sick person.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then heat the cautery to its proper shape and apply it to the tooth while you hold your hand over your mouth until the cautery has cooled. Repeat this several times, either on that day or the following day, until the pain has subsided.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that after this cautery, the sick person should rinse his mouth well with good water and hold it for one hour, then spit it out. This is the shape of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize according to your will, as far as it is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cautery for external fistulas.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When external fistulas are filled with phlegm and humors, and do not heal despite medication, and you wish to cauterize them slightly for digestion's sake, then heat the cautery to its proper shape, which has two sharp points, so that smoke can exit from one point while the other is heated. Apply it once or twice, as needed, until it reaches the front of the fistula.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the fistula is small, then apply the cautery according to its size. Leave it alone for three days and then wash the area with warm water until what was burned by the fire has healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	Then dress it with ointment, bandages, and cloths until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the form of the cannula or cautery for this purpose is as follows:
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.
