Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	"When this adhesion occurs in many people, such that the eyelid is solidified upwards with the skin of the eye, and its movement and natural functions are hindered, then you should insert the tip of a needle under the eyelid and raise it up, or extend it using tweezers."
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	"And then you should cut the adhesion with a fine spatula that is not too sharp, having made it slightly obtuse so that the patient is not disturbed by the operation. Be careful not to let the spatula slip and harm the eye with its sharpness."
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	"And may your incision be such that it easily cuts through the adhesion, so that the eyelid returns to its natural shape and all of the adhesion is healed."
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	"And then you should put salt water in the eye, with which you rinse it out; or dissolve honey in water and use that to wash it instead."
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	"And then separate the eyelid from the eye with gauze and press on the eye with wool infused in egg white. And on the third day use consolidating remedies so that it may heal."
Capitol .xvi.	"Chapter XVI."
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	"Of Incision of Nail and of Protrusion of Flesh from the Lacrimal Ducts."
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	"Know that there are two kinds of nails: one is nervous and resembles hard cartilage; the other is not nervous and resembles congealed white moisture. When you touch this kind with a knife, it can be easily grasped with tweezers and cut off without the tweezers becoming stuck in it."
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	"And both of these species begin from the larger lacrimal duct, which gradually extends until it covers the eye and prevents light and movement."
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	"But the method of operating for this incision is that the patient holds his head steady by placing it against the table, and then you open his eyes and lift up the eyelid with your hand. Then you grasp the nail with tweezers using few duplicates and extend it upwards."
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	"And then take a needle and insert it under the nail a little bit using a horsehair or cowhair or pig hair or similar thread, or strong string. Then duplicate the tip of the needle little by little and insert it into the middle of the nail, pierce it with the needle, tie the nail with string, extend it upwards, and cut off the side of the nail that covers the pupil using the thread."
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	"And then follow this method behind it as well."
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	"And then cut off the remaining part of the nail in its root with a subtle spatula or small forceps and lift up the flesh of the natural lacrimal duct so that there is no continuous flow of tears from the incision."
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And sometimes you can also grasp and extend the nail with only one pair of tweezers or string as we have said earlier. And then cut off the remaining part of it using a lion-shaped spatula whose shape is like this:"
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	"And be careful that with the spatula you do not touch the corneal tunic and cause a rupture in it, or pierce the pupil."
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	"Then place a little bit of salted water or thin dough made from flour and sinapis into the eye and leave it overnight. Then rinse it with clean water until it is healed."
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	"And if the nail is not nervous and you cannot insert the needle into it or grasp it with tweezers, then sometimes this type of nail can be treated with medicines and healed as described in the division."
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	"But if you want to incise it, then open the eye of the patient and take a subtle lion-shaped spatula with acute edges like this:"
am subtilitat.	"with subtlety."
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	"And if sometimes it becomes rarefied and congested and stuck in its root, then distill from your mouth into the eye some thin dough made from flour and sinapis or egg white or salted water, and close the eye overnight."
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	"And then repeat the operation until all of it is removed. But if a contrary aposteme appears in the eye, then leave it alone and cure it at the beginning so that it heals."
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	"And then continue your operation on it with reason until it is healed."
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	"The prominence of the lacrimal caruncle, if it causes great discomfort in the eye, should be suspended with tweezers. Then cut off one part of it and do not extend the incision too much to avoid cutting the tear ducts."
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	"And then distill some egg white and flour made from sinapis into the lacrimal duct until it is healed."
Capitol .xvii.	"Chapter XVII"
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	Of Incision of an Abscess and of What is Born from Adherent Tissue in the Eye.
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	Sometimes in the eyes of some people rough flesh is born, which covers the pupil or approaches and adheres to the eyelids and presses them together at their edges like a column.
Mays la operacio en lu es que·l malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se; e aprop obre les huels de aquel e colligeys tota aquela carn am oncis convenientz ad aquo, e te aquo am una forcep o am cesti; e aprop inscindiys la carn el comensament entro que tot sia finit am le encisori, e guarda te del huel que no ledescas aquel deves la tua operacio.	But the operation for this is that the patient holds his head steady on the table, and then opens his eyes and grasps all of that flesh with appropriate tweezers or forceps or cesterne, and incises it at the beginning until everything is finished with the scalpel. But be careful not to hurt the eye during your operation.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	And your incision should be done with the scalpel with which you cut those nails or with the lion-shaped spatula mentioned in the chapter on cutting the nail, or with small forceps using a scalpel according to what is appropriate for this chapter.
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	Therefore, when your incision is finished and all of that flesh has been removed, then fill the eye with salted water or distill into it rough powder similar to corrosive medicines, and compress it externally with a bandage made from wool until it is certain that there is no cauterization.
E si roman alcuna causa de alguardenici e es senhoragat sanc caut, e temes apostema caut, lahoras leyssa le huel e cura aquela apostema am aquo que ceda aquela apostema, e aprop itera sobre aquel am operacio entro que sia sanat, e semblantment fay en la carn ajustada la qual accideys en le huel de aquesta especia.	And if there remains some cause of abscess and it is swollen but not cauterized, and you fear cauterization, then leave the eye alone and cure that abscess with what will help it heal. Then repeat your operation on it until it is healed, and do similarly for adherent flesh that occurs in this type of eye.
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	But you should avoid all cure of the eye by natural means or accidently done with iron instruments. Do not put your hand in any of these operations until you see that that member can withstand such an operation.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	Of Extraction of a Foreign Body from the Eye.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	Rough foreign bodies that are stuck in the eye and hinder its vision require an operation to remove them, which can take many days.
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel. o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	or two tweezers graduated in one body like this:

De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	"On the reduction of the swelling on the wound."

De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	"Of the incision of the prominence of the tunic of the eyeball."

Capitol .xxii.	"Chapter XXII"
De curacio de alconati.	Treatment for eye strain
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This condition known as eyestrain is nothing but excess heat that settles in the area around the eye, resembling water flowing downwards.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	The method of treating this condition is to make the patient sit on the prepared stool with their back straight, and then take hold of their head with both hands, moving it in such a way that you see the excess heat beginning to descend from the affected area. Then, dry it off so that it does not flow downwards, and cover them with clothing, so that they feel better as if they have seen light again.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not flow downwards, know that it is water.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	But if the excess heat is not properly prepared to flow downwards as we have said, then make the patient sit between your hands and take a small, fine spatula. Wipe with it on the inner corner of the eye, close to the continuation of the conjunctiva onto the cornea, until the excess heat has been dispersed.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	Once it has been dispersed, then distill onto the eye a few drops of water in which you have mixed honey or water in which you have boiled fenugreek and honey.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat them with other causes until they are healed.

Capitol .xxiv.	"Chapter XXIV."
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	"On the treatment of flesh torn in the nose."
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When flesh of diverse colors emerges from the nose, which is sometimes caused by a condition similar to a scorpion with heavy weights or polyps in the face; this illness is called polypus because it resembles that fish.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And its flesh is cancerous and pale, dark-colored; and its lion-like flesh is not dark-colored.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore, in that case where the flesh is not deceitful or cancerous, you should make the illness disappear between your hands and place it in the sun, open its nostrils, and pick up the lion's hair from those areas.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And immediately remove that from the parts deforo, and carefully cut away what you have grasped of those with sharp and subtle spatula from one part until you know that all the flesh is removed; so that if any cause remains for which amputation is possible, then quickly remove it with one of the delicate instruments with ease.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if there is an abscess with blood or pus, then you should wait until it opens up; but if it is of the malignant kind, then cut it open and cauterize it immediately after amputation so that blood may be stopped and all cavities may be cleaned out.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And also pour into the wound wine mixed with honey or water to make the incision clean.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the wound is open and moistures flow out towards the palate, then you know that it has already healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if moisture does not penetrate as it should, then you know that beneath the wound there is dead flesh and pus above the bones of the nostrils where amputation was not performed.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore you should then insert a probe into it if there is any thickness, and make knots at the mouth of the wound, leaving the quantity between each knot equal to the length of the finger or less. Then extract the disease by inserting one extremity of the probe into the nostril with a hook or other means available.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And after doing this, let him breathe strongly through his nostrils until the odor reaches the canals of the nostrils and let it escape over his gullet, as many people who have done this action before can see that children do at school. It is an easy thing for anyone who wishes to do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And also pause both extremities of the probe, one extremity which comes out over the nostril and the other which remains in the nostril. Then apply a suture of flesh around the knots that are on the probe until you know that the flesh is well attached to the knots on the probe.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	Then extract the probe and pause in the nostril until bleeding has stopped completely. Then apply a plaster made of honey and salt for three days or more until the wound is healed from the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And finally, at the end of the treatment, insert into the nostril a lead cannula for several days until it has healed completely.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you have to perform an operation that requires drying, use that one accordingly.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	"And this is the form of the device for purging the head with which oils and medicines are distilled into the nose:"
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	"And make this of silver or brass, it should resemble a small open lantern, like a small basin, with the mouth likewise."
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	"If you wish, make a closed cannula like this: and the opening of the instrument for purging the head should be flat and uncovered; at which you should hold it when you pour in oil or water that you want from the juices and causes of suction."
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	"And this is the recipe for purging the head: take of castor oil, white bay leaf, ginger, saffron flower, long pepper, scammony, and gum acacia one ounce each. Combine them with the juice of beetroot and cabbage, and make pills. Take one pill dissolved in hot water and administer it to the sick person lying down."
Capitol .xxv.	"Chapter XXV."
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	"Of knots (polyps) found in the nasal passages."
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	"Very often, a polyp is found in the nostrils, and it is magnified and inflamed during those days when much mucus flows from it."
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	"And for that reason, you should insert this (remedy) at the beginning of the appearance of the polyp and remove all of it."
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	"Then place a cautery or medicine that burns on the spot."
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	"However, if the incision is delayed until it becomes magnificent, then consider whether it has become hard, dark in color and insensitive. If so, do not touch that part with iron because it is a malignant cancer; many times those who cut this cancer end up dying because of great wickedness towards him who had it."
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	"And if the aposteme is of lion's touch and not dark in color, and sometimes incision is possible throughout it, then evacuate the sickness and incise without fear, and cure the spot with astringent water that constricts until it heals."
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	"Of the suture of the nose and lips, and of the ear when continuity is dissolved by plague or by injury."
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when a solution of continuity occurs in one of these cartilages, it is advisable to perform this operation on few men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then, when you find such a cause in someone, that you should consider whether it is fresh plague with its own blood, and then join the two lips of the wound with suture, and afterwards cure it until it heals.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	"And if the lips of a solution of continuity are already separated, and each one is healthy by itself, then you should cut each edge along its apparent course until there comes out blood."
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then join the two lips with suture and strengthen them, and over them sprinkle dragon's blood powder and a little bit of tragacanth gum, and place on top of it a piece of diafinicon plaster or some other consolidative plaster, and leave that bandage for two days or three, and then remove it and replace the plaster, leaving it to heal by itself until the wound is closed. Then cure with ointment until it heals."
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the manner of suture is that you join the solution of continuity with needles as we have explained in the suture of the belly, or join it with thread as you and others do.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVII
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	"Of the extraction of those causes that appear between the two lips in wounds."
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Very often it happens to many men that in wounds between their lips there appear hard abscesses like fat of hares, some small and others large.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore you should cut the lips and split each of those hardnesses on all sides, then make an incision in that place with tragacanth gum until the blood is stanched, and then wash it with vinegar and cure it with something astringent until it heals.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	"Of the incision of attached skin in the gums."
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	"It is often necessary to place a clamp on the attached gum tissue around the alveolus before incising it, so that you can retain its position and maintain traction during the incision, allowing blood to flow without clotting."
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	"And then place a pause (packing) on the wound with other powders, either stypitic or excitative."
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	"If that tissue returns, incise it again and cauterize it, because proper cautery will prevent its return."
Capitol .xxix.	"Chapter XXIX."
De razo de dentz am ferr.	"Regarding teeth with iron (fillings)."
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	"When on the surface of the teeth there are rough, hard, and sometimes black spots between the gums, which often cause corruption, allowing pus to escape between the gum and tooth, causing them to appear loose."
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	"And therefore you should cut through the cause of this between your hands and push it down into its place, and scrape off the hard spots on those teeth where such appearances are seen that they do not appear loose for any other reason. This is due to blackness and yellowness, and other discolorations."
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	"So if that is what you want at the beginning of this reason, well and good. Otherwise, you should repeat this reason over those again on another day and the second and third times until it comes to the last statement that you want."
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	"And know that teeth require different types of drills with various shapes and forms according to what is prepared for your operation."
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	"And therefore the drill with which a tooth is scraped at its outer surface is different from the drill used to scrape between teeth according to other forms. These forms of drills should be prepared by you, as you will see shortly:"
Capitol .xxx.	"Chapter XXX."
D’eradicacio de dentz.	"On the extraction of teeth."
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	"Though you treat the tooth for its pain with all art and diligence in its extraction, there is no reason why the sight should suffer when it is extracted, for it is a subtle substance that is freed from constraint by its extraction."
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	"When the patient is about to have that tooth extracted, you must be firmly certain which is the painful tooth; for often the pain seems to come from a healthy tooth and you extract one while the real source of pain remains until the truly diseased tooth is removed. We have seen this happen many times in dental operations."
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	"Therefore when you are certain which is the painful tooth and know it well, then you must carefully scrape around the tooth with a probe having some medicinal virtue until the gum is dissolved from the tooth completely parted; and then gently remove it with your fingers or delicate forceps little by little until that occurs."
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	"And then use strong tenaculum forceps for good grasp or extraction; carefully hold the head of the patient between your thumbs so that it does not move and thus extract the tooth straightly without breaking it, nor causing greater pain to the patient."
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	"And then, if it is not forgotten, take one of those instruments and insert it gently from both sides with ease and effort to move the tooth as it was done at first."
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	"But if the tooth is broken or decayed, then you must first fill that crack with wax and strengthen it at its end with a subtle thread so that it may not be injured during your constriction upon it with forceps."
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	"And you must work carefully with scraping around all sides of the gum and guard your strength so that you do not break it and injure the patient, returning upon him for more pain than the first pain of his."
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	"And beware that you do not do what many ignorant barbers commonly do in their haste and boldness regarding extraction, without administering anything we have recommended; for often they cause great illnesses upon people which are harder to treat than the tooth itself was to extract, and sometimes leave behind roots all broken off or some of those, or even remove teeth with pieces of jawbone as we have witnessed many times."
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	"And then for the extraction of it, let the mouth be washed with hot water containing salt or vinegar."
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	"And if there should be flows of blood thereby, as often happens, then take some quantity of sage and sprinkle it upon the wound; and if that sage does not suffice, then cauterize."
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	"The form of the forceps and delicate tenaculum with which the tooth is held at first should have a long extremity, short handle, and thick, so that they may not be bent when you use them."
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	"And they should be such that their inside is of sufficient thickness that when you grasp with them the tooth is not bent or broken at its end."
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	"And they should be made of wrought iron, with straight extremities, and on the extremities there should be teeth which fit into each other and grasp firmly for constriction; sometimes the extremities are shaped like the bill of a bird called the ciconia, that is, hook-shaped, and have strong grasping power."
Capitol .xxxi.	"Chapter XXIX."
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	"On the extraction of teeth and removal of broken jawbone pieces."
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When extraction of a tooth that is firmly embedded requires some cause,
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	"Their extremities are made smooth like lime or whetstone."
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	"And if you do not obey the examination with these forceps or tongs, then you must cut through the flesh and insert this tool called 'atali', which is a small lever whose shape is as follows:"
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	"And it should have a short, thick end that is not inserted to prevent pinching."
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	"Therefore, if the incision is forgotten, it will be good; otherwise, help yourself with these other tools, of which this is the shape of the first one: a triangular-pointed instrument with some thickness:"
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	"The shape of the second tool is that it should have a triangular point but be more delicate."
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	"And then you are helped with this tool which has two branches whose shape is approximately as follows:"
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	"And also help yourself with these tools that resemble large pins; for the sake of clarity, this tool is shaped like so:"
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	"with a triangular, bent or short tip, which has some thickness but should not be inserted to prevent pinching."
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	"And you should know that the tools for removing teeth are similar in shape to the other instruments mentioned before."
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	"But the skilled and subtle artist will find for himself according to what he understands about the operation and various diseases. For there are some diseases for which the ancients did not provide any specific instruments due to their varied forms."
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	"But if the bone of the mandible or other bones in the mouth are crushed or broken, then it should be carefully treated on that spot with whatever is convenient from the instruments and forceps mentioned earlier for the extraction of dental roots. Help yourself with this gesture whose shape is as follows:"
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	"And gently press it with some thickness little by little, and hold it tightly with the mouth so that it does not escape or flee until all the bone is removed. Then approximately restore the area with appropriate medications."
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"But if there is a small fracture in the bone, then remove that piece of the fracture and its darkness, and treat it until it heals."
Capitol .xxxii.	"Chapter XXXII."
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	"Of the care of prominent teeth above the others."
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth protrude unnaturally beyond their natural course and form, especially in women, and more so in venerable elderly women; therefore you should consider: if the tooth is not adjacent to another tooth, and it is impossible to straighten or align it with thread, then that tooth should be extracted. But if it is attached to another tooth, then cut that one with this instrument whose shape resembles a pig's bristle, made of Indian iron with an extremely sharp tip.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And if your incision is not deep enough that you can cut that tooth out in three days due to its hardness, and do not touch any other teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it's an erupted tooth that needs filing down, then file it with this Indian iron file whose shape is like this:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And all of it is made of fine Indian iron; and it has many short sharp points like this file with which teeth are slowly filed little by little over several days with ease, without touching or harming any other teeth.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And finally, smooth out the tooth at its end with these little scissors.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if it's a tooth with one corner broken off that cuts the tongue, then you must grind down that edge until its sharpness is smoothed and blunted, so that the tongue does not get cut and speech is not impaired.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Concerning the restoration of broken teeth with gold or silver foil.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When toothache occurs due to concussion and dislocation from a blow or fall, and the patient cannot swallow food, and you have treated them with medicinal astringents, but your treatment has not been effective, then those who are strangled by gold thread and not silver may be strengthened, for silver becomes green and soon purtefies within these few days, but gold is never changed.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And let the thread be of such fineness and thickness according to the amount that can fit between the teeth; and the manner of tying is as follows: take the thread, and take twice its length between two healthy teeth, and precisely when you have made two twistings of the thread between two molars, or one or more if necessary, until the thread reaches a healthy tooth on the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And repeat the tying within the same partition where you began, and strengthen your hand with facility and skill until it is not loose.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your tying be such that when you tighten the thread, you do not displace the roots of the teeth.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And then cut off the excess ends of the thread with forceps or scissors, and gather them up in each place with gestures, and turn them back and hide them between the healthy tooth and the loose tooth, so that they do not cause injury to the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then leave it like this for three days.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it becomes loose or breaks, strengthen that one or those with another thread in the same manner at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the rectification of two healthy teeth and two loose teeth, as seen in these tied ones:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when it happens that a tooth or two return to their proper places, and are repositioned as we have described, and remain stable.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And this is not done by anyone except skilled and wise artisans.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes it is appropriate to use bones from cattle for this purpose, and they are made in the shape of teeth, and placed in the location where the tooth has failed, and tightened as we have said, and remain and serve for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter XXXIV
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of cutting the thread which comes into the tongue and obstructs speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament which comes from near the tongue sometimes is natural with which people are born, or it occurs accidentally due to plaque that has already become consolidated.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation in this case is that someone lifts the patient's mouth open with their head held in place, and elevates their tongue, and then cuts that nerve ligament along its length until the tongue is released from its restraint.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is hardness or resistance in that place, and this is due to the consolidation of plaque, then you should use forceps and cut through it along its length until you have incised the ligament and dissolved the resistance.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful that there is not made a fissure in the front of the flesh, and do not cut carelessly so that blood flows excessively.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then wash the wound of the incision with warm water or strong vinegar or hot water and oil, and then place a lint bandage near the tongue; this is the method that the patient should follow every night so that it does not become consolidated again.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if bleeding occurs, apply powdered vitriol over the place; but if the bleeding continues, then cauterize the place with a silver caustic which is suitable for this purpose.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	"Chapter XXXV."
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Removal of a mucocele from the tongue
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes, an accumulation of fluid resembling a small tumor forms on the tongue, preventing it from functioning naturally, and causing difficulty in speaking.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation is as follows: have the patient sit facing the sunlight and examine the tumor.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	If you find that it is of dark or black color, hard, and the patient feels no pain, then do not touch it for it is cancerous.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	But if it is white or translucent, indicating that it contains fluid, then insert the curette into it, incise the mucous membrane around it, and excise it completely. If bleeding occurs during the procedure, pause briefly to allow for coagulation, using vinegar if necessary to facilitate hemostasis.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then return to your work until it is completely healed with a smooth surface. It should be washed with vinegar and salt water daily, and dressed with the usual cure until healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter XXXVI
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	On the extraction of tumors from the ears, those found in the throat, and other kinds of tumors.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When a tumor appears in the throat, it is called a gland, which may be formed from adipose tissue. If it grows externally and is named "double ear," if this tumor does not heal after being treated with water as previously described, and if it is hard, dark-colored, and causes little pain, then do not touch it with an iron instrument.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	If it is of rough color and the root is thick, then do not touch that with iron for the flow of blood; rather wait until it has matured, and then you will either draw it out or it will break on its own.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	If it is of white color, round, and the root of it is subtle, then that is what ought to be incised.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And in operating on it, before your operation, consider whether the aposteme has already rested and completed its growth or if it has diminished somewhat; and then have the patient lie down facing the sun, with their head towards the east, open their mouth wide, and the servant holding between their hands press the tongue of the patient away with a noble instrument of which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or of bronze, subtle and sharp like a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Therefore, when you press with that the tongue and it is revealed to you, then cut upon it quickly with the tincture of the east, and then take fire and place that in the middle of it, and draw it out at its partitions outside as much as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And afterwards, when you have drawn out some of the tunics, then promptly incise that with the instrument of which this is the form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	And it resembles forceps, but its extremities are curved so that the sharpness of each is turned towards the other, very sharp, made of iron inserted within.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not available to you, then incise it with a scalpel of which this is the form: And it should be sharp on one side and not sharp on the other.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And after you have incised one vein, then incise the other in the same manner of incision, and promptly wash the wound with water squeezed through a cloth
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if blood flows out, then wash it with water from a decoction of figwort or myrrh leaves, and similar to those of the styptics, so that the flow of blood is stopped, and then dress it until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes it happens that other apostemes appear around those two ears, and incise them in the manner which I have told you regarding the incision of two veins equally.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I once treated a woman with an aposteme that had appeared in her throat, which was dark in color and insensitive, and had closed up her throat, so that she breathed with difficulty, and food and drink had been prohibited to her, and she had come near to death if more time had passed for one or two days.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the aposteme had already grown so much that it had formed two lumps, each of which issued forth through two ducts.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	"You extracted it with a tweezer and placed it in one of their sores, pulling out quite a large portion. Then you cut off the part where it was connected to the other tumor, and then you tied its mouth shut and pressed its tongue down. Then you left the sore in that abscess."
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	"And you removed a large part of it, from which only a little blood flowed."
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	"So the ulcer of that woman was healed soon after she began drinking water and eating. Then I often cut into that abscess for a long time without it healing, but instead it grew bigger."
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	"So you took a needle and cauterized the ulcer. Then you added more medicine to it. But you wandered around and did not know what God had done for me."
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter XXXVII
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	**Of Incising a Swelling When It Becomes Abscessed.**
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When phlegm descends to the humors and is thick and long, then it is called perpendicular; and if it is at the beginning thick and round, then it is called bubo.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is cured with what we have said in the division, and your treatment does not confirm it, and also sometimes even when an abscess has been cauterized and it is already open and subtil, then you should insert that which is aggregated roundly; and if it is to that length, and it is sanguineous, of dark color or black, and there is no feeling in it, then you should examine the incision of it, for in that case there is fear about the patient's condition.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you find that according to the manner which I have described of its whiteness and length, then you should make the patient lie down and press the tongue of it with an instrument whose shape is appropriate for it, and place your finger on the new opening, and draw that downwards and incise it with one of two instruments which are mentioned in the incision of two melons.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And you should not incise it unless that is adapted to its natural term without addition, for if you incise too much of it, you will impair its speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And at the incision, use that which we have recommended in the incision of two melons, and cure it within so that it may be healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is frightened by the incision of it, then you should use a cautery in its cauterization without fear, and the manner of cauterizing it is not but with hot water, and this is what you should do: pause the head of the patient on his chest, and press the tongue of it with the instrument which we have mentioned, and take some of that water which we have said in the chapter of cauterization, and apply it with that fire, and place it neither thick nor subtil, and with that fill the concavity of the instrument whose shape is this:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the extremity of that concavity in which the medicine is placed be thus as the concavity of a spoon of ray, and place the instrument with the medicine over the wound, and let the patient lie upon his side so that saliva or mucus from the mouth of it may not fall into the interior through the intrusive medicine, lest it should descend into its throat.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then place your hand on the medicine, and press it upon the uvula for the space of half an hour until you see that it is blackened and sedated by the biting of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take cotton and wrap it around the extremity of the ray, and immerse the cotton in the medicine, and insert the ray with the cotton into a cannula above until the cotton adheres to that cannula, and do this many times until you achieve what you want from the cauterization of the uvula, and then leave it alone for three or four days until it dries up and falls off.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you should need to repeat the medicine, then repeat it, and afterward cauterize around the uvula with cotton dipped in borax, and cleanse it with that of what is around it from the medicine, and wash it with warm water, and afterwards cure it abroad with embrocation, and then keep it at rest until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of cure is more safe than incision, and also longer lasting without fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is cured with something more subtle than cautery and incision, for it is cured by sublimation in this manner: take calamint, hyssop, origanum, rue, saffron arabic, chamomile, betony, and similar herbs of those kinds, and adjust all those causes, or some of them, in a mortar, and let them be moistened with sour wine, and boil them; and let the mortar be well beaten with good lime, and let there be in the middle of the mortar a tube, upon which is placed a concave instrument of silver or brass thus made:
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And let the extremity be inserted into the mouth of the patient so that the vapor may reach the uvula upon the uvula until the uvula is much obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	Guessed translation:
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	"However, if you do not have this instrument present, then take a reed and attach at its end a piece of hot coal, so that the patient's mouth is warmed, for the heat of the coal prevents the mouth from burning."
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	"And this cure is good for health."
Capitol .xxxviii.	"Chapter XXXVI."
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	"Of the removal of splinters and other things adhering in the eye, and of other causes."
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	"Many times a fly or thorn or some other thing adheres to the eye."
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	"Therefore you should remove that which is visible among those [things], on which the gaze falls, because as you press your tongue against the instrument before the sun, it will be declared to you what is in the eye."
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	"And that which is not apparent and is hidden in the eye, you should make the patient vomit before food has been digested in the stomach, because very often the cause annexed to the eye will be forgotten through vomiting; or the patient could swallow a piece of dough or of fig leaf or a mouthful of dry bread; or he could take a piece of dried sea sponge and tie it strongly with flax, and appropriate it to the patient's forehead, for as soon as it arrives at the place in which the thorns are extracted, they will be forgotten."
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	"And more, take an eel and tie it with flax, and put it inside the bed, and suddenly extract it; or take a pot and suddenly put it on [the eye], and suddenly remove it."
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	"And more if they are not forgotten through those causes which we have said, then use an instrument of lead in this way:"
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	"And it should be thicker than a little finger, and at the end of it there should be concavity which you will insert into his eye with ease."
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	"And hold his head raised up, and make sure that the contact of his forehead with his throat does not happen, so that it could go into him and with that which causes the bone or the spine, or that which the physician puts in with his hand."
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	"But however that the patient himself inserts it better, by his knowledge of the place of the annexed cause and pushes it downwards, and pulls his hand with the instrument upwards, all this according to the quantity which is prepared inside him until it is forgotten."
Capitol .xxxix.	"Chapter XXXIX."
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	"Regarding the extraction of blood from the groin area."
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	"When applying the leech as mentioned in the division of cure with medicines and it does not improve, consider the time when it is applied to the patient's groin area, for you have prepared the tongue of the leech using the instrument that was recommended."
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	"If you wish to use the bloodletting leech, extract it gently or with subtle movements accordingly."
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	"And if it is not possible to extract with that, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the patient's groin area, and properly place within the concavity of the cannula an ignited iron, and do this several times (until the leech is dead and removed from the groin area), abstain from giving the patient water all day."
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	"Then take a vial full of water that has been warmed, and place its mouth over there, wash the mouth with it; do not let any leak from that and keep changing the water an hour at a time in your hand, for the leech immediately feels the water."
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	"But if it is not forgotten as mentioned earlier, then fumigate the patient with cummin or asafetida using the instrument that was recommended in the fumigation of the uvula."
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	"Do this, so that it may be effective."
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	"And this is another method of operation in fumigation of that area: you should take an earthenware vessel containing burning coals and cover the vessel with a lid having a hole in the middle, and place the end of the instrument through that hole; then perform the fumigation from above; and have the patient place their mouth over the end of the cannula, closing their mouth so that the fumigation is not lost until you know that the fumigation has reached the leech, for the leech will immediately fall."
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	"And if it does not fall, then you should repeat the fumigation many times, and prevent the patient from drinking water, and let them eat salted foods and almonds, and do not let them drink water; and thus it is necessary that with this regimen one should be forgetful."
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	"And this is the shape of the instrument with which one draws out a leech from the groin area when it can be seen: and it resembles forceps like these, except that it has some curvature:"
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	"which is placed on the groin area, and its end resembles the beak of an ibis bird, which is broad, in which a file has been sharpened, for when it seizes something it does not let go."
Capitol .xl.	"Chapter XL."
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	"In this chapter is the summary of the sermon on the treatment of apostemes and their incision."
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	"Apostumes are many species with many methods, according to what is remembered about them in this book, each one being described here:"
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	"And they are different in their puncture and incision methods due to two ways: one is for the species of deep apostemes; and by what is gained from humidity."
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	"And the second way is according to the places where accidents occur in the body, for the aposteme that occurs on the head is different from the one that occurs on the buttocks; and the aposteme that occurs on a fatty location is different from the one that occurs at a joint; and each of them has its own treatment through operation."
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	"And more about apostemes: some should not be punctured but rather waited until maturity or completion of them in those areas:"
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	"There are other apostemes which should be drawn out when they are hard and not mature according to their completion, such as apostemes near joints, for when an aposteme is near a joint its essence extends into what is around it, and often the ligaments or nerves of that joint are corrupted by it, causing contraction of that limb; or if it is near a main limb, if you delay its puncture until it is fully matured it may harm the main limb; or if it is near the buttocks, then pierce it immaturely; and do not pierce one that is hard due to undigested matter unless it is near the buttocks, for fear of tearing the skin of it and extending it towards the inside of the buttocks, causing a fistula."
