Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	"But you should know the time of puncturing an aposteme, which is when it has matured:"
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	"And it is matured when there is cessation of pain and fever, and around the decrease in redness and pulsation, and the sharpness of the head of the aposteme, and other signs."
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	"And because you should know that puncturing should be done where there is least pus: far from the aposteme and coming from its peak."
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	"And puncturing should always be done along the length of flesh or skin if apostemes are in areas such as those around the breast or feet, and at locations of muscles, nerves, arteries; and, finally, in all places except where there is reflection; for those that are reflected use puncture according to that limb."
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	"But when an aposteme is in a fatty location, it is better to leave its puncture until digestion of it has been confirmed according to its completion, as we have said; for if you pierce it before that time the skin of the hole will be extended and much matter will accumulate, and often the lips of the hole will become hardened and its depth increased."
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	"But some apostemes are punctured across the width of flesh or skin due to necessity, or according to what is necessary for that limb."
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	"And you should administer a small puncture, and in large apostemes make a large puncture and wide or many incisions according to the diversity of their size."
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	"And others are apostemes in which it is necessary to make the chain concave and cut it when it has been completed as if it were bread, and done so that it may already stick, such as those that occur in tubercle and buboes."
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	"And of those that are incised with three angles in section; and of those in which it is cut like the figure of a mitre leaf, such as those of hermits."
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	"And among them are those to which round incision and crescent incision are administered, similar to those."
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	"But that one to which it is not applicable as with their superficial apostemes, you should pierce it with superficial or flat puncture alone."
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	"And when an aposteme is large and has already collected much matter, you should pierce it but not remove all the pus at that time; having removed some of it, bandage the aposteme overnight, and then on the following day remove a larger portion, and continue doing so gradually until it has healed."
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	"And especially if the patient is an infant or pregnant woman or child or elderly person in decline, for the animal spirit is often resolved with the exit of matter, and sometimes the patient dies, and you operate on them."
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	"Therefore guard this chapter with great care, and especially the puncture you make in these apostemes, for you should cleanse the wound and consider whether the wound of the aposteme is small or is a flat section; then you should administer the cautery to it or ancient caustic. And if the aposteme is large and the incisions of the puncture are many, then you should pause between each pull until they converge together."
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And if in the aposteme a portion of the chain is cut off or has been made concave around its circumference, then you should fill it with old cotton or thread made from linen cloth, like when you bake bread or cakes without moisture; and strengthen it on the third day; and then proceed with it and cure it with what is needed for the dressings until it heals."
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	If blood flow occurs during your operation, then you should administer warm water and vinegar mixed in a cloth, and place that over the area of blood flow many times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	If bleeding persists, then you should administer remedies and care as recommended in various places of this book and its division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	If it is wintertime and the location of the abscess has many nerves nearby, then you should mix powder in warm vinegar and oil, and place that on those locations.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is summertime and the locations are fleshy, then you should mix powder with water and oil or vinegar and oil, and keep that warm until the third day, as we have said, and then you should drain the abscess and cleanse it, administering to it whatever is appropriate for its healing.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the general knowledge of the treatment of abscesses, but according to the method of distinction, I have already mentioned in detail how each type of abscess should be treated in its own chapter.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XL.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the Incision of Abscesses Which Appear on the Neck
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the neck of young children, small abscesses form, which are like glands containing sacs that are made in this way; and their varieties are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And among them there are pimples, and those contain a moisture similar to slime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And those which contain moisture resembling dust also resemble them in this way; and those which are like stones, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	"I fear not the sectioning of all things, nor the extraction thereof; for I must do that which is neither harsh nor cruel."
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	"You must use an instrument shaped like this, called a 'tomes', so that you know what it contains."
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what it contains is humidity, then cut it lengthwise along the surface according to this form.
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	"And begin the section at line B, extending to line G. When the moisture has been evacuated, then peel away that which contains this moisture, leaving no cause for any recurrence of trouble."
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	"And immerse it in Egyptian pitch, if available, otherwise in water and salt. Fill that with the mixture and leave it for another day, as with this it will corrode all that remains of its surface."
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	"And again apply Egyptian pitch to that spot a second and third time if necessary, until you are confident that there is no remaining cause of its surface. Then heal the wound with ointment until it is healed."
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	"And if an abcess contains hard nodes, then cut it according to this form:"
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	"A section having the shape of a cross, and cut once between its two lips and scrape it clean from all sides, and exert your strength in removing the tunic which contains this."
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	"But if you encounter resistance with your scalpel, then do what I told you first."
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	"And similarly treat the carbuncle section and cure it according to what I have told you. The section of a carbuncle is easier because it has little blood and humidity."
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	"And sometimes some of these abscesses that are on the head in some men have no humidity at all. The cause is that once someone cut an abscess on the head of an old woman like a deaf stone, rough and white, which could not be opened, and if anyone were to hit it with something, it would injure him."
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	"But in other accidental abscesses on the head that are not like this one, such as those that occur on the heads of children and behind the ears, the section should be a surface section."
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	"And make the incision of these as low down on them as possible, so that it alleviates the body from the lower parts of the abscess."
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	"And apply the appropriate treatment to those according to what you consider suitable for cure."
Capitol .xlii.	"Chapter XLII."
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	"On sectioning scrofulas that occur on the neck."
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times these abscesses occur in the neck, in the armpits and in the groins; sometimes they also happen in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck are many and are generated between them, and all scrofula of these is within its own tunic, as also in the nodes and abscesses of the head, as we have said.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the types of these scrofula are many; for some are hard (lapideas), and others contain moisture, and some are malignant and do not respond to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore in that one which you feel to have good disposition upon touch, of which the color of that which is manifest is like the color of the skin (codena), and is smooth throughout, and is not annexed with the nerve of the neck, nor with the veins, nor with the artery, it is necessary that you incise it with a dry superficial cut from above to below on the line from G. to the line B., and remove all its skin, and extend the lips of the wound with forceps, or with several forceps if you have need of them, as we have said in the abscesses of the head, and extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more cautious that neither vein nor nerve be incised.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	"And if the wound is not moving, do not insert your hand into it lest you injure the patient and unnecessarily incise; for if you incise a vein or artery and hinder your operation, then apply powdered vitriol or other powders that stop bleeding, cleanse the wound, and allow that which causes inflammation to rest so that the pain may be mollified and begin to suppurate."
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	"When blood is absorbed."
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	"And then return to your operation until it is completed."
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	"Then inquire if there are any causes of the other small scrofulae, and if so, incise them and cleanse them."
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	"And if it is near a large vein, do not incise that scrofula at its root."
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	"Avoid cutting it with a doubled folded blade, and allow it to fall on its own without injury."
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	"And then fill the wound with softened cotton which you have already immersed in Egyptian ointment, and also treat it."
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	"And if you incise the whole scrofula, then it is necessary that you approximate the two lips of the wound and dress it immediately so that there remains no superfuility."
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	"But if there remains superfuility due to the size of the scrofula, then it is necessary that you incise the root of it, extract it, and administer suturing and whatever else is said."
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And those scrofulae that contain fluid, pierce them with a superficial perforation where it appears to you the location of maturity of it, and pause the perforation until it emits purulent matter from below the skin, as we have said."
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	"And then administer a dressing with ointment and similar substances, so that it may burn away what remains of the corruption."
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	"And when you see that the wound is already cleansed, then treat it with a ointment for generating flesh until it heals."
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XLIII
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the Incision of the Point of the Abscess Accidentally in the Groin
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients called this type of incision "epilhot," and there is no man known in our land who has performed it.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the speech of those people.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men with hip pain, it is necessary to avoid the extraction of the epilhot, because by doing so, all the veins and major vessels of the disease are opened.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have hard abscesses in the mouth or groin or ears, when the disease is not in the canal, it is necessary to perform an incision of the epilhot to avoid the damage that is caused by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want this, we should incise the epilhot around three or four circles of the epilhot's rings, or make a small incision across its width in that which is between two circles in quantity, so that the incision is made in bone, not cartilage. This location is convenient for an incision because it is devoid of flesh and the vessels of blood are distant from it.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the physician is fearful, then he should first extend the cord of the groin with a loop and then cut it so that it reaches the canal, but avoid the vessels of blood if one sees any cause for doing so.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then incise the hip bone as we have recommended, and it is indicated above the incision of the canal by the flap that has issued from there with what is of its disruption and by the absence of sound.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	Leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, once the hour has passed in which perforation is feared, join two lips of the cord of the wound, and sew it alone without cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that promote the growth of flesh until it heals.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the sum of the speech which we have recommended is this: that some of these abscesses have already closed off the groin of the disease, and the disease has come inside to cause death, and the breath of it is cut off, and some go to incise the epiglottis so that the diseased may breathe over the location of the wound for some breaths, and thus be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And therefore I command that the wound be left open until the mischief of the disease is consumed; and the mischief lasts for three days. And then I command that the wound be sewn up, and cared for until it heals.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And this is what I have seen myself: that a servant took a knife and stuck it in his groin and made an incision with it into a part of the canal of the lung, and I was called to care for him, and I heard him moan like one dying, and I uncovered the wound and removed the blood that had issued from it in small amounts.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I was convinced that he had not cut any vein or artery, and the wind issued from the wound. And I cared for it until it healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And nothing happened to the servant except that he lost his voice temporarily, and a few days later he returned to his usual state of health.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the section of the epiglottis there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	On incision over an abscess that occurs externally in the groin, and is called a groin hernia.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess called a groin hernia is a large abscess according to the color of the skin, and it is common in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it occurs in two ways: either naturally or accidentally.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	"In nature, it does not arise to cure."
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	"And the accidental is according to two methods: one is similar to fatty tumors, and the other method is similar to an abscess which occurs due to the clogging of an artery, and in this case there is fear."
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	"And it should not be presumed upon him with iron unless it is requested."
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And then you should press it and investigate it with the said iron, and if you find that it is similar to fatty tumors and there are no veins suspended in it, then you should cut into it like nodes, and extract what contains it from its skin and bursa; but if not, then you should carefully examine all of its being, and apply cure to the place according to what cure requires until it is healed."
Capitol .xlv.	"Chapter .xlv."
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	"Of the sectioning of kinds of tumors."
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	"There are many species of tumors, and I have already mentioned all the kinds of them in the division."
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	"And it is necessary that I explain thus the difference between a tumor and an ulcer so that there may be no doubt."
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	"So I say that in an ulcer there is heat and fever and violent pain until the boiling away of the superfeta is stopped; but it is completed putrefaction which then stops the fever, pain, and heat."
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	"But a tumor has neither heat nor fever nor pain, and contains that which produces phlegm in the lymph vessels or the proper sac."
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	"And according to the color of the body and the beginning of it is like a boil, and becomes like an empty sack, whether larger or smaller, and they are divided into two species: those that are fatty contain moisture; and the colors of the moisture are many, as I have said in the division."
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	"Therefore, when you come to the treatment of tumors, it is necessary that you investigate it at its beginning with an instrument called the trocar, according to what will be said about its shape in the following chapter."
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	"And the manner of investigating abscesses and all tumors is this: you should take this instrument and insert it into the moist place which you find in the abscess, and turn your said instrument around little by little until you know that it has penetrated the channel."
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	"And at last withdraw your hand according to the measure of the greatness of the abscess, and then remove the trocar and consider what has issued from it in its trace."
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	"And if there is a flow of moisture of whatever color, then you should cut into it with a superficial section according to what has been said about other abscesses."
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	"But if there is no moisture issuing from the trocar's trace, then know that it is fatty."
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	"And then cut across it with a cross-section having this form:"
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	"So as you have been shown, and suspend it with forceps, and carefully excise the channel from all parts, keeping the skin or sac if possible, and remove that tumor."
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	"But if it breaks during the operation, it is not possible to remove that tumor whole, and sometimes something remains there; therefore, you should remove what you can without leaving anything behind."
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	"For if anything remains there, little or much, the tumor will return again according to its nature."
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And if you find that some small part remains there, then fill the cavity with some sharp corrosive powders and sew up the wound, leaving a cauterizing plaster over that which sits upon the abscess; and cure it by the other method until it is healed."
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	"But if it is a large tumor, then cut both lips of it and cure it with what oozes out."
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	"But if there is pulsation, contrary or not, then tie and compress the place of the wound with threefold bandages which are moistened with treacle and leave it thus for two or three days until the wound closes and the ebullition of blood ceases; and then return to cutting into what remains of the tumor."

And you should choose these types of cups to be large, medium, and few in number, so that through those incisions blood flows quickly as needed, and later on when it is not medicine at first.

Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter XLVI
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the care of the breasts of men which are like those of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Sometimes the breasts of some men become enlarged and puffy with sleep, and they are inflamed, and their breasts resemble those of women, and we should bind them tightly.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And regarding that which is said above, it should be cut with a lunar section according to this shape from line B. to line G., and then remove all the thickness, and then fill in the wound with an ointment that encourages healing, and then sew together the two lips of the wound, and care for it until it heals.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast leans towards the sides and becomes softened by its size like that of women, then it should be cut in two on both sides upwards with two lunar sections, each containing the other at their ends so that the larger line contains the smaller according to this shape from line B. to line G. And then remove the cord which is between the two lips of the wound, and remove the excess flesh, and administer what has been said about suturing and powders as necessary for healing until it heals.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of that which ought to be cut due to restlessness of illness and bleeding, then you should fill in the wound with cotton soaked in corrosive oil and leave it until it has corroded what is removable from the thickness, and then care for it until it heals.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter XLVIII
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Of the perforation of boils that come from the armpits
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These boils that come from the armpits are of the kind called scrofula, hard ones, which contain a core that is removed.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And those that contain moisture; and those that contain moisture should be cut with a lunar section according to this shape: from line G. to line B. And when all the healthy matter has been evacuated from the boil, then fill it with black wool and leave it for another day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	"And then the wound should be covered and treated with an appropriate salve until it heals."
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	"And if the abscess is of the kind found in joints or on the skin, then you should incise it as we have said in the section about scrofula."

Capitol .xlix.	Chapter XLIX.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	About incising abscesses that occur from injury or by venesection
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery has burst and the vein that is above it becomes consolidated, then often an abscess occurs. And the signs by which it is known whether inflammation and abscess are due to the artery or the vein: for when an abscess is due to an artery it is elongated towards the front of the body; and when you press on the abscess with your fingers you feel a cracking noise.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	"And one that is due to a vein is round, near the surface of the body."
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	"And it is an error to make an incision regarding this abscess, especially those that are located on the hips, thighs, armpits, neck, and many other parts of the body; therefore its treatment with iron should be avoided. And those that are in the extremities or on the head should also be avoided."
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But concerning that which is due to inflammation of the sheath of the artery, make an incision in the vein along its length; then widen the incision with hooks and expose the artery itself, delivering it from its surrounding sheaths.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then take that needle and pierce it through to the other side; and twist the artery with a double thread in two places, — which will provide you an example of how to extract two arteries which are found on the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	"And then make a puncture with a spatula in the location between the two ligatures where blood has accumulated; this will cause the abscess to dissolve."
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	"And then apply treatment in which pus is generated between the ligatures so that they fall away; and also treat him with appropriate medicines until he is healed."
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	"And if the abscess is due to an incision of a vein, then you should take hold of it with your hand as much as possible; and then insert the needle on the side where you have held the abscess, and pierce it through. Then tie the thread in such a way that you extract it from the other side; and then ligate the abscess with good ligatures according to what I have taught you regarding the ligation of grapes of two parts with two ends of the thread."
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that the thread may come out, then insert the needle along with it on both sides of the abscess through the original incision of the needle; and twist your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	"And then close the abscess in its middle part so that when it has healed, you can then incise the superfluity of the vein, and leave what is tied."
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And then plaster it with powder that you have immersed in wine and oil, and apply hot fomentations and appropriate medicines until it is healed."
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 1 of the abscess which occurs from twisting of nerves
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as an abscess occurs in the artery and vein, so too does an abscess occur in the nerves when they are subjected to percussion or excessive movement, and for similar reasons.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And such abscesses most often occur in the locations of the elbows or ankles, or in any place where joints are moved with violence.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And if the abscess is large, it resembles the color of the rest of the body; it is hard and tense, without its usual flexibility, and when pressed with violence, there is a sensation like stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And if the abscess is not situated on the chest, it is near the vein; it is moved at any part and does not move toward its front or back.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, those that are located in the joints should not be bandaged with iron, lest it cause contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But one that is on the head or forehead may be opened with a spatula.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, then treat it with cold compresses and incise it with razors.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if it is large, then suspend it with a bandage, scrape it off, and remove it; then sew it up with stitches, and treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 2
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Of the incision of an abscess that occurs from a cut on the belly
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	There are certain people who see in the bellies of others and other parts of their bodies things that resemble those with fungi, which have a subtle root and a large head; they also have lips that are inverted, and these are small or greatly enlarged.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I myself have seen one such case in which there were two growths resembling fungi on his belly, and they had no difference between them; both were white with small roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips of those were inverted and split open, from which moisture flowed constantly.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, I incised them and removed one weighing eighteen ounces and the other weighing six ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	Therefore, when performing the incision of such abscesses, consider first whether the inflammation is moist. If the color of the skin is white and moist with a subtle root, then incise it with a wide spatula that has been heated in fire, for much blood may flow during the sectioning; cauterize if any blood flows.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	But if the inflammation is painful and fearful, beware of incising with iron. Instead, take a fresh lead thread made from the kind we have described, twist it around the abscess, and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Then adjust the lead thread at its tightest point; continue twisting the lead around it until it has been separated and fallen off by itself without any manipulation.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the root is thick, there may be some cause for fear and anxiety during its incision, especially one that is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible to incise most of it, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then treat it until the wound has healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	Beware that you do not attempt to incise a growth that is dark in color, insensitive to touch, and regularly recurring, for it is cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I remember this regarding cancer.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of the treatment of umbilical hernia
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	An umbilical hernia is caused by various factors: fissures of the skin over the belly, or a prolapse of the intestine or bowel through other ruptures; blood flowing from a vein or artery as mentioned earlier; or constricted flatulence in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is due to a skin fissure and prolapse of the intestine, then the color of the abscess will resemble that of the body; there will be no pain, and it will appear in various positions.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	But if it is due to prolapse of the bowel, then its position will be as we have described earlier with great variation. When you press it with your fingers, it will disappear and then return; there will be a loud noise, and it will become greatly enlarged during bathing and vigorous exercise.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is due to moisture, then there will be no noise and it will not disappear or become hidden when you press it with your hand; nor will it be constricted or enlarged.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	If it is due to blood, then appear these signs: the abscess turns black.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	However, if it is due to flesh without blood, then it becomes a hard, large and tough abscess, which grows in size.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it's due to windiness, then its touch is light.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation in this case is to consider whether the prominence of the navel is due to arterial blood, venous blood, or windiness; therefore you should be prohibited from treating it, because there is fear and awe as I have taught you in the chapter where I spoke about arterial and venous abscesses.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the prominence of the navel is due to bowel or tissue, then you should command the patient to keep their elbows by their sides and stand extended. Then, sign with a tent around the entire navel, and then command them to lean back between your thighs but above your two knees, and then encircle around the navel with a wide spatula on the area where you have indicated with the tent. Then extend the mass of the abscess upwards with a large unguent; and finally, ligature around it with strong flax or cotton, using an appropriate tying manner.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then carefully press the middle of the extended abscess towards the cord and insert your finger into that opening, seeking the bowel. And if you have found it and grasped it with the cord, then gently pull it outwards and push it back inside the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	"And if you've exposed the tissue, then take that with oil; and incise its excesses."
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	"But if it's opposed to your artery or vein, then encircle that spot and return to your operation; take two needles and place them in those strong threads, inserting the needles into the circle you've made around the abscess in a cross-like manner, penetrate them; and then stretch the abscess in four directions over the needles."
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And if you wish, remove the needles and let the wound close up on its own; or cut it open once it has healed and become subtle, then dress it with oil as necessary until it is fully healed."
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	"And if the prominence of the navel is made of raw flesh or due to dampness, then you must remove the abscess as we have said and drain out the blood or dampness that you find there, and then dress it with oil until it is consolidated."
Capitol .liii.	Chapter LIII
De curacio de cranc.	Of the treatment of cancer.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already spoken in the division of kinds of cancer and how it can be treated with medicines, and that surgery with iron is avoided because it could cause an ulcer; we have also said that cancer generated in the larger vein or artery is difficult to cure.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancient authorities said that sometimes cancer can be found in places where its removal is possible, such as cancer of the breast or scrotum and similar locations on the limbs, especially when it begins small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when cancer is advanced and deep-seated, it is not advisable to approach it, because I have never seen anyone healed of that kind nor heard of another case.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation for this kind of cancer is as follows: first excise the malignant tissue and purge with black collyrium several times, then cauterize it if there is a manifest tumor.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then prepare the patient for surgery in that location, and afterwards sew up the wound with stitches as necessary. Also cut out everything around it with a good excision so that there is no remaining cause of recurrence.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow out, and do not bind it lightly, squeeze the parts, and wipe away all thick blood with your hand or an instrument that is available to you among the instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if you encounter a lot of thick blood during the incision of a vein or artery, then cauterize it immediately until the flow of blood stops, and then treat it with the other treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter LIV
De curacio de ydropici.	Of the treatment of dropsy.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already discussed in the division the kinds of dropsy and their symptoms, as well as how to treat it with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that which is treated by surgery is only the condition of ascites alone, and it should not be approached surgically in cases of tympanites or hydrothorax because these are fatal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have treated tympanites with medicines but do not see any improvement, then consider whether the patient has become weak from another illness or has another kind of dropsy, such as in cases of coughing or abdominal pain, and do not treat it surgically because there is great danger involved.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if the patient is strong and healthy, and the only illness present is tympanites alone, not in infancy or old age, then the method of surgery for it is as follows: raise the patient between your hands, and have an assistant press the abdomen with their hand below the ribs on the left side, expelling the water through the opening in the peritoneum, and then take a spine-covered spatula in this manner:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	"Let it be of double-edged sharpness, long at its pointed end like a spade; yet let it have some slight shortening here and there, so that in the operation with it one does not enter too deeply into the intestine."
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	"And consider whether the generation of dropsy comes from the bowels, because now you should extend the section through the navel for about three fingerbreadths on the right side over the bladder."
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	"But if the generation of dropsy is due to illness of the liver, then your section should be on the left side of the navel for three fingerbreadths."
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	"And if the generation of it is because of the womb, then your section should be on the right side."
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	"And do not let your section be over the side where you want to make the opening, lest the superfluities run to that place."
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	"And then carefully perforate the entire cord with the instrument and enter that section, elevating your hand with the spade between the cord and the bladder, and you shall cut through it; if the amount is like a fingernail or less."
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	"And then carefully perforate the bladder so that the spade reaches the desired place, which is the location of the water."
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	"And then extract it and insert an instrument whose shape is as follows:"
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	"And it is like a thin silver cannula; it is made of silver or iron or laton lion, at the lower end of which there is a small hole, and on its sides there are three holes: two on one side and one on the other side; and its tip is cut obliquely in the manner of a feather, like this:"
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	"And at the upper end of it there is an armilla, for when the instrument reaches the water, then immediately let that fall onto the instrument, so that you evacuate from it as much water in half an hour as is necessary, for if you evacuate more than is necessary in that hour, it causes sudden death due to resolution of its animal spirit, or five days before death approaches."
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	"But evacuate from it according to the quantity of its virtue, and according to what you understand about the conditions of the illness and the strength of the pulse and its goodness."
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	"And then extract the instrument and retain the water that is held by the cord which retains the hole that you have made on the bladder according to what I have taught you."
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	"And then repeat the procedure on another day if the illness is tolerating it, and extract a small quantity of water each time, doing so for several days with caution, and make sure that not too much water remains."
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	"But if you fear for the illness and allow too much water to escape, then cure it with a burial in hot ashes, and apply a lot of dry suet in a bath, and expose it to the sun for a long time; and cure it with drying medications until it is healed."
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	"And cauterize the stomach and the mesentery around the location of water extraction, according to what I have previously described."
Capitol .lv.	Chapter LIV
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	"Concerning the cure for children born with unperforated openings of urine."
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes, some children are born from their mother's womb with the head of their mixture not pierced (or too tight or not in its place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore, carefully cut into it immediately after birth with a sharp knife according to this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then pause in the tight spot with a thin lead awl and tie it up, and leave it for three days or four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when they want to urinate, move them away and let them relieve themselves; then return that one (to its position).
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not use lead, it is possible that the urine which falls on this place will not close it.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	But that one whose opening is too tight should be treated with lead awl as we have said for several days until it becomes wider.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	But those in which the opening is not in its proper place should be led away, because some of them are born with the head of the penis at the end for which they cannot urinate except by lifting the penis with their hand above; and this is not due to their generation, because the sperm cannot reach the mother according to nature, and it is a serious illness.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the manner of operation in this case is that the sick one should be placed on his back, and then extend the head of the penis with your left hand with great force, and cut off the tip of the glans penis at the opening of the urethra with a sharp knife, as if cutting through paper, taking care not to cut any other part, so that the middle of the penis resembles the head of the penis and the opening falls into its proper place according to what is appropriate.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And beware in your operation of a flow of blood, because many times this happens; and stop the bleeding with whatever you cut off the blood, and cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter LVI
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of whiteness which occurs in the foreskin on the head of the penis, and of roughness, blackness, and adherence of the foreskin to the head of the penis.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	This whiteness often occurs on the penis and is a raised flesh growth.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And among them one is malignant and another is not malignant.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	Then take a subtle hook and suspense it carefully, cutting the diseased part completely. Immediately afterwards, apply pressure on that area with your fingers in the Egyptian manner. Then cure the wound with clean linen until healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if it is malignant and of a black color, then you must apply cauterization immediately to the incision and its root.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.
