E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	"And know that some stones have angles or margins which make their extraction difficult because of this."
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	"And of those things one seems like a glans and is round, and it is done with light extraction."
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	"Therefore if that one has angles or margins, adjust it in the opening."
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	"And if it is not thus forgotten, then you must press down upon it with your hand or press it gently down with a gesture like this: the end of which should be like a file with which you press on the stone, and do not let it escape from there; or insert into it that thin curved instrument."
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	"But if you cannot press upon it, then widen the opening a little, and if you see blood flowing, cut into it strongly with powdered vitriol."
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	"But if there are more than one stone, then at the beginning you insert your hand into the mouth of the bladder and cut upon it; and immediately afterwards insert a little further into that place; and similarly do this if there are many more."
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	"And if there is a very large stone, then it is not known that you should cut into it with a large incision, because one of two things happens to the patient: either he dies or he suffers from continuous distillation of urine afterwards, because the place is not completely consolidated."
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	"But the minister performs the expulsion of it from there which has been forgotten, or presses down on its fracture with forceps until that one comes out in pieces."
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	"Therefore when you have completed your operation, then fill the wound with threads of aloe and dragon's blood and stitch it up."
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	"And place on that a cloth dipped in olive oil and wine or in sweet olive oil rubbed with water, so that the wound may heal without inflammation."
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	"And then let the patient lie on his back for three days without removing the stitches."
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	"And when that has been removed, wash the place with water and much olive oil, and then dress it with fine ointment and diabaic ointment until it is healed."
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	"But if inflammation and corrosion happen in the wound, which is hard and destructive, like that which seems as if blood were congealed in the bladder, and because of this urine is forbidden (and this is known by the exit of blood with urine), then insert your finger into the wound and remove that blood, for if it remains it provokes corrosion of the bladder and its decay."
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And then wash the wound with sour wine, water and salt, and apply anything that is suitable for healing wounds until it is healed."
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	"And you must lie quietly during all of the healing time with both legs elevated and adjust the dressings which are placed on the place."
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And if the stone is small and is in the middle of the urethra and has been inserted into it, and urine cannot be excreted, then treat it with what I have mentioned before that you should do to avoid sectioning, because many people are cured by this treatment without any section being made; and here it is how you should take a small awl-shaped probe of iron, the shape of which is like this:"
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	"with a triangular end, sharp-pointed, fitted into wood."
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	"And then take some wax and apply it with that to the urethra from below the stone so that it does not return to the bladder."
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	"And then insert the iron into the urethra, gently perforating until the probe reaches that stone."
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	"And then slowly rotate the probe with your hand on that stone and push it through until you pierce it from the other side, because urine will be released immediately."
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	"And then press your hand on that which remains of the stone from its exit from the urethra, because that is broken and forgotten with urine, and the patient is healed."
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	"But if this treatment does not suit you for any reason that prevents it, then apply wax below the stone and also above it."
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	"And then tie two ligatures around the urethra on either side of the stone:"
E aprop extratz aquela.	"And then remove that."
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	"And then untie the ligature and wash away the congealed blood, which has formed in the wound."
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	"And there is no need for sutures on the kidney stone, unless it returns to the bladder. The other suture above it is needed because when the ligature around the ureteral opening is released, the ureter slips back into place and closes the wound."
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	"And therefore, when you tie the suture above, it is necessary that you elevate the ureter towards its opening above or else you must complete your task and close the wound as we have said."
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter .lxvi
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	Of the removal of kidney stones from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Kidney stones in women are rarely formed.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	If a stone appears in one of these [parts], then its cure is difficult and forbidden by many methods.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	Another one of them is when the woman strongly resists being opened.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second one is that you may not find a woman who knows how to tell if she would willingly submit herself to the doctor when she is chaste, or is among married women.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third one is that you may not find a woman who knows this art well, especially the operation with the male organ.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth one is that the location of the section for removing a stone in women is far from the location of the stone itself, requiring a deeper section, and causing fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity forces you to do this, then it is necessary that you take a woman who knows well how to perform a female circumcision and is little frightened.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you are deprived of such a woman, then seek out a male doctor who is skilled and subtle, or present a mature woman who is experienced in the affairs of women, or a woman who has some experience in this art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Therefore have such a woman present, and command her to do everything that you order from the examination of the stone at the beginning; one reason for this is to determine whether the woman is a virgin, in which case she should insert her finger into the woman's vagina and try to find the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Therefore if she finds it, then command her to withdraw her finger, and afterwards have her insert a speculum over that area.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not a virgin, then command the midwife to insert her finger into the woman's vagina and search for the stone, since she will place her left hand on the bladder, and compress it with good pressure.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Therefore if she finds it, then gradually move the speculum from the opening of the bladder to the sides with the help of her strength until you reach the root of the matter.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And appropriately insert the speculum into that position of the mouth of the bladder where you found it and stopped, and keep her finger on the stone until it is removed from there.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And let the incision be small at first. Then insert your knife into that section and if you feel the stone, adjust the size of the incision according to how much of the stone you know will be removed from there.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that stones are varied in their shapes: some are small and round, some are large and sharp, others are long and round, and some have branches.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore you should know what kind of stone it is based on what you can feel through the incision about what you want to do.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see flow of blood, adjust the position to the side of the vessel and leave it for an hour until the blood is absorbed, then return to your operation until the stone is removed.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And make sure you have ready all the instruments mentioned in this book regarding the extraction of stones in men, so that you may be assisted by them during your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see a flow of blood and know that the expulsion of blood is from the artery that has been incised, then apply powder over the area and strangulate it with lint and strict ligature, but do not repeat this; leave the stone there and do not try to remove it, for otherwise the woman will surely die.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then dress the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	Therefore when the sharpness of the bleeding has ceased after several days and the area is healed, then you may return to your operation until the stone is removed.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter LXII
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Concerning incision for incarcerated hernia.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	Hernia occurs when there's excess moisture in the white coat that leaves the groin of the genitalia containing the eggs.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	Sometimes it occurs in the proper peritoneum that Nature has prepared at the time of childbirth between one egg and another, which is the groin between the white coat we've mentioned, and it's nothing but a mistake.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	The cause of this hernia is weakness that occurs in the groins due to which this matter escapes from them, and sometimes it happens due to a sudden blow on the genitals.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	This moisture has various colors. Sometimes it tends towards citrine or sanguineous red, or dark brown, or is blackish-yellow, or watery-white; and this is what happens most often.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	The signs by which one knows where this accumulation of water is located are these: if it's in the white coat we've mentioned, then the swelling appears leaning slightly towards length like an egg shape, and the groin is visible because the moisture contains that area entirely.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	If the moisture is in the proper peritoneum, then the swelling appears divided like an egg and for this reason people estimate that it's another egg.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the moisture is between the cord of the genitals and the white coat, then one should cut there.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And if you want to know the color of the moisture, then press the color of the moisture in the swelling with an empty cupping glass whose shape is described here; and according to what appears in the mark of the emptiness, judge what is inside it.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	Therefore, when we come to the treatment of this with iron, then it's necessary that we command the patient to cough if possible, and press the body of the swelling full.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And also let him lie on his back upon some slight elevation, and then cover the swollen parts with cloths.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And then sit yourself on the left side of him and command the assistant to be on his right side. The latter shall extend his hand towards one or two fingers' breadth from the cord of the genitals and the boundary of the navel of the belly.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And then take a broad knife and cut the cord of the genitals from its middle lengthwise, close to the penis.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And let the section be made according to a straight line equidistant from the skin of the genitals, until it reaches the white coat containing.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And strip that off, and observe, and take care that you do not incise it; and your stripping should be done in such a way that it hangs with the egg more subtly and carefully stripped according to the quantity possible for you.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	And then pierce the full coat of water with a wide perforation and remove all the water.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	And then separate between the two lips of the section with forceps and extend the coat at its upper parts. Do not touch the cord containing the genitals and cut the coat in this manner as is possible for you.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	Cut that completely or in pieces and especially its sides subtly, because if you do not examine the incision of it carefully, there is no guarantee that the water will not return.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	But if the egg proceeds from that outside its cord during the time of your operation, then when you have completed the section of the coat, return inside it and immediately join together the two lips of the cord of the genitals with suture, and also treat it like other wounds until it is healed.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	And if you find the egg corrupted by other disease, then it's necessary that you loosen the vessels which are near the suspenders and remove the egg. Then treat it with what we have said.
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	But if water accumulates in two places separately, then know that there are two hernias. Therefore cut that section according to what you have done on the other side, and if it appears to be an operation, then do it.
E aprop tu abstergiys le sanc, e entramet en las seccios lana submersa en oli o en oli rozat; e pausa deforo autra lana la qual tu as submersa en vi e oli, e expandeys aquela sobre dos genetius e·l mirac del ventre; e pausa desobre draps doblatz e pulvils, e lia aquels desobre am liament le qual es segon aquesta forma:	And then you shall clean the blood and enter into the sections with wool submerged in oil or rose oil. And put outside other wool which you have submerged in wine and oil, and spread it over both genitals and the navel of the belly. Then place doubled cloths and powders on top, and bind those with a bandage according to this manner:
e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas.	And then take two cloths and fill them with carded wool in this manner. And make the ends of those with which it is pressed from cotton or wet wool, and attach them together with a string in the breeches of the breeches. And one end should take the buttocks inside to outside, and the second should take at the navel, and two extremities over both thighs, and other two extremities over both hips, and all tightening should be adjusted in the breeches of the breeches.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta hernia es medicada artificialment am cauteri en loc de seccio am ferr; e es que tu prenguas cauteri cutellar subtil e que inscidas am aquel la codena dels ginitius, e es ignit segon que havem recomtat entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc contenent la aygua, e lahoras tu pren cauteri segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes this hernia is treated artificially with cauterization instead of sectioning with iron. And you should take a cutting cautery and incise the cord of the genitals with it. And ignite it according to what we have recommended until the white coat containing the water is discovered. Then take cautery in this manner:
e es asemblat a letra greca.	And it resembles the Greek letter Pi.
E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	And then pierce with that cautery and heat it until all the moisture is driven out.
E aprop exten le ciphac am uncis, e excorja am uncis, e excorja am cauteri subtil ignit; e inscideys aquel segon que es a tu possible entro que eradiques tot lu; e guarda te del huou que·l foc no·l toque.	And then extend the coat with forceps and scrape it with forceps and scrape it with a subtly heated cautery. And cut that as much as is possible until you have removed all of it, and take care that the egg does not touch the fire.
E sapias que aquesta operacio es pus salva e pus longinqua de flux de sanc, e milhor que operacio am seccio.	And know that this operation is safer and farther from blood flow than an operation with sectioning.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat apostema caut en la hora de seccio o en hora de cauteri, o flux de sanc, lahoras cove que tu cures qual contrarietat fa a tu per aquo, am curacio la qual conveneys a lu segon que es dit.	But if you encounter an aposteme or cautery during the time of sectioning or cauterization, or bleeding, then know what hinders you for that and cure it with the treatment which is appropriate for it according to what has been said.
Mays si le malaute es pauruc, e no spera la segonda operacio per la sua horribilitat, lahoras administra perforacio segon que yeu recomti aquo; e es quan es certificat deves tu, per aquo que havem dit de las significacios, que aquela hernia es ayguosa.	But if the disease is painful and does not await a second operation because of its horror, then administer perforation according to what we recommend for that. And it is when you are certain, by what we have said about signs, that that hernia is hydrocele.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute sobre alcuna cezelha elevada, aprop perfora le apostema en la partida pus bassa de lu am spatum lat, e pausa la perforacio segon la longitut del cos.	Then you should make a seat for the disease on some elevated cushion, and then pierce the apostume in its lowest part with a broad spatula, and continue the piercing according to the length of the body.
E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	And let the aperture be wide enough to drain all the water.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l’aygua.	Then press with cotton on that spot and tie it and leave it there so that the remaining water can flow out.
E aprop cura aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And then treat it until the wound is healed
Mays si contrarietat es a la egrecio de l’aygua en aquela hora tu perforas aquela: e aquo no es fayt sino per aquo quar le pannicol blanc en le orrifici de la plagua fa contrarietat e prohibeys le eyssiment de l’aygua, lahoras cove que tu metas en la plagua pena o instrument am la qual es extrayta l’aygua dels ydropitz, la forma del qual es precedida; o ajusta en la opprecio de la plagua un petit.	But if there is resistance to the exit of water at that time you pierce it, then that happens only because the white panniculus in the opening of the wound causes resistance and prevents the escape of water. Therefore, insert into the wound a probe or an instrument with which the water from hydroceles is removed, whose form is described above; or adjust a small catheter in the aperture of the wound
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	And know that water will return and accumulate again around six months or less. And when it has accumulated, then pierce it in the same manner because this disease will thus pass its days.
Capitol .lxiii.	Chapter LXIII
De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	Of sectioning on fatty hernia and its treatment.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	Know this: in the section regarding this hernia, there is great danger of loss and peril in many cases; therefore, I have seen it fit to dismiss him and save him by that better means.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And you are reminded about the operation on that one and the species of the abscesses.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	Therefore, it is said that the abscesses are born in those bodies where the veins are composed and this happens for many causes: either by acute acid superfluity, which is poured into the veins, or by percussion.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	And the colour of the abscess follows the colour of the body, and it is not found in the pain, and it is a serious abscess.
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	A light boil is an apostemized ulcer, of which the colour is dark, and it is not painful to the touch.
E alcunas veguadas es fayt per nodacio de las arcerias, e per imflacio de aquelas ayssi quo ja es perceubut la rememoracio de lu, o per imflacio de venas.	And sometimes it happens through the coagulation of arteries and through inflammation of those vessels that have already been perceived to be remembered, or through inflammation of veins.
Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques.	But that which happens through inflammation of arteries is known by the dispersion of the abscess when you press it with your fingers, and it does not need to be touched.
Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	But that which happens through inflammation of a vein is not dispersed by any cause due to the compression with your fingers.
E ja es possible que sobre aquesta specia sia fayta seccio e sobre les autres carns; e es que tu inscida la codena dels genetius, e aprop esten le huou a las partidas desus, e extratz aquel del ciphac blanc, e deliura le suspensori dels vaysels, e ligua les, e inscideys le suspensori pus que tu deliuras aquel de tota partida de las partidas del huou.	And it is possible that on this species there may be section made and on the other flesh; and it is if you cut the chain of veins, and close to where they emerge at their departure, extract from it the white matter, free the suspenders of the vessels, tie them up, and cut the suspender of pus after you have freed it from all parts of the hole.
Donc si l’huou ja es am aquelas carnadas consolida, lahoras cove que tu extraguas le huou e inscidas aquel.	Therefore, if the boil has already adhered to those flesh tissues, then you must extract the boil and cut it open.
E si es adherencia entro alcuna causa del ciphac, o entre aquo que es entre les bayssels, lahoras cove que tu deliures tota aquela adherencia e inscidas aquela per inscizio redonda.	And if there is adherence within some cause of the pus or between that which is between the vessels, then you must free all that adherence and cut it open with a round incision.
Mays si es nativitat de carn en le loc de la adherencia la qual es detras, lahoras cove que tu inscidas tot aquo que es de lu, e extraguas le huou ayssi cum havem dit.	But if there is native flesh in the place of the adherence which is behind it, then you must cut all that is of it and extract the boil as we have said.
Donc cum es complida la tua operacio, lahoras omple la plagua de lana imfuza en oli rozat e vi; e aprop cura aquela am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when your operation is complete, then fill the wound with wool soaked in rose oil and wine, and close it with the other dressing until it is healed.
Capitol .lxiv.	Capítulo LXIV
De la curacio de hernia que es de vitz.	Of the treatment of hernia that is caused by wind.
Vit es apostema envolut per alcuna envolucio semblant a broto am mollificacio dels testiculs, e es fayt dificil movement exercitiu e deambulacio sobre le malaute.	Wind hernia is an abscess wrapped in some wrapping similar to a bud with softening of the testes, and it makes difficult movements and walking over the illness.
E en la curacio de aquesta malautia es per temor per aquo del qual es precedida rememoracio.	And in the treatment of this ailment, it is by means of remedy that which preceded its memory.
Empero cove que diguam opperacio en aquela segon que fero les primiers.	"But how can we call this operation according to what was done first?"
E dic que cove que fassas sezer le malaute sobre una cezelha elevada; e aprop enpelleys le suspensori dels testiculs a las partidas dejos; e aprop te la codena dels genetius am les tieus ditz am les baysels que so probdas a la vergua; e tengua aquels autre ministre que tu, e extenda aquels am extencio vehement.	"And I say that you should first place the patient on an elevated couch; and then gently expose the spermatic cords at their origins; and then grasp the cord of the testicle with your fingers and tie it with a probe in the scrotum; and have another servant help you, extending his hands with great care."
E aprop inscideys am spatum lat agut per seccio traversa en le dreyt dels vaysels entro que sian les vayssels descubertz.	"And then make an incision with a sharp scalpel through the skin perpendicularly to the right side of the vessels where they are exposed."
E aprop excorja de tota partida ayssi quo a tu havem dit en extraccio de arceria las quals so en las templas.	"And then strip away all the fat from there, just as we have described for the extraction of an arrow from its head, which is located at the temples."
E aprop fica en aquelas un’agulha en la qual sia fiel doble, e lia aquel en le primier del locs en les quals accideys vit, e lia aquel autra veguada en le derier de lor.	"And then take a needle with double thread and insert it at the first point where you see blood flow, and bring it out again at the last of them."
E aprop inscideys aquels en le mieg loc per seccio dreyta segon la longuesa del cos, e extratz aquo que es agreguat de las humiditatz fetulentas e corruptas.	"And then incise at that midpoint with a perpendicular incision along the length of the body and remove what has accumulated there from corrupted and putrid humors."
E aprop cura la plagua am curacio de las autras plaguas en las quals vols sania esser engendrada per so que caian les vaysels les quals noyreysso un de dos genetius, quar no es mal per aquo.	"And then treat the wound with treatments for other wounds where you want healing to be generated, since the vessels that you have not ligated one of two will not cause harm."
Mays si accideys vit a totz les bayssels, lahoras cove que·ls testicols sian extragutz o que les testicols per aquo se cequo am les vayssels, per que sia privat de tot nutriment per la inscizio dels vayssels, e que sian estaborits, o que cequo per so que no sia juvament am aquels.	"But if it happens that all the vessels are cut off, then either the testicles must be removed or they should be tied off with the vessels so that there is no nourishment for them due to the incision of the vessels and they shrivel up, or else they will cause harm."
Capitol .lxv.	**Chapter LXV.**
De la cura de hernia entestinal.	**Of the Treatment of Intestinal Hernia.**
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels.	Hernia occurs due to a rupture in the abdominal wall caused by straining during bowel movements, allowing intestines to protrude.
E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.	And this rupture occurs either in the abdominal wall itself or due to an exit from it. This happens for many reasons such as: percussion, sneezing, coughing, heavy lifting, or similar causes.
E·l senhal de aquo, quan es per extencio del ciphac, es que accideys pauc a pauc en lonc temps, e no accideys soptament, e es apostema engual entro ves le preon per so quar le ciphac comprem le budel.	And the sign of this is that if it occurs due to an extension of the abdominal wall, it happens gradually over time and not suddenly. It appears as a swelling between the pubic area and the groin because the abdominal wall compresses the intestines.
E le senhal de lu es quan es per seccio del ciphac, quar al comensament fa accidir dolor vehement sobtament; e es apostema divers aparent dejos la codena propdana aparent, e aquo es per eyssiment del budel, e·l cos de lu a las partidas deforo del ciphac.	And the sign of it is that if it occurs due to a rupture of the abdominal wall, initially there is sudden severe pain. It appears as a different visible swelling near the groin area, which is due to protrusion of the intestines through the rent in the abdominal wall.
E alcunas veguadas es fora-getat am le budel la tela, e es apelada aquesta hernia entestinal zirbal.	Sometimes the intestinal tissue becomes trapped outside the abdominal cavity without being able to be pushed back inside. This type of hernia is called an incarcerated or strangulated hernia.
E alcunas veguadas es fayta am ventositat, e alcunas veguadas corr en le budel fenda, e aqui es retenguda, e es am aquo gran pernitia3 del malaute, e alcunas veguadas fa endevenir dolor malvada e majorment quan es premut.	Sometimes there is windiness (flatulence), sometimes the intestine slips out of the rent and gets trapped inside it. This can cause great danger to one's health. Sometimes it causes severe pain, especially when pressed upon.
E en la curacio de las especias de aquesta malautia am ferr es temor, per que cove que sia esquivat le cazament en aquela.	And in the treatment of these types of diseases with iron, caution is necessary to avoid causing a hemorrhage at that location.
E la manieyra de la operacio de aquela es que comandes al malaute que redugua le budel am la sua ma a las partidas dedintz de la sua conquavitat si obezeys al sieu retornament, e aprop sia envessat sobre le sieu col entre las tuas mas, e eleva las cambas de lu.	The procedure for this operation is as follows: tell the patient to push their abdomen inward with both hands from inside the navel if it returns there. Then quickly place your hands on their thighs and lift them up. This will help reduce the hernia by pushing the intestines back into the abdominal cavity.
E aprop sten la codena la qual siec la codena dels testicols a las partidas desus, e inscideys la codena dels testicols tota per le lonc; e aprop fiqua en doas labias de la seccio uncis segon que indigeysses a hubrir la seccio am aquels.	Then press the cord that connects the scrotum to the abdominal wall at its base, and incise it along its length. Then use two forceps on either side of the incision to widen the opening as much as necessary to expose the hernia.
E si’ la seccio segon la quantitat que a tu sia possible que de aquela le huou sia foro-getat.	And if the incision is made wide enough according to your ability, the protruding loop of intestine may be able to slip back into place on its own.
E aprop excorja aquela ciphaqueth les quals so dejos la codena dels testicols, entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc dur de quascuna partida.	Then carefully remove the fluid-filled sac that is surrounding the loop of intestine (hernial sac) by pushing it back through the opening in the abdominal wall until only the white fibrous tissue of each side remains exposed.
Lahoras tu entromet le tieu dit en aquo que siec le testicol, en aquo que es entre ciphac blanc, le qual es dejos la codena del huou, e entre le ciphac segon, e absolve am aquel’adherencia que es en la partida detras del huou.	Then insert your finger into the opening around the testicle, between the white fibrous tissue (which is left attached to the loop of intestine) and the hernial sac. Then carefully separate any adhesions that may be present behind the hernia with your finger.
E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	Then grasp the cord with your left hand at its base on the outside, and stretch the white fibrous tissue upwards with your right hand. Then lift the loop of intestine along with the hernial sac back into the abdomen through the incision. Tell your assistant to hold the loop of intestine in place from above while you use warm saline solution to dissolve any remaining adhesions behind it.
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	Carefully check with your fingers that there is no bowel tissue still wrapped around the white fibrous cord (hernial sac) and that it has been completely reduced into the abdomen.
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	But if you find any remaining cause (tissue), then carefully push it back into the abdominal cavity with your fingers.
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	Then take a needle with thick thread (about four strands) and insert it through the posterior wall of the hernial sac, just below where the cord was incised. Then cut off the excess thread on both sides so that you have about four inches of thread on each side. Tie the two ends together in a figure-eight knot, and then tie this securely to the edge of the hernial sac that is left attached to the spermatic cord with a tight double knot.
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	Then tie off the ends of the thread and ligate them securely together with a tight knot, making sure that none of the blood vessels in the area are inadvertently tied off to prevent the formation of an abscess at this site.
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	Then tie another ligature around the hernial sac about three fingers' breadth below the first ligature. Then grasp both ends of the hernial sac with forceps and cut away any remaining tissue that is attached to it along its rounded edge. Leave the loop of intestine in place.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	Then incise along the spermatic cord on its lateral side, as previously described, to allow blood and lymph fluid to drain freely.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	Then apply sterile gauze soaked in oil to the wound and place it over the incision. Then apply a ligature as previously described (and occasionally cauterize the white fibrous tissue with a hot iron near the blood vessel tie-off, especially if there is active bleeding), and leave the ligature in place until it falls off on its own.
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	But if the wound does not close spontaneously, then apply hot water compresses to promote healing and reduce inflammation as previously described.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	Then dress the wound using appropriate wound care techniques until it is healed.
Capitol .lxvi.	Chapter LXVI
De hernia ventosa.	On Ventral Hernia
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this type of hernia, there is nothing that can be burned or cauterized during the operation.
E les primiers diyssero que es fayta ayssi cum havem recomtat en la hernia que es am vi; la qual es que tu lies les vayssels aprop la seccio sobre aquela am fecilitat de lu; e aprop secca en le mieg loc en enviro le apostema am aquo que obro aquel, entro que caian les vayssels.	The early authors said that it should be treated in the same way as a hernia with fluid (hydrocele), by ligating and tying off the blood vessels around the hernia and then cauterizing the wound with a hot iron to prevent infection.
E cura la plagua segon que havem dit entro que sia sanada.	And dress the wound according to what has been said until it is healed.
Capitol .lxvii.	Chapter LXVII
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	On Dislocation of the Jaw
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Sometimes there occurs rupture in the joints as we have said, and swellings appear at that location.
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And if the intestines do not cause any problem to the horse, then that is good, and it returns to its usual state at all times.
Mays si es prolonguat le temps am aquo, es ajustada fissura en le ciphac entro que deysenda le budel en le ciphac; e accideys aquo per la extencio del ciphac le qual es en le angonars ayssi cum havem dit, la qual causa es quar le ciphac es estendut, e aprop es mollificat e·l loc es apostemat e emineys.	But if the time is prolonged thus, there occurs an adjustable fissure in the hip joint through which the intestine enters into the hip joint; and this happens because of the extension of the hip joint which is located in the joints as we have said, whose cause is that the hip joint has been stretched out and the place becomes softened, with the resulting apostema (an abscess) and swelling.
E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And its cure is through cauterization as it has been preceded by its narration.
E alcunas veguadas es curada am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: e es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos entre las tuas mas, e aprop secca le loc de la ruptura dels apostemas emineys am seccio per la latitut segon la quantitat de tres ditz.	And sometimes it is cured with iron according to this manner: and it is that the sick person lays upon his back between two pillows, and then the place of rupture of the swellings is dried up by section through its width according to their quantity.
E aprop strenh le ciphac blanc que es jos la codena entro que sia descubert.	And then strengthen the white hip joint which is below the backbone so that it may be discovered (i.e., brought back into alignment).
E aprop pren le ray e pausa aquel sobre le loc eminent del ciphac, e prem aquel al preon del ventre.	And then take the ray and place it upon the prominent part of the hip joint, and press it against the front of the belly.
E aprop cus le dos locs eminentz sobre la extremitat del ray del ciphac, e ajusta am la sutura un de aquels am l’autre.	And then heat the two prominent places upon the end of the ray of the hip joint, and join them together with a suture.
E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	And then extract the end of the ray, and do not squeeze the hip joint at all, nor extend the wound, nor cause any other harm as you know well in the cure of intestinal hernia.
E aprop cura aquela am la curacio de las plaguas, e cum inscideyses les fiels, mundifica aquela e restaura la plagua entro que sia consolidada; quar le ciphac es contrayt e no es ajustada la eminencia de ruptura.	And then cure it with the cure of ulcers, and when you have cut through the tissues, cleanse them and restore the ulcer so that it may be consolidated; because the hip joint is contracted and the prominence of rupture is not joined together.
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And cauterization is better in this place, for it is closer to health.
Capitol .lxviii.	"Chapter 68."
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	"The softening of the chain of the testicles."
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	"Many times the chain of the testicles in some men is softened because the flesh that is between them is softened. This is noticed."
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	"Therefore it is necessary that whoever examines the treatment of this [condition] makes the patient lie on their back, and cuts all the softened chain along its length above the natural chain; then he should approximate both lips with stitches."
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	"And if you wish, at the beginning, remove the excess of the softened chain with three or four cuts and sew it firmly."
E aprop inscideys entre las suturas; e aprop cura per curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat e caian les fiels.	"And then cut between the sutures; and then treat with treatment for other diseases until healed, and the threads fall out."
Capitol .lxix.	"Chapter 69."
De castracio.	"The Castration."
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	"Know that castration is condemned in our law, but because it has been requested of me that I remember this in this book, and it is not necessary to remember it except for two ways: the first is so that it may be known by those who study medicine when they are asked about this, that they may know its treatment; and the second way is that we often have a need for castration of other beasts for our uses for those animals, such as mules, goats, pigs, and similar beasts."
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	"And therefore I say that castration is done in two ways: either by crushing or by cutting through a section."
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	When an injury is caused by a blow, the method of treatment is to seize the beast in heated water until its genitals are softened and made limp, and then suspend it.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And furthermore take those with your hand so that they are resolved and do not appear outside the touching point.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	Moreover, in castration performed through incision and sectioning, you should hold the beast and press the cord of its testicles with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And moreover tie the suspensory ligament, and make an incision over each one with a section so that two halves proceed from it.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And moreover cut those parts that will have extruded outwards.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	Do not leave anything on the scrotum except for the thin skin which is above the testicles.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this method of castration is better than the one performed by crushing because crushing leaves no trace of the testicles and makes the beast desire copulation.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And furthermore treat the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lxx.	"Chapter Seventy."
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	"On the Treatment of Hermaphroditism."
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	"In men, hermaphroditism occurs in two ways: the first is when it appears in that space between the testicles where it resembles a vulva with menstrual blood."
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	"And sometimes urine flows from that area between the testicles."
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	"In women, it is one species: and that is when the vulva on the pubis appears like two testicles of a man, a little bit smaller at their opening, like the penis of a man and two testicles."
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	"And its treatment is of three kinds: two for men and one for women."
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	"And you should insert those joined flesh between the opening of that (vulva) and cure it with the cure for other sores."
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	"And in the second kind of men where urine flows from between the testicles, there is neither cure nor operation for it."
Capitol .xxi.	"Chapter XXI."
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	"Of lint and flesh protruding due to causes in women."
Lentige fort leu es ajustada sobre causas naturals entro que es etressat e es fayt leg le reguardament; e alcunas veguadas es magnificada en alcunas femnas en tant entro que es spandit ayssi cum en les homes e perve entro al coito.	"Freckles, being naturally formed between the skin's surface and its depth, are noticed due to observation. Sometimes, in some women they become prominent, spreading similarly as in men, even during intercourse."
Adonc cove que tu tenguas la superfluitat de lentinge am la tua ma o am unci e inscidas.	"Then you should remove the surplus of lint with your hand or tweezers and discard it."
E no ultimes en inscizio, majorment en le preon de la razit, per so que no endevengua flux de sanc.	"And finally, when cutting, especially around the wound's perimeter, to avoid bleeding."
E aprop cura aquela am curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanada.	"And thus treat those with plague until they are healed."
Mays carn nascuda es carn que nays en le horrifici de la mayre entro que umple aquel, e fort leu es eyssit a las partidas deforo segon semblansa de coa (e per aquo alscus primiers appelero aquo “malautia caudada”); donc cove que nos inscidam ayssi cum inscidem lentinge, e curem aquela entro que sia sanada.	"Born flesh is flesh that appears during pregnancy within the uterus until it fills it entirely, and for this reason it is called "hairy disease". Therefore we should remove it as we remove lint and treat it until it heals."
Capitol .lxxii.	"This is chapter seventy-two."
De curacio de alratica.	"On the treatment of leprosy."
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	"Leprosy is when a woman's vulva is not pierced or is barely torn."
E es o natural o accidental.	"And it can be either natural or accidental."
Accidental es per malautia la qual ha precedit, e aquela es fayta o per carn nada ajustada o per ciphac subtil o espes.	"Accidental occurs due to prior illness, and it is caused by lack of flesh, poorly attached skin, or thick, rough calluses."
E es fayt o en le preon de la mayre, o en les costatz de lu, o en le pus sobira de lu, o en le pus bas de lu, e prohibeys de cuoyt e de enprenguacio e de enfantament, e fort leu prohibeys las mestruas.	"And it happens either at the entrance of the womb, or on its sides, or on the pubic skin above it, or below it. It inhibits coitus, pregnancy and childbirth, and often inhibits menstruation as well."
E la cognicio de aquela es fayta per reguardament de la metrona, si la oppilacio es apparent, propdana; mays si no es apparent, lahoras tu cerqua aquela am les tieus ditz o am le ray.	"And its diagnosis is made by examining the vulva, if it appears open, it is considered prominent; but if it does not appear open, you should examine it closely with your fingers or a speculum."
Mays si oppilacio es per ciphac subtil, e es propda a las doas labias, lahoras tu coyta e disromp aquela.	"But if the opening is due to thick, rough calluses and appears between both lips, you should cut it open and remove it."
E es que pauses sobre las doas labias pulvils, e aprop pausa les tieus ditz indicz de amdoas las mas encemps.	"And when it pauses over both labia minora, its examination is indicated by inserting your fingers from both sides as far as they will go."
E la femna sia sobre le sieu dos, las sieuas coyssas extendudas, e aprop exten las doas labias am forsa entro que aquel ciphac subtil sia romput e la oppilacio sia uberta.	"And when the woman is lying on her back with her legs extended, she should extend both labia minora with force until that rough callus is broken and the opening is exposed."
E aprop pren lana e enbeu le4 en oli e pausa aquela sobre·l loc, e jagua am home le dia per so que·l loc inscis no sia consolidat.	"And then she should take some lint soaked in oil and place it on that location, and leave it there for a day so that the wound does not heal over."
Mays si le ciphac es gros e espes, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel am spatum lat o am fuelha de mirta.	"But if the callus is thick and rough, you should incise it with a scalpel or a myrtle leaf."
Mays si la oppilacio es per carnada, lahoras suspen aquela am unci, e inscideys aquela.	"But if the opening is due to lack of flesh, you should suspend that area with a hook and then incise it."
E sian am tu las medicinas que fan cessar flux de sanc ses mordicacio, ayssi cum ahacatia, e sanc de drago, e enses, ajustat am album de huou.	"And use medicines that stop bleeding without biting, such as aloe, dragon's blood, and mastic mixed with egg white."
E aprop aministra una canulha de plom ampla per so que la plagua no sia consolidada leugierament.	"And then insert a wide lead cannula so that the wound does not heal too quickly."
E tengua aquela per alcus jorns e aministra calgua de li sec.	"And keep it like that for several days and apply hot compresses of flaxseed water."
E aprop sia curada am l’autra curacio de consolidacio entro que sia sanada.	"And then treat it with the other consolidation treatment until it is healed."
E alcunas vetz accideys en la mayre nativitat de autres carns, e lahoras cove que inscidas segon aquesta manieyra.	"And sometimes it occurs in the natural opening of other flesh, and in that case you should incise according to this method."
Mays si aysso es per apostema crancos, a l’apostema crancos le qual es en la mayre no sia fayta contrarietat am ferr en deguna manieyra.	"But if this is due to a hard abscess in the womb, you should not use any iron instrument against it."
Capitol .lxxiii.	Chapter .73
De la cura de emorroydas e de tayl e de botor roja que accideysso en le conh de las femnas.	Chapter .73
Emorroydas so apprecio dels orificis de motas venas entro que de aquelas corro mot sanc continuadament; e cum so antiquadas emorroydas e son fayts theyls.	"Hemorrhoids are recognized as orifices of many veins where blood flows continuously; and when these hemorrhoids become ancient, they are made thick."
E ja yeu he dit en la divisio las specias de aquelas e les senhals de aquelas, e diyre ayssi aquelas que recebo curacio e aquelas que no recebo curacio.	"And you have already spoken about the division of species and signs of those, saying which ones receive treatment and which ones do not."
Donc dic que emorroydas e theyls quan so en le preon de la mayre e no apparo al sentiment, lahoras en aquelas no sia fayta curacio am ferr.	"Therefore I say that hemorrhoids and piles, when they are in the front of the anus and do not appear to the touch, at that time they should not be treated with iron."
Mays aquelas las quals so en le orrifici de la mayre sobre las quals catz sentiment, so aquelas que so curadas.	"But those which are in the orifice of the anus where one can feel them, are those which are cured."
E cove que tu metas la femna en mayso frega e aprop exten atheyl am les forfexs, o am drap aspre, e inscideys aquelas am las razitz.	"And you should put the woman in a warm bath and then extend her buttocks with forceps, or with rough cloth, and incise those with scissors."
E aprop pulveriza sobre aquelas deves le fluxs del sanc de una de las polveras insciscivas ses mordicacio, ayssi cum acassia e semblant ad aquels.	"And then sprinkle upon them, against the flow of blood from one of the powder boxes without biting, thus with acacia and similar to those."
E aprop enpellesca les sieus pes per una hora, e aprop pausa aquela en aygua freja.	"And then let her sit on her heels for an hour, and then let her pause in warm water."
E si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras fay aquela sezer en decoccio de sumat e de scorsas de milgranas e de gualas e de semblantz.	"And if the bleeding persists, then let her drink a decoction of sumac and the bark of thorns from the blackthorn tree and oak trees and similar ones."
E aprop pren farina de ordi e comfiys aquela am miel e vi agre e fay emplastre am aquo sobre le dos de lu.	"And then take barley flour, mix it with honey and vinegar and make a plaster with that on her back."
E si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, fay adherir am dos ventozas, e a las mamilhas ses escarificatio.	"And if the blood has been cut off, it is good; but otherwise let it adhere with two bandages, and on the breasts without scarification."
E aprop pren lana e submergeys aquela am suc de coliandre o am suc de arnagloza o am suc de guarravier am vi pentit e fay adherir al loc; e aprop cura le loc am enguentz entro que sia sanat. E cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And cure it until it is healed."
Capitol .lxxiv.	"Chapter LXXIV."
De perforacio de eyssedura accident en la mayre.	"Of the Perforation of an Abscess Accidentally in the Belly."
Motas specias de apostemas accideysso en la mayre, ayssi cum cranc e apostema lapident e ulceracios e adhubelat e erpetromens e fistulas emorroyas e raguarrias e thyl e autres apostemas.	Many kinds of ulcers occur on the thigh, such as hard and fleshy tumors, ulcers, inflamed sores, scabs, serpiginous fistulas, blood-filled cavities, and others.
E yeu ja he dit aquestas malautias e las specias de aquelas e les senhals de aquelas, e las curacios de lor en la divisio.	I have already spoken about these illnesses, their types, symptoms, and treatments in the chapter on ulcers.
E cove que yeu digua en aquest tractat de apostema caut le qual ve en la mayre quan es dels apostemas que collegeysso sania, e si vols saber en qual manieyra se fa la opperacio de lu am ferr.	And now I will explain in this treatise how to cauterize the ulcer that appears on the thigh when it comes from ulcers that do not heal, and if you wish to know how the operation is performed with iron.
Adonc cove que tu consideres si la dolor de la apostema en le sieu comensament es aguda am percussio e flecma e febre, e vezes aquel enrogezir e si catz sobre aquel le sentiment, lahoras no·t coytes am perforacio de lu, e cura aquel am aquo que ajuda sobre la maturacio entro que cesse la acuitat dels accidentz.	Therefore, you should consider whether the pain of the ulcer at its beginning is acute with percussion and swelling and fever, if it becomes reddened and tender to the touch. Then, do not cut into it with a cautery until it begins to mature, and treat it with water that helps with maturation until the sharpness of the symptoms ceases.
E lahoras cove que tu fassas cezer la femna sobre una cezelha que aia doas cezelhas; e recline sobre le sieu dos e ajusta les sieus pes a la partida pus dejos del ventre, e las sieus coyssas sian expandudas, e pausa les sieus brasses dejos les sieus denols, e lia quascus am liament ad aquo convenient.	"Now you must place the woman on an elevated surface that has two pillows; she should recline on her back and adjust her feet close to the opening of her womb, with her thighs spread wide. Then position her arms beside her breasts, binding each one appropriately."
E aprop la matrona segua del latz dreyt e aministre le instrument am le qual es ubert le orrifici de la mayre, la forma del qual vindra en aquelas causas que·s faran aprop.	"And then the midwife takes her place on the right side and administers the instrument with which she opens the vagina, whose form will come up in these cases that they will discuss next."
E cove quan vols ministrar aquest instrument que tu fiques am lo ray le preon de la mayre de la femna, e aquo que del instrument es intrat en la mayre no sia mays que·l preon de la mayre e leda le malaute.	"And when you wish to administer this instrument, place it at the entrance of the woman's vagina; ensure that only the tip of the instrument enters the vagina and does not cause discomfort."
Mays si l’estrument es major que·l preon de la mayre, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils sobre la textura del preon de la mayre per sso que sia prohibit l’intrament de tot instrument en le preon de la mayre.	"But if the instrument is larger than the opening of the vagina, then you should apply powder on the surface of the opening of the vagina so that no instrument can enter it."
E cove que tu pauses le vertitge que corr en le strument del latz pus desus e que le ministre tengua le strument e revolva le vertitge entro que sia ubert le orrifici de la mayre.	"And you should hold the thread that runs through the instrument on the left side and above, so that when administering it, they must keep the instrument steady while turning the thread clockwise to open the vagina."
E cum appar la excitura, e es tocada am la ma e es leon e molh, lahoras cove que tu secces aquela deves le cap de lu am spatum lat.	"And when the head appears and is touched with the hand, it must be gently lifted and dried with a linen cloth; then you should cleanse the child's face with a sponge."
E cum la sania es evacuada, lahoras cove que tu pauses en la plagua una meca submersa en oli rozat o oli vert en le qual sia alcuna stiptisitat; e pausa la calca7 en la seccio en le preon de la mayre.	"And when the child is born, then you should place a cloth soaked in rose oil or olive oil with some astringent properties on the umbilical cord; and place it on the section at the opening of the vagina."
E pause deforo la mayre e sobre le pentenilh lana munda submersa en aygua en la qual sian bulidas malvas.	"And then cleanse the woman and over the child, place a clean cloth soaked in water with boiled mallow leaves."
E aprop sia curada aprop dos dias am enguent le qual conveneys ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	"And afterwards it should be cared for properly two days after birth with ointment that is suitable until it is healed."
E alcunas veguadas es lavada la mayre e la plagua enayssi que es cristerisat am aygua e mel, e aprop am aygua en la qual es bulhida razit de liri o de aristologia longua, e aprop retorna al enguent.	"And sometimes the woman and the placenta are washed in this way: they are crystallized with water and honey, and then returned to the ointment. And sometimes it is washed with water in which rose hips or long pepper have been boiled."
E si la plagua es dedintz en la mayre ameguada, lahoras cove que tu sias prohibit de la curacio de lu am ferr, habantz cura aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio.	"And if the placenta remains inside the womb after birth, then it is prohibited to perform any surgery on it with an iron instrument; they should have care of it with water as we have said in this division."
Capitol .lxxv.	Chapter LXXV.
A ensenhar las matronas en qual manieyre les enbrios bius sian medicatz quan yeysso segon figura no-natural.	"To teach midwives how to treat women whose births are difficult and do not proceed according to nature."
Necessaria causa es que la matrona conogua en le comensament la figura del enfantament natural per senhals de lu, e es que quan tu vezas la femna expremar a las partidas dejos e desira odorar le ayre, e sobre aquo es enleujada per aquo que sobre ela es del part, e festina le eyssiment del enbrio, lahoras sapias que aquest part es segon figura natural, e es l’eyssiment de lu sobre le sieu cap, e la segondina am aquel o suspensa o pendent del ombelic.	"It is necessary that the midwife recognizes at the beginning the figure of a natural birth by its signs, and this happens when she sees the woman pressing her thighs together and desiring to smell the air, and afterwards she feels relieved by what comes out over her, and hastens the birth of the child; then you know that this birth is according to nature. And this is the emergence of the head first, followed by the shoulders hanging from it or suspended from the umbilical cord."
Donc cum tu vezes aquels senhals, lahoras cove que·l ventre de lu sia compremut per so que l’embrio deysenda leugerament quar quan deyssen sobre le sieu cap, deysen a lu la segondina, e es mondada de aquelas superfluitatz am bona mondificacio.	"Therefore, when you see those signs, it is necessary that the woman's belly is pressed so that the child comes out gently as it emerges over its head; then the shoulders follow, and they are cleaned of those excesses with good cleansing."
Mays aquel que es otra aquest part es no-natural e no-lausable, quar quan le enbrio es eyssit sobre sos pes e·l cos de lu es eyssit devant le cap de lu e·ls pes de lu, e la ma de lu una, o al pe de lu i, o es eyssit le cap de lu e la ma de lu, o al ventre de lu, e fort leu es convertit sobre le sieu col, e semblant de las figuras de lu no-lausablas.	"But if the birth is not according to nature and is not desirable, then it occurs when the child emerges feet first, with its body emerging before its head and feet; or one of its hands emerges first, or its foot, or its head emerges together with its hand or belly. And thus it turns upside down on its neck, resembling those figures that are not desirable."
Don necessaria causa es a la matrona que sia savia e subtil en totas aquelas causas, e que·s guarde de error e de decepcio.	"Therefore, it is necessary for the midwife to be wise and subtle in all of these causes and to guard against error and deception."
E yeu so mostrant tota figura de aquelas, e qual engen es en aquelas per so que sia significat per aquo e sia stat sobre aquo.	"And here we are showing you all the figures of those that are not according to nature, and what is their cause, so that it may be understood by this and established on this."
Quan le feyt es eyssit sobre le sieu cap per egrecio natural, e aquel es vehement sobre la femna e es fayt a lu part dificil, e vezes la vertut de lu ja debelitada, lahoras fay aquela sezer , o que las femnas tenguan lu, e evapora le conh de lu am fenugrec coyt e am olis humitz.	"When the feet emerge first due to an error of nature, and it is violent over the woman and difficult for her to give birth, and she sees that her strength has weakened, then they should seize it by its feet or what the women hold onto, and evaporate its head with fenugreek cooked in oil and humid earth."
E aprop entrometa la metrona entre les sieus ditz espatum petit e fenda am aquel la segondina, o secce aquela am la sua ungla entro que corro aquo que es en ela de humiditat.	"And also the midwife should insert herself between its legs and tear open the second with her finger or cut it open with her fingernail until what is inside it of humidity flows out."
E preme le ventre de la femna entro que deyssenda le fet.	"And press the woman's belly until the child comes out."
Mays si no deyssen, lahoras cove que la femna sia cristirizada de mucellage de ptilli e mucellage de fenugrec am cizami.	"But if it does not come out, then the woman should be crystallized with dough of barley and dough of fenugreek with sesame."
E aprop comanda a lu, aprop le cristeri, que sia compremuda e fay aquela stornudar am condisi; e te la boca de lu e·l nas de lu per huna hora, quar le fet sira foro-getat tantost.	"And then command her to be pressed, and also she should sneeze with conditions; and put your mouth over hers and your nose over hers for one hour, because the child will soon forget."
E si las doas mas del fet so foro-getadas al comensament, lahoras cove que tu redusiscas aquelas am fecilitat petit a petit.	"And if both arms of the child are forgotten at the beginning, then you should reduce them gently little by little."
Mays si no obezeys al intrament, lahoras pausa la femna sobre una cezelha e leva les pes de lu sus, e aprop concuceys la cezelha sobre la terra; e la femna sia tenguda que no caia deves la concussio.	"But if it does not obey the manipulation, then place the woman on a pillow and lift her feet up, and also strike the pillow against the ground so that the woman is held that she does not fall due to the blow."

"And if the arms are not properly returned and the child dies, then incise those veins and extract the flesh of the child or tie its body to your hand with cloth and extract it equally, because that will soon forget."
De eyssiment del embrio sobre les sieus pes.	"On the birth of the child feet first."
Quan le fet yeys sobre les sieus pes, lahoras cove que tu impelliscas aquels en sus, e aprop convertas le fet petit, e aprop que engualhes aquel, e aprop que prenguas un pe de lu e extendas aquels petit a petit.	"When the child emerges feet first, then you should push those up and also turn the child gently around, and grasp its heel with your finger, and take one of its feet and stretch it out little by little."
Mays cum son eyssit entro a las coyssas, lahoras tu comanda a lu que se exprema, e fay aquela extornudar am condizi, quar sira foro-getat si Deus lo vol.	"But when it is inside the hips, then you should command it to press itself out and make it sneeze with conditions, because it will soon forget if God wishes."

"And if it is not forgotten with what we have recommended, then return the child gently little by little until you place it according to natural figure, because that will soon forget at that moment with gentle birth."

Eyssiment del fet latutidinalment pendent una de las suas mas.	Guessed Translation: Examination of the latitudinally hanging one of its hands.
Sia engeniat en reduccio de la ma de lu, mays si no podes aquela reduzir, lahoras eleva la femna e fe aquela anar.	Translation: If it cannot be reduced by that hand, then lift the female and make her go there.
E si anar no pot, lahoras fay la jazer sobre le lieyt, e concuteys las coyssas de lu am concussio vehement, e aprop aministra liamentz les quals yeu e recomtatz de mucillages.	If she cannot go there, then make her lie down on the bed, and strike the parts of her with violent concussion, and promptly administer remedies composed of mucilages.

If childbirth has come, then make her sit on the birthing chair, and immediately study the reduction of the hand, guide the fetus according to its natural shape, make the woman sneeze, and command her to push hard until it is expelled.
Eyssiment del fet sobre·l col expandudas las suas mas e la fassia de lu es al dos de la sua mayre.	Examination of the fetus on the collar with expanded hands and its fascia behind that of its mother
Cove que la matrona tengua la ma del fet e aprop revolva aquel petit a petit, e eque aquel am facilitat.	That the midwife should hold the hand of the fetus and gradually turn it around, and ease it out.
E cum es e quant so es engualhat, e lahoras pausa sobre le conh de lu aquo que havem recomtat de oli e de mucellages.	And when it has come and as much as possible is expelled, then pause on the neck of it until what we have recommended of oil and mucilages has been absorbed.

Then command her to push little by little, and when she has done this, then make her sit on a birthing chair with the condition that she leans over the right side, and promptly command her to push; and make her sneeze.
Exitus foetus praeparati super latus.	The exit of the fetus prepared on the left side
Quan deyssen a horrifici de la mayre segon aquesta manieyra, considera, e lahoras tu inscideys la segondina am la tua ungla entro que sia evacuada de la humiditat.	When it has been expelled from the mother in this manner, consider, and then you should incise the secondine with your nail until it is evacuated of moisture.
E si le fet es suspendut sobre la cara e·l col de lu, lahoras tu inscideys aquela del embelic, per so que no sia retengut e mora.	And if the fetus is suspended on its face and neck, then you should incise that of the amniotic sac, so that it is not retained and dies.

Then push the fetus out towards its exit until that which is necessary passes, and command the woman to push herself several times, and it will be expelled with ease if God wills.
