Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	"But when the rupture is wide and is in the lower part of the belly, then you should make the patient lie on his back and place their buttocks higher than their head; and if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you should place the head down and the feet higher than the buttocks."
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	"And likewise if the rupture is in one of the two parts of the belly, then always place your intention and consideration on this so that the part where the wound is may be higher than the other."
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	"And therefore you should administer this in large wounds and in moderate wounds."
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	"And in small wounds, pause until it is prepared and make sure that the one who ministers it is among your most experienced, who holds the rupture entirely with his hand and adjusts the lips of it, and quickly discovers from that to that which sews any cause if necessary."
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	"And this is the common manner of suturing: first take a needle or count needles according to the quantity of the width of the wound; and then leave it at the end of the rupture on the tip of your finger, and thread the needle with one thread, but do not put any knot in both ends of the thread, with two knots that are left below the thread, inside which you make it penetrate from one part to another; and you have already attached four threads."
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	"And then thread with a double knot around the needle, and sometimes two parts together, and then attach both lips and the wound by proper attachment; and then leave the thickness of your finger and put another needle in that, and then tie it with thread like the first needle; and do not cease doing this until you have completed all the contraction of the wound."
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	"And let the needles be moderate between thickness and subtlety, for thin needles cut flesh too lightly; and thick ones are difficult to thread with the thread, therefore they should be moderate in both thickness and subtlety."
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	"And it is not necessary for the needle to be stuck in both ends of the thread at once, lest the flesh be cut too lightly and the wound be opened before its consolidation."
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	"And do not prolong suturing so that the wound is not hindered from healing."
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	"And then cut the ends of the needles so that the patient does not bother with their sleep; and you will place powdered breadcrumbs on all parts over the suture, which hold the ends of the needles; and leave them until you know that the wound is healed."
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	"And these types of suturing with needles in any manner are more convenient for small wounds, because one needle or two is enough for their suturing."
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	"But the second type of suturing is like this: you should use four threads for suturing, from the thread and two knots at once, with a needle that has fine silk wrapped around it in both thickness and subtlety."
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	"And then, when the needle has pierced these four extremities, return the needle to that same opening from which you began, so that the wound draws back its pus-filled cavity into the abscess, so that the suture may be made according to a stitch of cloth with which the wounds are strengthened."
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	"And pause between each suture the quantity of the thickness of the little finger."
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	"And this suture is known by men."
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	"And at this suture you cauterized the wound which was inflicted on a man in his belly who had been struck with a dagger, and the disruption of the wound was more than a palm, and it was issued from the bowels around two palms of the bowels near the middle place, and the disruption was in the middle of the member; and then you reduced that deposit which the bowels had flowed out of the wound for 24 hours."
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	"And the wound was consolidated in the space of about 15 days, and that man was cured and healed; and at that time he lived for many years, and remained in his usual condition."
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	"And the other physicians had judged that he would not be healed; and it was by miracle that he was cured, because you did not cure him with an ointment, since he was in a place where no ointment could be applied nor any medicine, but you paused over the wound twice a day and washed it assiduously with water of honey until it was healed."
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	"But you describe two kinds of suture proper according to the narrative of the Word."
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	"And it is that you begin with the stitching of the cord, and insert the needle from without to within."
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	"And then as the needle penetrates into the cord and meets with it in length along all the body, let the extremity of the thread remain in that which you have inserted the needle; and make the needle penetrate into the other extremity from within outwards in the other extremity of the member."
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	"And then when you have made it penetrate thus, afterwards make it penetrate again in that same extremity of the member from without within; and let the extremity of the thread remain on this side, and make the needle penetrate into the other extremity from within outwards."
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	"And make it penetrate again with that penetration with which you have made it penetrate in the thread at the extremity of the member which is on the inside, so that all may penetrate."
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	"And then begin from this same side and draw it with the extremity which is of the thread on the other side, and withdraw the needle from the cord which has penetrated, and reduce that in that cord and tie the extremity of the thread which is on the other side with this extremity of the member; and withdraw that from the cord which is on the part within."
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	"And do this once and again, and do it once more afterwards until you have tied all that is without according to that example."
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	"And the sum of this manner of suture is that you make a stitch of skin with which you sew the skin, so that you make the thread once from the extremity of the cord and let it remain again until you have completed it."
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	"But the second kind of proper suture which you describe expressly, and this is about it and for it to be sewn together, is that you sew it in half-length so that some physicians sew it thus, arranging every part with its corresponding part according to nature; and they apply the extremity of one to the other extremity and the extremity of the member to the other extremity of it, and this is done as you command."
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	"So that you leave the needle in the extremity of the member near the outside part, and make it penetrate within that part and let both extremities of the thread remain; and then turn the needle round and make it penetrate from without within at both extremities of the thread."
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	"And then turn those loops round, and make each loop penetrate from within outwards in two extremities of the member other than those which are on the opposite side."
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	"And this manner of suture is better than common light suture, and it is the suture of which there was a preceding mention."
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	"This is the discourse of Galen"
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	"And others say that the suture of the belly is corrected with two needles, so that you insert in each a thread and begin with an introduction of the needle on whichever side it is necessary for you to sew according to the suture of those who sew the heart ingeniously."
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	"And know that when a disruption occurs in the middle part of the belly, then the suture of it is more difficult than those of other parts of the belly."
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	"But the judgment of medical treatment of pleurisy is also the judgment of other plagues."
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	"The cause is because when you succeed in the recent plague with its pure blood before the air alters it and reduces the vessel and sews it up well and applies it properly afterwards, then it remains calm on that inflammatory dust."
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	"And if the air has already altered the plague, then it remains calm on some of those which are present before they make hard skin and cast out the threads, and are solidified thread and member; and then cure it thus as is the cure of other plagues until it is healed."
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	"But if you are not present with the medications then it remains calm for a short time because as soon as it begins to throw forth much sweat and bad humours and changes twice a day, as you have taught us, until it is healed, because in many dispositions when the plagues are simple you do not need other medication."
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	"But if you fear that the plague may communicate to an injury of the principal members then it is necessary for you to immerse lion's wool in pure olive oil or rose oil and apply it around those parts which are between the angles and leave them thus."
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	"And if there is pain or putrefaction in its vessels because many times this happens then crystallize it with black treacle and vinegar, especially if the putrefaction has reached the vessel and a penetrating evacuation has been made into its concavity."
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	"And know that that which is in the thick vessel is of lighter healing than that which is in the subtle vessels."
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	"And it is of difficult healing because the vessel which is called 'gungu' does not receive healing from any plague that falls into it completely; and this is because of the great multitude of veins that are in it and the magnitude of them that are in those, and because of the subtlety of its body, and because of its proximity to the nature of nerves."
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	"But if what proceeds from the plague is tissue and you succeed in it recently then reduce it according to your discretion with which you reduce vessels ingeniously."
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	"But if it has passed into the space and is now green or black then stretch it with a thread over that part which is darkened by it, so that there comes a flow of blood because in the tissue are veins and arteries."
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	"And then incise that which is other than the thread and leave two extremities of the thread hanging from the part beyond the plague outside it, so that over you may be relieved the attraction of it you must have the stitching of the tissue and emission of the sweat of the plague."
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	"Remembrance of the plagues when they occur in the vessel."
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	"When there is a disruption in the vessel and it is small then it is possible that it may be restored in some people because I have seen this man who was struck with a spear wound in his belly which was a plague on the right side of the stomach and the plague was old and had made a fistula, but from it came management and windiness."
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Then I pursue the healing of him though it was not yet completed in his recovery, but ceased to explore that region which had been healed and the place is consolidated.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And I saw that the place was already consolidated, so I told him to be careful not to aggravate his condition by eating and drinking too much, or overexerting himself, and to avoid excessive bathing and exercise.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And some experienced people say that when the bowel moves and is narrow, it should be tied in this manner: take figs with large heads, adjust both lips of the movement, and place one of those figs with its mouth open over both lips of the movement. Then press on it until its head separates from it, because it adheres and does not dissolve.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	And place another fig near the first one, and continue doing so with figs one after the other according to the amount of movement there is.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	Then reduce that and tie it with the movement; and those attached heads will remain inside the bowel until the bowel is healed, without causing any harm to the patient.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is possible that the bowel may be tied with a fine thread made from the bowel of an animal attached to it, because it is more like a needle. You should take the end of these bowel threads, and make sure it is well cleaned, and tie the end of it with the thread you have, wrapping it around, and then insert that thread through the needle and sew it onto the bowel, reducing it at the point of disruption.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this manner of suturing with figs is nothing but a matter of trust and hope.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	But if the movement is large and wide, especially if it is in one of the subtle bowels, because then it will only result in subtlety and not in the healing of it entirely.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of the cure for hemorrhoids and fistulas.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	"I know that every ulcer and abscess, when it opens and becomes ancient, turns into an ulcer that does not heal and continually discharges pus without being cut open; universally this is called a fistula, which we call that wound."
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	"A fistula is indeed a hard, tough, white nodosity with which there is no pain and it has a cavity just like the cavity of a bird's egg; because of this it is called that hollow wound."
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	"And in some men there is moistness [that causes] an ulcer which discharges pus; but if the moisture is cut away, it heals in a few hours."
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	"Sometimes this moisture is much, little, thick, and subtle."
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	"And I have already said before in the division, when I spoke of ulcers, that every ulcer which does not heal and is not on naked flesh is due to one of these nine causes: either from lack of blood in the body, or from malice of the ulcer, or because there is hard skin between it and its lips preventing the formation of new skin; or because it has too much lees; or because that ulcer itself is putrid and the material which passes into it is of bad quality; or because the medicine used to treat it is inappropriate; or when corruption spreads in the region, causing pestilence; or because of a property of the region, such as that of Saragossa, where difficult digestion of illnesses occurs, and healing of abscesses is delayed by nature; or because there is a bone or many bones in the ulcer."
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	"I have already explained all those causes, their symptoms and the treatment of them by medicine in the division [of ulcers]."
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	"And it is necessary that I should also tell you about the cure of fistula, which is done by operation with a knife."
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	"And know that fistulas occur in all the members of the body: some of them extend to large veins and arteries, or to nerves, or to the bladder, or to some part of the spine, or to some of the joints composed by composition such as those of the hand and foot; and others open near the main member and its like."
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	"And therefore those fistulas which are of this kind are among the illnesses which are difficult to heal and do not receive cure, and dealing with them is troublesome and ignorant."
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	"And if among the fistulas there is one whose depth does not reach these places which I have mentioned, and you hope for its cure and trust in it, then take a thread of wool or iron and try to find that with it."
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	"But if the fistula is winding, then investigate it with a thread of thin lead, for lead with the lightness of its body is eased and curved along the winding."
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	"And if the fistula has many horrible openings, it will not be possible for you to mark them with a thread."
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	"Then cauterize the openings separately, because the moisture by which you cauterize it will go towards the other openings and from them."
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	"And then inquire carefully to see if you can know whether here there are bones or nerves; and also whether the fistula is far or near; or whether it is one with many openings which is located on top of everything with your utmost strength, investigation, compression with the hand over the place, and similar signs and causes accidentally occurring in ulcers."
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	"And when you have considered all those causes with careful observation, then come to the treatment according to your judgment: and this is that you consider whether it is an apparent fistula near in a healthy place, far from a joint, nerve, artery, vein, or one of the places which I have mentioned."
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	"Then dry out the fistula according to what has been said above about its narration, and remove that which is in that filtration and of corrupted flesh, and that which is born from the opening of the flesh or of the skin and similar things, and cure it so that it may be healed."
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	"But if the fistula is of great depth and is winding, then it is necessary that you insert it into the front as much as possible according to your ability, and also cleanse it from all its corrupted flesh; and then administer bandages wrapped in sharp medicines, and introduce those into the cavity of the fistula which you have grasped with an iron hook."
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	"And do this for several days in succession so that the sharp medicine may burn away all that is rough and corrupted within the cavity of the fistula."
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	"Then restore it with dressings which generate healthy flesh until it is healed."
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	If it does not heal by this method, then cauterize according to what we have advised.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	If the cause of the fistula is bone and it needs to be certified, then inquire about it and dry it according to what we have advised, if you do not prohibit any cause of vein or nerve or main member as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is exposed and there is some corruption and blackness in it, then remove that within which all the corruption has gathered; and afterwards cure it with this until it heals.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it does not heal and throws out again as it did before, then know that you have not reached the complete eradication of the corruption; therefore, uncover it once more and carefully examine its cause and clean it with your strongest ointment, and afterwards restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And then if it is healed, well and good. But if not, then know that that corruption is in the deep interior of the body, which has not been reached, and therefore in that case there is nothing to do but leave it alone.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small, or can be removed, then remove it with fine forceps suitable for that purpose.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	But if there are many bones, then carefully perform the extraction of all of them, and do not leave behind any cause with your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if you encounter any difficulty due to moisture, and there is no fear or error in their incision, then cut those membranes or flesh if it is here, and deliver the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to remove the bones at that moment, then pause over the wound until it is closed up again, and leave that within which that closing has taken place around those flesh bones and membranes, and guard the wound so that it does not harden, and keep the incision you have made in your operation open.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Have then, if you fear, a poultice soaked in treacle and honey, or in Egyptian pitch, or in some other green ointment, for when those membranes dry up and the bones are separated by ablation, attraction is relieved.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone such as the thighbone or shinbone or similar ones, and only the surface of it is corrupted, then cut away that corruption only behind, until that blackness and corruption is removed, and then restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if that which is corrupted in it is a large part, and the corruption has reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close up that and cut off all around where the corruption has penetrated, and then cure it until it is consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend that you have with you something belonging to a man in his shinbone, so that you may pause on it as an example and assistant for your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	There was once a young man about thirty years old, to whom pain occurred in his shinbone, and the cause of that pain was inside the thigh bone within which matter had penetrated into the shinbone, and it was a matter of an abscess with a large swelling, and there was no external cause for it.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then much time passed with that one because of the error of physicians while the abscess was growing, and much matter came out from it, and his treatment was finally stopped when the thighbone became fistulated, and he did many things through those orificial parts which were all emitting pus and moisture from the body.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And then for a long time he was treated by many doctors around two years, and there was not much knowledge among them but rather skill, until I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And when I saw the thighbone of that one and the matter that was running out from those orificial parts through a large part of his body, then that man's whole body was already emaciated and his complexion was yellowish.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I inserted the tent into one of those orificial parts and reached the bone with it.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	"And then examine and probe all the orifices and find those through which fluid comes from every part of the chamber."
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	"And then you cut and incise on one of those orifices where you discovered a fracture of the bone, and you removed that decayed part which was earthy and rotten and blackened; and already a part of the chamber into which it had entered was corrupted."
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	"And then you closed what I had discovered and prepared of the bone discovered."
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	"I feared that it was not merely a fracture but some corruption which had been hidden and closed up, for I had already dressed the wound."
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	"And therefore he paused the restoration of the plague by using medicine in a consolidative way for too long, but it was not consolidated."
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	"Furthermore, I explored and exposed the bone a second time over the previous discovery, revealing continuous corruption in the bone."
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	"And I closed what appeared to be that corruption, and therefore he was perforated fairly for the cure of it and restoration, but it was not restored."
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	"And then I discovered it again and did not cease to incise the bone little by little particularly, perforating the restoration of it, but it was not restored until he had incised around a palm's width, and that extracted with its marrow, and therefore he restored it with medicines, and it is lightly consolidated and healed."
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	"It is not necessary to iterate the operation and section of it unless for the position of the friability of it and for the scarcity of its tolerance and fear of its death, because it had syncope in all hours due to superfuility of evacuation."
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	"And therefore it is healed by whole healing, and nothing is in place of hard flesh; and its position is good in its body and returns the virtue of it; and it has been converted into its positions and does not do anything contrary to it in walking nor harm in any cause."
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	"But if it is prominent in place of the body already broken, then you should cut it this way: Take linen and strengthen that in the extremity of that prominent bone, and order someone to stretch that out; And pause that linen of wool thicker than the first linen; And therefore tie that over the flesh that is left near the bone, and extend the extremity of it so that you draw the flesh apart from there, and you uncover the flesh upon the place where you want to saw so that the saw does not cut the flesh."
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	"And pause a piece of wood or board near the bone decently, because when you do this the saw will not cut the corrupted flesh."
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	"And it is necessary that the sawing be little by little upon the corrupted place because if it is in the concavity of the corrupt bone and does not appear in its appearance to the feeling, then the sawing must be done again."
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	"And if the bone is corrupted but not prominent, then one part continues with the other, and the corruption is in the middle place or at the end of it. Then uncover the flesh from all parts; And therefore pause wood near by, and saw that first part where there is corruption until the sawing of the other part is continuous."
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	"And let the sawing be according to the place of the corruption little by little, as we have said."
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	"And if the corruption is at the joint, then cut that corrupted joint, and saw the bone where it continues from the other part."
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	"But if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in its reason but by chance."
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	"And if the corruption is in the breast of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; however you should investigate the corruption in whatever way it appears to you, and remove that, and cleanse that according to every disposition which is possible for you, and with each invention be rectified by you when it does not cause any contradiction to vein or nerve."
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	"And know that there are different types of saws and sawing tools for cutting these bones. They are made according to the situation of the bones, their preparation, thickness, subtlety, size, smallness, hardness, and rarity; therefore you should prepare suitable instruments for each type of operation."
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	"And know that this operation implies to you regarding the type of instrument which you need when with you is great study and long knowledge of the methods of this art, and experience in the ways of diseases because then you already knew what is suitable for each tool according to each disease."
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	"And here at the end of this chapter I give you the number of instruments which you will prepare with them simply with which you will proceed to your prohibition which you will experience on others."
Forma de serra:	Here is an example of how "serra" could be translated into English:
Forma de autra serra:	"Here's another saw."
Forma de autra serra:	Otra forma de sierra
Forma de autra serra gran:	Another large saw shape
Forma de ray:	Form of ray
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	The head of this ray is shaped like a six-pointed star, and its tips are shaped like the points of a compass.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it should be noted that when the joints become corrupted, only then should their heads be rubbed together; otherwise, the opening is too wide.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Shape of a larger razor than the others
Forma de razori menor:	Form of small razor
Forma de razori lat:	Razor blade shape
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	Form of another saw properly made: it is arched as high as possible and sharp like iron, and its wooden member is properly shaped like a punch.
Forma de lu:	Shape of it
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Razor shape with concavity
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Another subtle razor shape

Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Another smaller incisor shape
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another incisor; this one resembles a ray, and its tip is like a saw, and it is used in many places where bones are involved.
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	The shape of the drill that suits the case of that which is perforated by the bones
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its tip is triangular and has a sharp point.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	It is made of Indian steel, similarly it is necessary that all the causes that we have mentioned for razors and incisors and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Regarding the cutting edge and the locking of bones
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The edge can be dulled either intrinsically or extrinsically. If you have treated that corruption with medicines and the cure does not help, sometimes the corruption will spread to another member without any cause. Therefore, in that case, you should incise that member where the corruption has occurred so that the illness is cured through death or mischief which is a greater impairment of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	The sign of that which happens is that the member becomes black where it was burned by fire or approaches darkness where the corruption has entered within that member and takes all the body. Therefore, you should incise there.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	Similarly, if it is caused by corruption due to some venomous causes such as the sting of a marine scorpion or viper or rattlesnake and similar ones.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the injury is at the tip of the finger, then you should incise the finger and not allow the corruption to spread into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	Similarly, if it spreads to the hand, then you should incise there from the wrist of the firearm and not allow the corruption to spread into the forearm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if it reaches up there, then you should incise the arm at the elbow in the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption passes beyond that and sometimes surrounds the elbow, then in that case it is the death of the illness. And to administer another cause for cure other than that is a matter of quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	Similarly, when corruption reaches the finger of the foot, then you should incise there to one of the joints
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold in the ankle of the foot, then you should amputate all of the foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it can enter into the knee, then you should incise the calf at the joint of the knee
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if corruption has already reached over the knee, then in that case there is no help but release and let the illness take its course to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	The manner of incising the member or sawing it is that you should stretch one bandage at the point where you wish to incise, and stretch another bandage above that place. And extend one bandage towards the points below, and extend another bandage above them. And separate the flesh which is between two bandages with a wide knife so that all the flesh is exposed. And then it should be incised or sawn.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And care should be taken to place cloth of lime on all sides so that it does not touch the place raw, and that wound may come to the illness with proper lesion and caustic aposteme.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if bleeding occurs while working, then you should cauterize the place carefully, or place some powder on it to stop the bleeding. And then return to your medication until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the member with a bandage in whatever way seems appropriate, and treat it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I relate to you what happened to a man in his foot, which is the accident that I and you are discussing, which was that it became black in his foot with burn-like discoloration resembling fire combustion.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And this corruption first occurred in his toe such that it spread throughout the entire foot
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepared to cut off his foot himself because the cure was not going well due to its severity of pain and burning. And he incised his foot at the joint, and fire healed it.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time that same corruption occurred in the index finger of his hand
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then I came to him, and he told me that that same corruption had spread over with what I had placed on his hand as medicine, especially the cleansing of his body. And the corruption did not spread back but began to go into another finger until it reached the hand
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he asked me to incise his hand, and I did not want to do that hoping for the repercussion of that corruption. And more so because I feared the death of the incision of his hand, since the strength of the illness was already established
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he left me, I heard that that man had returned to his land and had incised all of his hand himself, and it healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not related this narrative except to help with what is known about this illness, and that it may be understood for which it is named and according to which it should be treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Concerning the treatment of sinus and the quality of cleansing with medicines
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an aposteme occurs on some fleshy members and the space of the aposteme becomes prolonged so that it collects pus, and then it breaks and perforates, and the pus is discharged from it, and the place remains void as if it were a vessel, and the channel that is above it is like a thin cloth, and no further corruption reaches it, and it does not print on bone or nerve or tendon, it is called a sinus, and it is not named fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But if the space is prolonged so that corruption impresses on some member, then it is called fistula and notzukem.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	"And the treatment of this condition is to insert that chain completely in this manner as it is rolled up, especially when it has been subtiliated and made with cloth, ensuring that it does not adhere to the location due to its corruption."
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	"If however you suspect that the chain has adhered and that this corruption cannot be achieved by any other means, then at that time you should treat him with a clyster."
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	"And if you consider the sinus, and if it is large, and the arm that goes in has a foul odor, then clysterize him with an Egyptian medicine which is made of oil and sour wine and cinnamon ground together equally, put in a vessel, and cooked over the fire until it reaches the consistency of honey."
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	"And moreover take of that which is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey; and clysterize him with this mixture into the sinus, and strengthen the orifice of it, and leave the medicine in there for the quantity of two hours."
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	"And then remove that with a sponge; and do this for so many days until the sinus is cleaned and the pus removed."
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	"And sometimes it is clysterized with hot ash water when this medicine is not present. And if you take the ashes of figs and put them on the water, then collect that and clysterize him with it until you are satisfied that the sinus has been cleaned."
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	"And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicine or hot ash water, then clysterize him with warm water and honey mixed together three times, and clysterize him with wine and honey mixed, for it is proper that honey should cleanse and wash, and wine makes the sinus adhere, especially when there is an abundance of astringency and dryness in the wine."
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	"And when you have done this several times and are satisfied that the sinus has been removed, then clysterize him with something that makes flesh grow in it."
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	"And take of refined diaphoretic and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent wine, or clysterize him with some other medicines and ointments that have the properties which have already been written about in the treatise on ointments."
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	"And if the orifice of the sinus is narrow so that the cannula of the clyster cannot be received there, then gradually dilate it with a little iron, and pause in it with hot water wrapped in Egyptian ointment or basilicon ointment until it has been dilated."
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	"And similarly, if the orifice is wide, then gather its lips with a suture and leave in it the quantity in which the clyster enters without addition."
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	"And if the opening of it from which the arm comes out is elevated above its parts, then dry that place with a poultice below where it is located so that the arm may run easily, for when the arm is obstructed in the concavity of the sinus flesh may be generated there."
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	"And if it is not possible to dry the sinus inside according to your will, then prepare the member with preparation so that the arm runs through it easily according to what you are accustomed to, and that there may be no cause of retention in the arm."
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	"And take consolidating medicines which are put on the sinus conveniently, such as those you wish to extend them over cloth on it."
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	"And let the cloth be of such a quantity as to cover all the sinus; and appropriately cut with scissors on the right side of the opening of the sinus a strip somewhat wider than the opening of the sinus; and appropriately extend over another piece of cloth some of the ointments according to the quantity of the strip, and pause it over that at a distance from the opening of the sinus so that the exit of the arm from it may be facilitated and do not let the cloth remain too long, only for a few days once."
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	"But that which is over the opening of the sinus should be removed at all times so that nothing may be stuck in it on the arm."
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	"And so that you may know whether what comes out from the opening of the arm is much or little, whether it is digested or undigested."
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	"And also consider the place where that sinus is located, if the patient feels pain there or not, and whether it is an abscess."
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	"Given that your treatment has lasted this long in such a manner, and you see the matter that is thrown onto the wound of the sinus already adhering or becoming properly adhered, then remove it on the third day. And when you remove the cloth, then replace it with another one and renew the ointment."
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	"However, if the sinus has a long and narrow space that is filled with subtle virus, then do not despair about its adhesion, because its healing will be proper. For there are some people in whom the generation of flesh in the wounds is delayed, and among those are also those in whom it happens otherwise."
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	"If the sinus has remained dry for many days without discharging any matter, then you should know that the sinus is not adhering. And if the adhesion of the sinus is delayed and prolonged as a result, then adjust the drying out of the medications. If the medications are humid in their substance and virtue, they will be dry like fine ointment when they have reached the appropriate amount of addition of pitch."
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	"And the last remedy with which it is cured is that you take some fine ointment and dissolve it in rose oil. Then pour it over the wound while hot, like ancient wine. And then apply this remedy to it, using it."
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	"And it seems like that action, when there is no matter present, ointment should be used. And if honey has been cooked until it becomes thickened, use it; or you may take myrrh and aloe wood and nutmeg, grind all of them together and powder them over the honey while it is still on the fire. Then spread that over a cloth and apply it to the sinus; and also spread that with the honey which has been cooked until it becomes thickened, and powder it over the cloth."
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	"And sometimes it is administered with long and thin roots of celestial lily (which is celery) and barley flour and centaurea. Use these simple remedies or adjust them as needed, grind them up and sift them, then powder them onto the honey which has been thickened, and apply it."
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	"And if the sinus remains prolonged and is not healed by this treatment, then you should know that the corruption is in the bone of it. And you should make an investigation in the bones or in the other hard members or in the ligaments. Then treat it with fistular cure, as was said above."
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	"On treating panaricium (a whitlow) by rubbing with ointment, making an incision in the nail and adding a finger, and cutting it off."
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	A pimple is an abscess that appears beneath the nail of the toe or finger, and often appears in other digits as well. When it becomes prolonged and its cure is more difficult, it is called an abscess of an abscess or it is corrupted, and it emits a thick liquid that corrupts the root of the nail. Often the entire nail becomes corrupted, and frequently its corruption extends to the bone, which gives off a foul odor. The tip of the toe or finger becomes reddened, and the color appears dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	Therefore, when you have that which we have spoken of in the division and your cure does not confirm itself, it is necessary then to cut with iron all the superfluous part that remains of the nail and cauterize the wound immediately afterwards, for cautery is very helpful in this case.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the corners of the nail begin to push into the flesh beneath, causing pain and inflammation there, then you should make a subtle incision at the angle of the nail that is pushing into the flesh, lift it up, and cut away that flesh with ease. Then place over what remains of the flesh medications that burn corrosively until all is removed; and immediately afterwards dress that wound with an ointment so that it may heal.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already entered the bone, then you should cut into the bone and extract it, for there is no time when the bone can be healed once it becomes corrupted.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the corrosion and corruption extend to the finger itself, then you should cut into it at one of its joints according to what is remembered regarding its movement, and dress that wound until it heals.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail receives a blow or rubbing and there is violent pain in that place, then you should first bleed the affected part. Then dry the nail with a sharp spatula made transverse from above to below, taking care that the cut does not extend into the flesh beneath the nail. Otherwise you will cause severe pain and provoke the formation of excess flesh in that location. And dress that place with something that relieves pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	"Yet it was said that some men are born with excessive flesh in their bodies, and they have excessively fleshy skin, or bones, or nails."
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	"And some of them are born at the root of the joint, or their birth takes place in certain knots of these aforementioned bones."
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	"But he who is born in some knots of the finger does not suffer pain, and this one who is born at the joints is much afflicted."
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	"And those who are born fleshy, their section should be lighter, and you should incise the root of this one with a broad knife."
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	"Yet the treatment of that which is born at the root of the joint is difficult; therefore beware of cutting it off."
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"Yet in that which is born on the knuckle of the finger, you should incise the beginning of the flesh with a round incision into the bone, and then saw it off with one of those convenient saws appropriate for this purpose, and afterwards cure it until it heals."
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	"Yet the consolidation which occurs in these among their veins visible, or by birth of man, or by the consolidation of plague, or by combustion of fire, or by similarity, then it is necessary to cut away that consolidation until these aforementioned return to their natural form."
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	"And also interpose between their membranes of the inflamed ones with fine rose oil so that they are not consolidated lightly, and separate them or interpose between them a thin sheet of lead so that it may be consolidated according to what is necessary."
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	"And similarly if consolidation occurs in some of these at the palm, then you should cut away that consolidation according to what is prepared and appropriate for the figure of the member."
