De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	"Of incisions of veins, there are eight."
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	"Veins are veins, and they are wrapped-around thick veins full of superfluous black bile which come into the muscles of the body's members, and their greatest occurrence is in the calves, and especially in the calves of those who travel, those who work, and those who carry things."
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	"Therefore you should administer purgation of the body from black bile several times with strong evacuation, and also bleed the patient from the basilic vein."
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	"Yet the treatment of these with iron is according to two methods: one is that it be incised and that black blood be drawn out, and the other method is that the vein be elevated and that all of it be extracted."
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	"The section of the leg is according to this method: irrigate the beginning of the calf with cold water until thick blood is resolved, which is the sediment of the calf, and then bind the calf of the sick person at the superior part of the hip joint up to the joint of the anus with a bandage, and then cut the vein in one place, or two, or three with a wide section, and then elevate black blood with the tie-up hand from the joint below the calf upwards downwards until as much blood as you wish is let out, which will suffice for relieving the virtue of the sickness."
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	"And also tie it up, and command him to abstain from foods that generate black bile."
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	"And repeat the treatment by phlebotomy when veins are filled and this is noticeable to the sick person."
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	"Yet the elevation of these is according to this method: you who shaves the calf of the sick person if it has hairs, and then place him in a bath and irrigate the calf with cold water until it reddens and veins are visible; or have him exercised vigorously if a bath is not available, until the member is warmed."
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	"And then cut the cord at the right of the vein by section in its length or thickness, either near the buttock on the side of the anus, or lower down near the heel."
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	"And then tie up the cord with forceps and strip off the vein on all sides until it appears to the touch, and it is desirable that its appearance be several times requested declining towards blackness."
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	"And then after evacuating tie up the cord white like a rope several times."
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	"And then you place below that one which has been elevated and cast off from the cord, and suspend it with a golden forceps."
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	"And then cut another section near that one by three fingers, and strip off the cord from above the vein until it appears."
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	"And then elevate that one and incise it in a second section near the heel, and then extract that one and elevate that one until it is let out through the second section, and then extract that one from the section that is above it."
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	"And do this until you have extracted that one from the section which is above all sections, or highest of all, until everything has been let out; and then close it up."
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	"And if you do not succeed in extracting and elevating it, then insert a double-threaded needle with strong thread and bind it up and extract it, or else place below that one which has been elevated and turn your hand round on all sides until it is cast off."
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	"And be careful that it is not cut; for if it is broken, it will be difficult for you to elevate that one much, and harm comes upon the sick person through that injury."
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And when all has been cast out, then place over the wound a bandage moistened in wine and oil raw and oil not raw, and heal it until it is healed."
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	"And if the vein is contracted having tortuosity to which there is no wrapping at its parts, and it is not straight according to what we have said, then you must cut over that one all along the tortuosity of it and at the places where there is wrapping of it, and suspend it with forceps until you elevate that one entirely."
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	"And be careful of your section lest thou cut the vein and lest thou wound that one, for it will be difficult for you to elevate that one if thou doest so; and take care with thy prudence in that."
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Here is the form of the incident in which a vein is cut:
Forma de unci orp:	"Form of an ointment for ulcers:"
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	"It is not made like other ointments and does not have sharp edges so that it does not injure the vein, and it is of thick consistency, lest if it were thin, it would cut the vein due to its thinness; there is superfluous thickness in it, as we have said."
De extraccio venae cruris.	"Of the extraction of a vein from the leg."
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	"This vein is generated in the caves located on dry lands, like those found in Arab lands and in the dry lands of India, which have little tenderness and where there is no grass or herbs."
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	"And it is also generated in other places of the body besides caves."
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	"And its formation is due to putrefaction, which rises from the spine like venom from inside the body serpents and worms and crabs and worms generating between the spine and the flesh."
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	"And the sign of the onset of its occurrence is that this vein happens to be inflamed in the cave, and around the location it is infected; and from there begins the vein to exit from the location of that infection, which appears like a plant root."
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	"And then when the extremity of it appears, at that time you should wrap around it a piece of lead weighing about two and a half drachmas, without touching the lead, and let it hang from the cave."
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	"And whenever any cause arises outside of it that causes it to swell up, wrap that in lead without touching it."
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	"And if it does not become longer, then cut off a piece of it and wrap the remaining part; and do not cut it too close to the root, for if you do so it will retract and go into the flesh and cause inflammation and putrefaction in that location and produce a bad ulcer."
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	"So that it may be treated gently and extracted little by little until it is completely gone from the body and nothing remains of it inside the body."
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	"And this vein can be up to two and twenty palms in length, and I have heard of one that was thirty palms."
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	"And if it is cut during the time of its treatment, then insert a thread into the opening and pierce that with a long thread through the body until all that is inside the matter is evacuated, and administer putrefaction to the location for some days with medications; and cure it with the cure of apostemes."
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	"And this vein sometimes has many branches, especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or in the foot, and it comes from many openings, and each opening has its own branch."
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	"And therefore cure it as we have said in the division above, with what has been said about it."
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	"Regarding cutting for worms generated under the skin and called bovine disease."
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	"This disease is called in some lands 'bovine disease' because it often happens to oxen and is a worm that is born between the sinew and the flesh, and goes throughout the body pushing and pulling, and can be felt by its movement from member to member until it breaks the sinew and comes out."
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	"And its generation is due to putrefaction of certain humors, just as worms, serpents, earthworms, and ascarids are generated in the belly."
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	"And it is feared for its mischief because when it goes into the body and rises to the head and reaches the eye, then it strongly beats in it and enters and destroys the eye, which often happens."
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	"And therefore when you want to cure it and extract it, then do not do so unless you know its movement and appearance by feeling, and then bind what is above it and what is below it with linen and strong binding, and dry it on top of it and pull it out."
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if it is caught in the flesh and not removed, then apply a cautery with fire to the location where it is until it is killed, for its corruption is what is most feared because it corrupts that location as has been said."
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	"But if it has reached the head near the eye, then bind above the eyebrow with strong binding and dry on top of it and pull it out; and the patient should use purgation of his body with medicines that expel bad putrid humors, and should avoid foods that cause putrefaction."
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	"Regarding cutting for the disease called nafir."
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	"This disease is called in our land 'nafir' and it is pain that comes to some members and also changes from member to member."
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	"And you will see this as I will describe it to you."
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	"I was called to see a woman patient in a village, and I uncovered her arm and saw a small inflammation in the vein of the elbow joint of the arm, and after it had been broken for an hour, I saw that inflammation moving thus as if a worm were pushing towards this place but more lightly than could be seen, just like flowing liquid silver from place to place."
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	"And then the pain moved away from that place and fixed itself in the muscle, and stayed there for an hour."
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And now correct what was done in the other body until it reaches the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And now I recall that you said to turn yourself throughout your body according to what I saw; and he was greatly amazed at the transformation of him and the speed of member by member.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen before that in my eyes according to that manner, but I have heard many who affirm that it hurts to be transformed from member to member.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I do not see that in the eyes like in women.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And you think that is because the woman was of old age, where there are many bodies and veins uncovered, and in this appearance it seems to feel that windy transformation.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that it does not appear according to this backwards curve in those who are delightful and have moist bodies with veins intertwined.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And when you want the cure of him, and the patient feels that pain, then it is not apparent to your eye as we have said, then you press on him gently and let go lightly and cautiously over him where that windy oppression has come out, and cauterize the place.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it with your eyes, then cure him with exercise of the body and with that which expels windiness, and treat him with pills made from bitter herbs and with pills made from saffron and similar things.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Of removing arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diversified according to their species and according to the places of the body where they strike, because their diversity is that some have large points and some small and concave ones, some are blunt and others solid. Some have three angles, others have tongues or feathers.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And those that are according to the members and weights where they strike are divided into two methods: for some members or principal members cause death, such as the brain, heart, liver, lung, intestines, gallbladder, etc. And therefore when they hit one of these members and there appear signs of death, which I will explain later, then it is necessary that you avoid extracting that arrow in those where death is certain in the most favorable conditions, and when you do not see these bad signs and the arrow is not hidden in the depth of the member, then extract it and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And the signs of death from being struck by an arrow are: when it passes through the bone and exits from the cranium above the brain, because it happens suddenly with loss of consciousness, vertigo, roaring in the ears, inflammation and redness of the tongue, spasm and confusion of understanding and vomiting of bile. The breath is suddenly cut off and speech is destroyed, and there is an exit of moisture resembling white powder from the wound, and a yellowish discharge like watery matter comes out of the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore if these signs appear to you, then abstain from treating and extracting the arrow unless it is outside of the body.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of an arrow when it strikes the heart are: it is near the left nipple, and it seems to be stuck in hard flesh and not soft. The movement of the arrow is like the beating of the pulse, and there flows black blood from the wound, there is coldness of the extremities, chills, and syncope; therefore know that death will come without delay.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when an arrow has pierced the lung are: there is emission of frothy blood from the wound, and the vessels near the neck become obstructed, the complexion changes to pale, and there is great expiration or sighing for breath, and a desire for cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow strikes the diaphragm which is in the chest, then the pain will be near the little ribs, and there will be great swelling of the lung with violent pain and sighing, and all the members of the muscles will become paralyzed.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrow strikes the stomach, then there will be immediate vomiting of some undigested food from the wound.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if the arrow strikes the abdomen and is stuck there, then there will be some opening of the wound, or the skin, or a ruptured intestine, and there is no hope for cure by extraction of the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow strikes the bladder and urine is expelled from outside, and there is some process around the parts outside, then there will be great pain above the wound, therefore know that it is mortal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	But the other members such as the face, neck, throat, shoulders, arms, and shoulder blades, spine, collarbone, thigh, leg, and their like are saved according to the most favorable conditions when the arrow does not strike a vein or artery and is not a poisoned arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I advise you to consider this concerning these arrows, so that you may know how to proceed with their treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	For example: there was a man who received an arrow in the lacrimal bone of his eye near the root of his nose, and I extracted it from another part, leaving behind only the graze of the ear, and he healed without any harm to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another arrow from a Jew which had struck him in the graze of his eyebrow, leaving behind only the eyelid. The arrow was already hidden and could not be seen, except for a small extremity with which it adhered to its shaft. It was a large, pointed arrow of the Turks, with a lion-headed ferrule, which had no feathers.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew healed completely without any harm to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man which had fallen into his throat. It was an Arabic arrow with feathers, and it was already submerged in his throat. Then I incised between two guide fingers and carefully extracted it, and the Christian man healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another arrow from a man who had received it in his belly and thought that he would die from it. Therefore, since thirty days had passed without any change in his condition or symptoms, I incised over the arrow and removed it, and he healed without suffering any serious harm.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw another man in whom an arrow had struck the back and the wound had healed over it. After about seventy years, the arrow came out at the root of his thigh.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman in whom an arrow had struck her belly and the wound had healed over inside her without any change in her condition or symptoms. The woman did not suffer any harm to any of her natural operations.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man in whom an arrow struck his face and the wound healed over and the arrowhead broke off without causing much pain. Many similar cases have been seen to this effect.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I extracted the arrow from the man of the princes of the king which had struck in the middle of his nose and had deviated slightly to the right. The entire arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called for the treatment of him about three days after he was struck by the arrow.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then I opened the wound of the arrow quite narrow. And then I inquired about it with a delicate touch and did not feel it; but he felt a puncture on the right ear, and therefore I believed that this puncture was due to the extremity of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	"I have plastered the area with a plaster that has attractive and digestive virtue, ensuring that the area is covered so that I can see the arrowhead, for it is dry."
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	"There was no accidental occurrence in the area where the arrow had reached; and I continued applying the plaster for many days without any accident occurring; and the wound has since healed, and the patient recovered from his injury within several days until one day he felt the arrow inside his nose and recognized it."
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	"Then I applied acute corrosive medicine on the wound for several days until it opened; and with the forceps I grasped that [the arrowhead], and extracted the thin extremity of the arrow, which adhered to the shaft."
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	"And then I applied that acute medicine on the opening of the wound until it appeared visible to me; and I spent some time with this for the period of four months."
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	"And then when the wound was enlarged and it was possible for me to insert the forceps into it, I grasped that [the arrowhead], but I did not succeed in extracting it immediately. Then, however, I did not cease subtly manipulating and devising ways with ingenuity until one day I began to remove it by using methods of extraction described below, according to what came at the end of this chapter, so that I was able to extract it; and then I restored that wound."
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	"And some physicians judged that the cartilage of the nose could not be restored, but I did restore it and the wound became consolidated, and the illness was completely healed, without any remainder or cause for complaint."
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	"And I recount to you the method of extracting certain arrows because I have not given any rule or significance regarding that which has not been mentioned in this narrative, for the parts of this art and the definitions thereof are not understood with a mere narration nor is the book itself comprehended."
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	"And the wise artist compares little about matter; and that which is present he considers more than that which is absent; and he discovers new operations and new instruments whenever foreign causes of the art occur."
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	"And therefore I say that arrows are not forgotten in the members into which they have been fixed, but rather according to two methods: either by attraction of the place where it enters, or by the opposite method of withdrawal."
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	"And that which is cast in by the entrance point, or is an arrow proceeding from a fleshy location, is drawn out and extracted."
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	"And if it does not obey extraction at the time when cast, then you should leave it for a few days until the flesh that is around it becomes softened, and so that its attraction and exit may be alleviated."
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	"Similarly, if it is fixed in bone and does not obey extraction, then you should leave it for a few days and repeat the traction and motion each day, and then it will be extracted."
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	"And if it does not obey extraction even after several days, then you must perforate around the arrow in that bone with a subtle awl so that the location may be widened by the arrow, and then extract it."
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	"And if the arrow is fixed in the bone of the head and has already proceeded into one of the ventricles of the brain, and some of those accidents which I have mentioned appear in the illness, then abstain from extracting the arrow and leave it alone until the condition of the patient is equated after a few days; for if the arrow pierces the cerebrum, then death will not be prolonged."
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	"And if the arrow is fixed only in the body of the bone and does not pass into the cerebrum, and the illness remains for several days without any cause of those accidents occurring, then you should endeavor to extract the arrow and alleviate its attraction."
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	"But if it is deeply fixed and does not obey extraction, then you must administer awls around the arrow as we have described, and then treat the location so that it may be healed."
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	"But if the arrow is deeply buried in the location of the body and concealed from sensation, then you must search for it with a probe, and if you feel it, then extract it with some instruments which are suitable for its attraction."
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	"And if you cannot reach it due to the constriction of the wound and the length of the probe, and there is neither bone nor nerve nor vein there, then cut through the flesh until it is widened so that it may be possible to extract the arrow."
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	"And if it is held by the ears with which it may be retained, then separate the flesh in which it is fixed on all sides with whatever effort you can make; and endeavor to achieve this without fracturing the ears or twisting them, so that you may succeed."
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	"And when you administer the extraction of the arrow in any location, then use twisting with your hand and forceps on all sides so that it may obey; and do this with such subtlety that the arrow is not broken, and so that its extraction may be easily accomplished."
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	"And if you cannot accomplish this at that time, then leave it for a few days until the surrounding parts have softened, and then repeat it since it will be alleviated."
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	"But if you find that there is opposition to the flow of blood, then administer what we have said about cure in its chapter."
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	"And guard against injuring any vein or nerve or tendon, and exert all possible effort to avoid the arrow; and do this with gentleness, calmness, slowness, and steadfastness as I have recommended."
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	"And therefore when you extract the arrow, do so in such a way that the illness is according to the figure according to which the case of the arrow was situated in it, for this is more beneficial."
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	"But if this is not possible for you, then administer what is possible for you according to the figures."
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	"But arrows which are extracted against the other side of another part, or those from which some part has already proceeded into other parts outside it, or those which have their point or end concealed due to sensation of the flesh above them and are prominent in that area; then cut through that area. Let the section be according to the quantity which the forceps grasp; and then extract it, for it will be easy to extract."
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	"But if it is retained in the bone, then twist it backwards according to its opposition until the arrow presses against the bone and widens it on both sides, and then extract it."
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	"And otherwise, leave it alone for a few days, and then repeat it when it is necessary to do so."
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	"If the arrow's shaft is in that [place], then you push it there with force."
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	"But if the shaft has fallen and you wish to administer momentum, then insert it there, if it's rigid, use a smooth instrument concave so that between the concavity of it and the end of the arrow it pushes gently against it."
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	"But if the arrow is concave, then you push it with an instrument inserted in that, because the arrow is opened by it."
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	"And if the arrowhead is poisoned, then you must cut away all the flesh around where it is inserted, if that is possible for you, and immediately treat it with whatever remedy you deem appropriate."
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	"And if the arrow strikes bone, or enters the abdomen, bladder, side, and is close to touching it with your hand, and if you can safely cut around that area, then cut around it and guard against cutting any veins or nerves, and extract it, and apply a bandage if necessary, and treat it until it heals."
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	"Forms of forceps with which arrows are extracted:"
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	"[They] have the ends like the beak of a bird, made sharp like a saw when they grasp the arrow so that it does not slip away."
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	"And there are many types of them: large, small and medium-sized ones according to the amount of the size of the arrow and its thickness, and also according to the width of the wound and the constriction of it."
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	"Form of concave impulse made from this hollow end like the quill of a bird for extracting the arrowhead from inside it, and pushing back that wound:"
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	"Form of pushing with a blunt end:"
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	"like a rod, in order to facilitate the entrance of the concave arrowhead and push it with that."
De fleubotomia de las venas.	"On flebotomy of veins:"
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	"The veins that are usually flebotomized are thirty-two in number, of which sixteen are in the head. These include two pulsating veins near the ears called 'alizain'; two herbs on the temples; two veins on either side of the nasal cartilage called 'aspicients'; one vein in the middle of the forehead; one vein at the tip of the nose; two branches of the neck; two veins above the upper lip; two veins below the lower lip, which are called 'aleglic', and two veins on either side of the tongue."
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	"In the arms there are five veins that are flebotomized. Of these, one is cephalic and is located on the outer side of the arm; it is called 'the vein of the head' by the people. Another is median and is composed of a branch from the basilica and another from the cephalic vein; this is called 'the vein of all the body' by the people. The basilica is a vein that lies on the inner side of the arm, called 'citillar' by the vulgar people. There are also the funis veins located above the elbow, in which flebotomy is usually performed and where it appears most visibly on the forearm. Lastly, there is the salvatella vein located between the little finger and the next one."
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	"And in the foot and ankle there are three veins: one on the outer side of the curvature of the little finger of the outer side of the foot, another is the saphenous vein located on the inner side of the ankle on the inner side of the foot, and the third is the sciatic vein located on the outer side of the ankle on the outer side of the foot. There are also other veins in the ankle that resemble these."
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	"The benefit of flebotomizing the veins near the ears is for treating ancient catarrhs, migraines, and headaches, as well as ulcers on the head that are of long standing."
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	"And the method of performing flebotomy on these veins is as follows: first, shave the head of the patient and rub it with oil on the occiput where both veins are located. Then, place a wide cloth on the head of the patient and apply firm friction. Next, wrap a bandage around the patient's neck so that both veins appear near the ears in two depressions on the head. Finally, grasp those veins with your thumb and if you feel their pulse with your thumb, then proceed to perform the flebotomy."
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	"Then take the cutting lancet and insert it into the vein on the arm until blood flows to the bone."
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	"And then raise your hand with the vein and arm upwards and make an oblique incision into the vein, cutting it obliquely."
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	"And let the length of the incision be about two fingers or thereabouts. Then allow as much blood to flow out as desired."
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	"And then apply powder and a bandage, leaving it in place until healed."
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	"And it has been preceded at the beginning of this book, the incision of those affected by cauterization."
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	"The two veins leading to the temples, which is beneficial for phlebotomy, are useful for ancient headaches and persistent migraines, and for frequent eye disorders. It also has sharp, abundant effusions in the hips."
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	"And the quality of performing phlebotomy on them is as follows, which I recommend to you: compress the patient's arm with a bandage until both veins appear clearly at the surface and are demonstrated by touching them. Then proceed."
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	"Then raise the arm over the vein at its intersection with your index finger, insert the phlebotomy lancet into it, and elevate the vein above. Incise it as you have done on other veins, and let the blood flow according to your need."
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	"And then release the compression from the patient, keep your finger on the vein for an hour. Then apply cotton and powder, and strengthen that area with firm pressure. Leave it alone until it is healed."
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	"And already in the beginning of this book, I have described their remembrance and incision, and attraction."
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	"And therefore phlebotomy of the frontal vein is appropriate for treating ancient headaches, migraines, and severe or foul ulcers on the face."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And the quality of phlebotomy on it is as follows, which I recommend to you: have the patient compress their forehead with a bandage until the vein appears. Then take the instrument called 'fossor', whose shape is as follows:"
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	"Press the pointed tip of the 'fossor', which is at its head, against that vein and pierce it with a quick movement or another cause. Let the blood flow according to how much you want. Then release the puncture from the patient and compress it until it is healed."
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	"And sometimes it is useful to perform phlebotomy in a lateral direction, but it is not necessary that the phlebotomy be of acute termination like other phlebotomies. Rather, it should be performed transversely because the bone is nearby and would easily break if the phlebotomy were too fine."
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	"But the advantage of these two veins that are on the lacrimals of both eyes for scabies of the eyelids due to heat and sweat in them, and for diseases of the face."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	"And the quality of phlebotomy is this: have the patient compress their eyelid with a bandage, then perform phlebotomy on it while you are standing over their head."
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	"And the phlebotomy should be performed transversely and slightly diagonally with a fine phlebotomy needle because there is little flesh in that location. If the phlebotomy is too fine, it will easily break."
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	"And then make the blood flow as much as you need, and pause over those wounds. Then compress them for one night, and finally release them."
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	"But phlebotomy of the nasal vein is beneficial for acute fever and sudden sneezing, and for diseases of the face and migraines that occur there, especially when they are chronic."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	"And the quality of phlebotomy on it is this: have the patient hold their head and then take your left hand and place it over their nose. Then take a fine, long phlebotomy needle and insert it into the middle of the head of the nose in a straight line because the vein does not appear by touch here, and blood will begin to flow soon."
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	"It is necessary that you slowly withdraw your hand with the phlebotomy needle and make the blood flow according to your needs. Then compress it for one night because it will heal easily."
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	"But the benefit of phlebotomy on both wrists is for constriction of the armpit and the beginning of leprosy, as well as for many diseases, itching, and corrupting ulcers like herpes."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	"And the quality of phlebotomy on them is this: have each patient hold their arm with a cloth. Then stand over the head of the patient and have the patient sit on a seat."
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	"And then perform phlebotomy on the vein along the arm with a wide, fine needle little by little. Then remove blood according to a moderate quantity or as much as is needed. And do the same for the other vein."
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	"And then release the cloth and compress both veins with moderate pressure so that the patient is not fainted. Then leave them for the night because the wound will have healed by morning."
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	"And the benefit of phlebotomy on the veins in the armpits is for small apostemes and pustules of the mouth and corruption of the gums and ulcers and fissures, as well as ulcers that are in the nose and around it."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	"And the quality of phlebotomy on them is this: have the patient sit in front of you and compress their head with a bandage. Then turn their lips up and look for two veins, one on the right side of the lip and the other on the left. The demonstration of each is by its darkness, and this is more so because there are small black veins around them. Then incise each with an incident incision."
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	"But if you have any doubt and do not know which is one of them, then listen to the sound of their pulsation or observe the visible pus of those."
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	"And perform the same on both veins that are in the upper lips."
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	"However, it's customary to incise both veins located on the thigh."
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	"It is appropriate to perform flebotomy of the cephalic vein at the forearm, in cases of uvula inflammation, and mouth infections."
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	"And the quality of flebotomy is such that it should be done between the thumb and index finger, towards the sun, raising the tongue and observing both sides of the vein, noting the change in color to black."
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	"And then flebotomize each one; be careful not to exceed your hand in flebotomizing those, for there are arteries beneath them."
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And the veins that are flebotomized in the elbow are those in which blood is customarily drawn from all men. The flebotomy of these is performed in two ways: either by putting a mirtilated or olive-shaped lancet to it with subtle inclination; or by cutting with a cuticular flebotomy lancet, called 'alnessil', and this is the shape of it:"
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	"And this alnessil is that which conforms to the section and these are special edges and subtle according to the width of the veins and according to the thickness of those."
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	"Form of a mirtilated flebotomy:"
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	"It should have edges like this: so that it may open the concave veins full of blood appearing thickly, and those which contain dark, turbid blood."
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	"And this is the shape of a olive-shaped flebotomy:"
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	"And this flebotomy has less width and more subtle extremity; it is suitable for flebotomizing the subtle veins that contain clear, citrine-colored blood."
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	"But the benefit of flebotomizing the basilica vein, which is one of three veins, is that it draws out blood from illnesses that are located in the head and neck, and that which affects the feet and belly."
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	"And it is convenient for the flebotomist, when flebotomizing this one, that he guard this carefully and be above all fearful of it, because beneath it there is an artery. If he errs in the puncturing of the flebotomy lancet, he will incise that artery and cause a flux of blood to flow forth, therefore he should not flebotomize this with a puncturing flebotomy lancet, but rather cut with alnessil."
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if the basilica is not apparent by manifest appearance, then you should leave it and move to another, seeking some of its branches; or you should flebotomize in place of that the end of the arm where it is manifest, and cut that with an alnessil flebotomy lancet as we have said."
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	"But if you wish to flebotomize the elbow, then first at the thickness of the arm where you feel the pulse, press gently upon it with your thumb; and raise the arm and cut the vein with a concave section using an alnessil flebotomy lancet as we have said; and guard against percussing near some space of the location of the artery."
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	"And when you bind with a bandage, if there is swelling in the place that you have pressed with your thumb, then this swelling is swelling of the artery; therefore leave it."
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	"And if the blood flows in the flebotomy like a child's urine and the blood is thin red, then know that it is the blood of the artery; and therefore tighten your finger above that for some space; and then remove your finger, and if the blood is cut off, because many times it is cut off, then bind the arm and leave it."
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	"And guard against the illness of the wound, and be above all fearful of it, and do not move that for some days until it is healed."
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	"But if the blood is not cut off and yet it continues to flow, then this medicine is not present; therefore you have incised the artery if it appears to you. Because the extremity of it is contracted and the blood is cut off, or take some cotton wool, compress that, and apply it over the location of the vein with pressure using a bandage and powder for another day."
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	"And therefore if the blood is cut off, good. But if not, then cure it with that of which we have spoken at the recollection of the location of the powders cutting off flux of blood."
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	"And the stopping of the flow of blood from it is difficult in many dispositions because of the smallness of the wound and the possibility of tying the arm."
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	"But the flebotomy of the black vein is beneficial because it draws out blood from the upper part of the head and from below the body. Because it is composed of branches of the basilica and branches of the cephalica, as we have said."
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	"And it is necessary for the flebotomist to be above all fearful in the flebotomy of that one because below it there is a nerve. And therefore if he errs in the puncturing of the flebotomy lancet and strikes the nerve, then numbness will occur, and its healing is difficult and sometimes it cannot be completely healed. This nerve can often be felt; but if it is hidden to some people and is subtle and does not appear, then you should pause the flebotomy with the lancet with which you are flebotomizing with a concave section, and avoid the nerve with your strength."
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	"And if the vein is between two nerves, then cut the vein along its length."
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	"The benefit of phlebotomy on the temporal vein is that it draws blood from the head and alleviates illnesses of the eyes."
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	"And this is where you should puncture if you want to perform phlebotomy with the olive style or the myrtle style; for it is the safest vein, since neither artery nor nerve is left."
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	"But remember that you must perform phlebotomy so as not to puncture the head of the lacert only lightly, seek out the spot carefully, and do not strike it unless it is first anesthetized with percussion several times at that location for phlebotomy."
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	"But sometimes an abscess forms in some people if they are not phlebotomized during the first percussion; but do not touch that abscess."
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	"But the quality of this phlebotomy and its accidents are such that you must consider their correction."
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	"The first thing you should know is that phlebotomy is administered only for the preservation of health and in hopes of preventing illnesses, and with caution against their occurrence. And that phlebotomy should be performed on one of the veins that are located on the elbow, namely: the cephalic, the basilic, and the median cubital vein; and that it should be performed at the beginning of spring, after fasting in spring and autumn, and near mealtime in winter, when signs ofpletion appear."
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	"And phlebotomy should be performed on the third day or even earlier, provided that at least three hours have passed since the previous meal."
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	"But phlebotomy should be administered whenever it provokes convenience and necessity for that person, whether at night or during the day, at any hour and at all times."
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	"And children should not be phlebotomized until they have reached the age of fourteen; pregnant women should not be phlebotomized until the fourth month has passed from conception to the seventh month; and the elderly, once they have surpassed seventy years of age, should not be phlebotomized."
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	"And before anyone wishes to be phlebotomized, they must cleanse their intestines with a lion's clister if there is much retained feces in them, so that the veins do not draw the superfluities from the purification of the intestines during phlebotomy, which would harm the principal members."
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	"And patients with sacred illness or drunkenness should not be phlebotomized until they have recovered from their condition; nor those who are suffering from fever or intoxication. Phlebotomy should be avoided near colic pain and vomiting, and near abdominal complaints, and near multiplication of coitus and work and exercise during fasting or vigils, and due to any cause that dissolves the virtues, i.e., bodily or animal."
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	"And before phlebotomy, consider the refinement of humors, and if the blood is thick, use foods and drinks to thin it out, and medications if possible."
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	"And before phlebotomy, take a bath if there is no prohibition due to any cause, or stimulate with some exercise so that the blood may be subtilized."
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And pause phlebotomy at the foot of the day, especially around the hour of terce, as we have said."
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	"And perform phlebotomy only when the foot of that day is guarded from all harmful animal accidents, such as anxiety, anger, fear, and from all harmful bodily accidents, such as excessive work, fatigue, coitus, etc."
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	"And at his seat, let there be present the causes in use which are customary for men with aromatics and perfumes, balms, etc., according to their quantity of possibility."
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	"And let the phlebotomist sit on a stool that is higher than the stool of the person who is to be phlebotomized."
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	"And first, extract his arm and rub it with the phlebotomist's hand two or three times to warm it up; then tie the limb with a bandage twice."
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	"And let the tying be moderate, for if it is too tight or there is an excess of superfluity in the tying, it will impede the flow of blood; but if it is too loose, it will cause weakness of the blood."
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	"And after tying, let him who is to be phlebotomized rub his hands together until the veins are swollen and can be felt."
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.
