"And the phlebotomist should anoint his lancet with a little ancient olive oil specifically; and then place his left index finger on that vein where he wishes to perform phlebotomy, so that the vein may swell slightly and the percussion be steady, for one of the veins which is about to be opened will throb like a string, and that one which is full of windiness will contract under the lancet, revealing itself to the phlebotomist; and he should not open the vein until it has been felt by the finger, and if he opens it, it must be narrow."
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	"And therefore, it is necessary that the phlebotomist be firm and attentive to all these causes."
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	"And then withdraw the lancet, but if the vein fills up at once, that is good. But if not, repeat this process in another part nearby, or even above it, with haste, provided there is no apostema."
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	"But if the location is inflamed or the condition worsens, then leave it for a day or two, do not tighten the bandage, lest it draw forth an ulcerated inflammation, nor take a bath."
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	"And repeat phlebotomy if necessary."
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	"If the opening is small and blood flows out subtly, and you fear that not enough blood will come out, then repeat the lancet in that same place according to rectitude and adjust the opening slightly, and do this with haste before the location becomes inflamed, for many people's locations become inflamed due to a small opening."
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	"But if the location is already inflamed, then do not repeat it there, for it will serve no purpose. Rather, pause on some part of the oil groove to ease the flow of blood."
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	"And oil is better in this location than any other ointment."
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	"And similarly, administer an oil groove in every phlebotomy where veins are opened with the prohibition of blood flow, and they do this by applying treacle, alfalfa, and sage when pausing on one of those locations, for blood is subtilized and made to revolve when it is thick."
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	"If a large inflammation has arisen in the location of phlebotomy, which happens many times, especially to those who have not been bled before or whose vein opening was small, then apply a sponge soaked in water and salt, lightly scorched, over that place for an hour, for it will be dissolved."
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	"And this should be done immediately after the blood has flowed from that vein or another one."
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	"If a blackness or greenness remains in the location for several days, do not worry about it. But if you wish, apply some solution of aloe and myrrh, or some juice of mint, chamomile, or the like."
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	"And many times apostemes and elevations happen due to phlebotomy at the basilica."
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	"Then place your hand over that and if you still feel softness under your pressure, then that elevation is harmful and bad. And therefore be sure to apply some of what we have said there to prevent the flow of arterial blood."
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"Prepare a plaster with something that has astringent properties to harden the area, then treat it with another cure until it is healed."
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	"It is necessary to draw blood from each person according to their quantity of vital force and the prevailing color above their blood."
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	"But if the blood is black, then let it flow until it becomes red; and similarly if you find it thick, then let it flow until it becomes subtiliated; and similarly if it is sharp, until its sharpness has been diminished."
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	"And for someone who is full and robust and needs bloodletting at one time, the venipuncture should be widened and the incision made wide."
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	"And for someone who is cold, do the opposite of what was done for the previous person, and let them bleed in several sessions, with a narrow incision."
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	"It is better to make a transverse section of the vein when performing venipuncture than to prick it."
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	"And this method of bloodletting preserves against the flow of blood and injury to nerves, and it is safer and more laudable than bloodletting by width and length."
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	"And when syncope is about to occur during bloodletting, you should care for the patient beforehand with a little powder of millet seeds or simple sage infused in wine; and let out their blood in three or four sessions."
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	"And if it is coldness of temperament, then take before bloodletting a powder to infuse in a syrup of myrrh or in an aromatic syrup sweetened with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger and the like, or in a highly fragrant aromatic syrup."
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	"And if syncope occurs during bloodletting and it is due to the letting out of much blood, then you should give them to drink water of meat and highly fragrant syrup; and apply aromatics with aloe, and let them lie quietly on their side."
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	"And use the other causes that we have mentioned in the division of syncope by evacuation."
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	"And whoever wants to expand his veins and dissolve his blood according to the second method should let out blood from him with venipuncture for much evacuation, and the power of it is cold, which evacuates blood little by little, so it depends on the amount of power in consecutive days."
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	"But whoever wants to expand his veins and draw out his blood a second time, and his body is strong, then do so about seven or nine hours after the first venipuncture."
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	"But whoever wants to draw out blood from his body contrary to the direction that it declines, should have it expanded on the second or third day."
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	"But in that body in which there is little blood already let out and it is acrid and causes fever to occur, you should draw out blood from him in one session and draw out a large quantity of it, and amplify the aperture until syncope occurs; for you will have preserved all the conditions of bloodletting; and place your hand on his pulse before the body's blood, so that death does not happen instead of syncope, for many times this happens when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent."
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	"And when you want to release the veins and evacuate blood a second time, since the opening of the vein is closed and it is difficult to draw out blood, do not press with violence and curvature, but gently extend it; for this is very bad."
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	"Let him lie down again until he is phlebotomized a second time; or remove it with the acuteness of the bloodletting that has coagulated in the opening of the vein; or place upon it tyriaca alfarach, or sage, and press it gently until the blood flows out."
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	"And if the vein is inflamed, then leave that one alone and do not touch it until the inflammation has subsided."
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	"And if necessity provokes you to evacuate blood a second time, and there is no excuse for it, then draw blood from him on that spot or in the other arm in another vein."
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	"And the vein called 'funis of the arm' is bloodletted in place of the furca or the basilica when they are not available or concealed, for it is composed of those."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	"And the quality of bloodletting from it is that the patient should immerse his hand in cold water until the fleshy part reddens and the vein appears manifestly."
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	"And it should be stretched out with a linen bandage with moderate tension; and bloodletting should be done according to the transverse line, not latitudinally nor according to the longitude."
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	"And let the aperture be wide and your bloodletting with which you bloodlet him be on the junction of his hand a little bit."
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	"And if the flow of blood is prohibited, then immerse your hand in cold water again and let the blood run into the water until your necessity is satisfied."
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	"But if you are in the days of summer, then you are exempt from immersing your hand in cold water; and let the body's blood be placed in cold water during wintertime."
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	"And bloodletting from this vein is safer than from all other veins, for it has neither a pulsating vein nor nerves."
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	"And bloodletting from the little bag of the right hand is beneficial for diseases of the liver."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	"And the quality of bloodletting from it is that you should stretch out the hand with linen or your hand, since you have placed it in cold water, until the vein is inflated and clearly demonstrated to view; and draw blood transversely from it; and if you should happen to miss it entirely, do not concern yourself about it."
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	"And take care that you do not extend your hand too much during bloodletting, for there are the nerves of these veins denuded of flesh."
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	"And appropriately immerse the hand in cold water and let the blood run into it, for if you do not immerse it in cold water, the blood will coagulate in the opening of the vein and its flow is prohibited."
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	"And when blood has been extracted according to the quantity required, then place oil and salt on the vein so that it does not close suddenly; and do likewise in every straight vein."
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	"But the benefit of bloodletting from that of the left hand is that it is beneficial for diseases of the spleen."
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	"And do likewise in bloodletting from it as you have done with the other."
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	"And the benefit of bloodletting from the vein called sephena is for diseases that are in the parting of the limbs, such as diseases of the womb, and retention of menses, and for diseases of the joints and ulcers of skin and old scars, and their like diseases."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	"And the quality of bloodletting from it is that the patient should immerse his foot in cold water and make friction upon it until the veins appear clearly; and tie a bandage on the junction of the foot; and the place where the vein appears is behind the said foot, and it branches out into many ramifications on the front of the foot."
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	"And therefore draw blood from the most abundant branch or that which is nearest to the heel behind the aggregation of it; for it is better and safer."
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	"And if you draw blood from it on the face of the foot, then take care of the nerves that are close to it on the face of the foot, and make your bloodletting with that with which you would cut, namely transversely."
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	"And if you wish, perform a phlebotomy."
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	"But if the bleeding is forbidden; then immerse the patient's foot in cold water and let the blood flow into that container until it has stopped."
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if the phlebotomist errs on the first attempt, then retry with the phlebotomy later in that area because it will have healed by now. And do not fear the patient's maliciousness but be wary of the nerves as we have said."
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	"And similarly act regarding the vein of the other foot accordingly."
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	"And concerning the sciatic vein, the location is roughly at the level of the heel on the posterior aspect of the leg."
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	"The benefit of phlebotomy for him is to ease his hip pain when it is due to hot blood."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	"The quality of the phlebotomy for him is that the patient enters into a bath, and he quickly and strongly ties his left hip joint with a long thin bandage so that only that appears."
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	"And then when it appears, immediately phlebotomize that vein according to your ability and according to the transverse vein, and this is better. Or else cut that with an incision or dissect it with a section because the location of it has healed."
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	"And it is in many men not visible; and if you find that vein, but it does not appear at all to the touch, then phlebotomize some branch of it, and that is which appears on the back of the hand towards the said auricular and the annular bones."
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	"And beware of the nerves, and let flow as much blood as you wish."
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	"And then untie the ligation and pause over the site of phlebotomy until it stops flowing, because it heals quickly."
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	"Regarding venesection and its qualities for use."
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	"Wounds are of horn, or of iron, or of vein."
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	"And ventosing is done in two ways: one is by scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is ventosing without scarification."
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	"And this ventosing which is done without scarification is performed in two ways: with fire or without fire."
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	"And the locations on the body where ventosas are administered with scarification and extraction of blood are fourteen in number, of which the first one is placed near the bladder, which is the last section of the head; and the middle location of it, divided into two parts, is at the nape of the neck; and ventosas of the chin beneath the jawbone below the mouth; and ventosas of both shoulders; and ventosas of the hip bones, which are above the buttocks; and ventosas of both knees, which are on both thighs; and ventosas of both ankles; and ventosas of both elbows."
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	"And ventosing does not extract blood from the large veins, but only from the small ones scattered throughout the flesh, and for this reason it does not draw out the humor by that means, as is done by phlebotomy. And it is not necessary to perform ventosing with fire or without fire in any illness caused bypletion until the whole body has been evacuated."
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	"But if there is a need to provoke ventosing for an illness or continuous fever, we administer it at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, and in the middle of it, and at any time."
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	"This is why in men there are those in whom blood is multiplied so that they need extraction of it by ventosing and they find heaviness and sadness; and those who findpletion and heat in their face and head, and neck; and those who find pressure in their face and forehead and darkness and dullness in their eyes; and those whose location for ventosing is difficult to find; and those whose laughter is multiplied; and those who find a taste of blood in their mouth, or whose tongue is covered with blood and they spit it out; and those whose sleep is multiplied, and those who see blood in their dreams, redness and ants and plagues and other causes according to their appearance."
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	"And therefore, whenever there is such a cause in any of those cases, and especially if it is on the third or midday of the month, we command that ventosing be performed after two or three hours have passed since that time."
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	"And the benefit of ventosing on the nape is that when it relieves heaviness in the head and causes sinking into the eyes. But this should be accompanied by evacuation of the whole body."
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	"And this ventosing is in the place of phlebotomy on the cephalic vein."
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	"And it is not lawful to use it for one who has full flesh, or in whom there is catarrh, because it causes great harm."
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	"And therefore, one should not use it on the elderly, and on those whose heads have hot illnesses."
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	"But one who is continuous about it may cause forgetfulness. And therefore, you should command the ventosing to pause his hand a little at the beginning of the operation, fearing the generation of forgetfulness."
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	"But ventosing of alkehel (madder) is in the place of phlebotomy on the vein nigra and basilica: And therefore it causes asthma, and constriction of the lung, and splitting of the windpipe of the lung, and coughing, andpletion."
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	"And therefore, madder ventosing should be a little paced out, because if it is too sudden it causes weakness in the body and stomach."
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	"And the ventosing of alhagadhan (henbane) causes accidental pains in the head and inflammation of the eyes, migraine, suffocation, and pains in the roots of teeth. And it is in the place of phlebotomy on the basilica vein."
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	"And you should command the ventoser not to press his hand with the scarification so that he does not wound the artery and cause bleeding."
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	"And ventosing of the chin causes coldness in the mouth, corruption of the gums, and appearance of diseases that are in the mouth. And it is in the place of phlebotomy on those veins that are on the two lips."
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	"But ventosing that is performed on the two spatulas causes headache, which occurs due topletion of heat."
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	"And the ventosing of both sides of the temples causes benefit from phlebotomy on three veins: namely the basilica, nigra and cephalica. Because it attracts blood from all those veins that are in the flesh, and those small veins that are between the other thicker veins so that the attraction reaches the three veins."
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	"And command the ventoser not to proceed with scarification because the place is devoid of flesh, and too near are nerves and arteries."
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	"And it is a ventosing performed on the buttocks which causes hemorrhoids of the anus and ulcers nearby."
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	"And you should command the ventoser to perform a large ventosing with an earthen pot. Because that place requires strong suction; and few subtle attracted ventosings are performed, and it should be scarified with scarification."
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	"But ventosings on the fleshy camels [thighs] cause strong diminution by clear diminution. Because they attract blood from all over the body and cause old pains in the kidneys and belly, and stimulate menstruation, and cause botch and ademoma [hemorrhoids]. And they are in the place of phlebotomy on two saphenas, alarcochan, and two cavillas."
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	"However, they debilitate the whole body and cause fainting in many people."
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	"And from the benefits of alarcochan ventosing, the benefit is close to the benefit of two camber [thigh] ventosings."
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	"And the quality of the position of ventosings is that you pause the ventosing at the beginning, wait and suck moderately, and do not prolong the position of the ventosings, but rather pause them lightly and remain them carefully. And let the humors come to the place by gentle arrival."
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	"And do not cease iterating this and continuing until you see the place already reddened, swollen, and the appearance of blood's hue."
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	"And then you should scarify and iterate suction little by little, and carefully consider the disposition of the body."
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	"Because that person who has tender flesh and few pores should be scarified once only, not more than that. Because the place may become ulcerated."
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	"And command the ventoser to enlarge the scarification a little and press gently, and temper the suction with ease."
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	"And if the blood is thickened then you should scarify twice. Because in the first time the way of subtilization of blood and its wateriness is opened."
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	"But in the second one, the extraction of thick blood is obtained through scrutinization."
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	"And if the blood is very fetid then there should be no scarification in the third time so that it can succeed [the ventosing]."
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	"Finally, when we want to extract blood little by little or a little, one scarification is enough for us."
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	"And if we want to extract a lot of blood, we should scarify with many scarifications. And if we know that the blood is thick then we should scarify by pressing scarification."
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	"And the term of scarification means only the depth of the skin."
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	If the chain is thick, hard, dark, and its pores are narrow, make sure the places for cups are anointed leniently, opened, loosened; if it is summer time, thus with oil of aloe or violet oil, or oil of crushed walnuts, or oil of chamomile flowers; but if it is winter time, then use narcissus oil, or lily oil, or camomile oil, or blood oil, and those like these.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	If the swelling is large and fiery, then use oil of amaranth, or balm oil, or aloe oil, or pennyroyal oil, and those like these.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the cupping glass has wide pores of tender flesh, then it is necessary to prohibit oil, and for this one the places of cups near the cupping should be washed with warm or hot water of solatrum, or chamomile water, or borages water, and similar things.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for him whose blood is of much humidity, wash his cups with sour wine or myrtle and sumac water, and similar things.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for him whose swellings are large, wash his cups with old wine or water of sanicle, which is marjoram, or decoction of fennel, or chamomile, and those like these.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And it is necessary that cupping should be guarded beforehand from bathing. It is also necessary that it should be administered near immersion in the bath for one or two hours, and it is necessary that he should sleep near cupping.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	"What is this: That it is necessary to guard the person being cupped before cupping."
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	At the beginning you should consider: if the one doing the cupping or bleeding is choleric and vents upon hot blood and inflammation, then he should take cooling causes, such as sour cherries, endive with vinegar and lettuce, and secanolbin, and julep, and those like these.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And pause their foods thus as polenta, and fowl meats roasted, and foods seasoned with sour things, and those like these.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for him whose complexion is cold, it is necessary that he should drink hippocrates syrup of almonds or hippocrates syrup of fennel seeds and sumac, and fragrant wine better between young and old; and that he be commanded to use scarcity of drinking and eating, and pause foods of polenta and canabis and fish and small birds and pigeons.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And it is necessary that on the day of cupping and bleeding he should drink more than eat food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And it is necessary that in some hours certain people should be given tyriaca altharac or musk medicaments, such as musk or muscated wine before cupping or bleeding or near them, so that the principal members may be comforted and the blood subtilized; but they should not take that scalding.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	Mark those cupping glasses that are without scarification as being on the liver, and on the spleen and podagra, and on the navel, in the joints of the loins, and on the anus, because these members do not suffer scarification upon them.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired by those except for attraction of blood from the member, thus as pause cupping on the breast in illness of flux of blood from the nose; and they use that for the dissolution of cold ventosity undissolved from the member, such as pause on the belly and navel; because that rarifies the member and scalds it and removes pain because it resolves ventosity.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And already cupping is paused on the nostrils when there occurs in their obstruction or phlegm because by virtue of strong attraction it draws out obstruction and expels phlegm from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	Similarly, it does when paused on the liver and spleen to draw forth ventosity that is enclosed within them.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	These cupping glasses are administered with suction alone; some times they are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	Some times they are administered full of cold water in illnesses of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is why the cupping glass should be filled and made larger, that is cold water alone or water in which herbs are cooked according to what is convenient.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of cupping glass administered with fire: the width of the mouth should be as we have formed it; and the quantity of the preon should be the most of a palm; and it should be on the side of him, in the place that is in the circuit, the most of him, the traction should be little according to the quantity that enters him through a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It should be made of red earthenware or glass, with thick rims, lion's teeth, edges and smooth for that it does not wound the member through its position on him.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in the middle of it a transverse wick of earthenware or iron should be placed on which a candle is paused with fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And already this cupping glass should be much larger than that which we have recommended; and the little one less according to the illnesses and the state of him who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	The cupping glasses of children and weak ones are other than those of youths and strong-bodied people.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	The quality of pausing this cupping glass with fire on the member is that it extends the mecha with fire of wood decently before a small candle of wax, and pauses that on the middle of the transverse wick in the middle place of the cupping glass, so that the fire may be kindled around the partition of the sides so that not the skin of the sick person may be burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And soon it should be paused on the member of the sick person, and the said thread should be on the traction that we have said, until when we hold the cupping glasses and do not desire to pull the thread, then the vapor will rise over that traction, at that time the cupping glass will soon be dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then light the wick according to its manner, and renew it if necessary.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in cupping glass that is administered in the illness of pleurisy with water, in which there is no transverse wick nor traction, and it is not administered except that it should be filled with water, and it is paused on the member alone.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its shape: This cupping glass the larger it is, the better, for that it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter XCVII
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Blood-letting cups are not administered on large members except on those in which the position of cupping glasses is not possible because of their smallness, such as the throat and gums and similar ones; or on member denuded of flesh, such as the thigh and nose and theirs.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using them is that if found blood-sucking leeches that are in the waters of putridity clean.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And soon they should be placed day and night in putrid water until they are hungry, and that no cause remains in the belly of them; and soon the body should be evacuated at the beginning with phlebotomy and cupping glasses; and soon rub the member of the sick person until it becomes red; and soon pause them on him.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and satisfied.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to draw out the matter with cupping glass, it is better in judgment.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	But if not, then wash the place with sour wine and soon with much water; and let it be rubbed and expressed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the course of blood is prolonged because of the wound of the blood-sucking leeches, and it becomes red, then you should put a cloth soaked in hot water on him so that the bleeding may be stopped.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	"When blood is increased, then powdered vitriol trisulfate is applied, or poultices and similar causes of obstruction are used until the bleeding is stopped; or raw mung beans may be placed on the spot."
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	"And also, if necessary, the application of leeches for bloodletting should be repeated when possible.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	"And if the application of leeches by suspension is prohibited, then the spot should be rubbed with fresh blood or a needle inserted into it until some blood flows out; and immediately afterward compresses should be applied, because those who feel any blood flowing at once should adhere to them."
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	"And when you want them to stop, powder a little alum Trisulfate or salt or ash on them, and immediately they will cease."
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Here begins the prologue of the third part: On restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very often necessary in the art of medicine, and it concerns the reduction (setting) of fractures and accidental luxations of bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	"Oh son, know that those who boast about this chapter are foolish doctors and common folk, and those who at any time have not regarded the books of the Ancients nor read even one letter of them."
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	"And because of this, the manner of practicing the science in our land has become private; and I myself am not oblivious at all to this during this good time. And I have not added what follows except out of respect for the length of reading the books of the Ancients and study on their understanding, so that I might extract the knowledge from them."
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	"And moreover, I direct this to experiment and study throughout the length of my life."
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	"And I have already described in this chapter everything that my knowledge contains and on which my experiment has passed; because here I have abbreviated it for you others and delivered it from the occupation of lengthening. And I have abbreviated it to the utmost degree of abbreviation, and I have demonstrated it to the utmost degree of declaration, and I have formed many forms of the instruments that are administered in this one, as is done by addition of declaration, just as I have done in two preceding chapters."
Capitol primier.	Chapter One
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	"Summary and collections from the essence of bone fractures, from which a preamble is necessary before we begin to remember the members that have been broken and their different types."
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	"Therefore, I will begin this chapter by stating the summaries of what will be said, and the chapters that require understanding at the beginning for those who wish to master this art and remain firm on its truth; namely you and others who are eager to know or learn this noble art."
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	"And so I say that when an accident occurs such as a fracture or dislocation or torsion or compression, it is necessary at the beginning to apply flebotomy or bleeding to that person, or sometimes both, if there is no prohibition of any cause such as debility of power, or if he is an infant or old in decrepitude, or during times of great heat or cold."
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	"And moreover, let him be content with his food of fresh herbs and the flesh of birds and crabs; and let him prohibit heavy meats and filling foods, and all foods that fill the veins with blood, so that you may be sure of a safe cauterization, and not fear an effusion of matter to the member."
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	"And then return the patient to his first regimen, with which he is accustomed to live."
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	"And then, when the broken bone begins to be restored, it is necessary that the patient be fed nutritious foods of abundant and heavy nutrition with viscosity, such as foods made from wheat cooked with water, rice, chickpeas, eggs, beef, butter, fresh cheese, thick wine, and similar foods. And with this regimen, coagulation of the fracture occurs more gently and quickly."
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	"And know that bones are more brittle in men who are in the first age of life and in the decrepit, it is not possible for them to be continued and consolidated according to their nature due to the drying out of their members."
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	"And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature at all times due to the drying out of those members, and they are continued and consolidated in those that are of them at the end of old age, just as the bones of young infants."
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	"But nevertheless, nature adjusts and unites the bone that has been broken from any cause similar to glue with which it adheres and strengthens it until they are simultaneously conglutinated and united together, until the end of its strength and firmness, just as fire at the beginning until no cause prohibits it from its work."
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And for this reason it is necessary that you pause the foods of the patient, foods in which there is gravity and viscosity and heaviness, as we have said."
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	"Great diversity in fractures according to the diversity of the member."
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	"And know that the species of fractures are diverse according to the diversity of the members, for a fracture of the bone of the leg is different from a fracture of the bone of the head; and a fracture of the bone of the foot is different from a fracture of the bone of the hand; and similarly all other members are diverse among themselves."
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	"And I come with remembrance of every species of fracture, explained in its own chapter distinguished from the others."
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	"Great diversity even within the same fracture."
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	"And the species of bone fractures are diversified among themselves; for there is an arched fracture that occurs sometimes in stars; and sometimes there is a fracture according to the length of the bone: these are the fractures of the lower jaw, upper jaw, and additional proceeding and non-proceeding ones, such as those made when preparing a pen to write, and there is a fracture with swelling and disruption at the head, and there is a small fissure-like fracture."
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	"And for each species there will be its own treatment in the restoration of it, according to what will come later distinguished in its places."
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	"Many signs of bone fracture."
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	"And for this reason a fracture of the bone is known: its twisting, and the prominence and appearance of it to the touch, and that of it when you compress it with your hand."
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	"And then when there is no twisting apparent in the place nor is it done by your touch when you touch the bone with agitation and the patient finds little pain, then there is no fracture here."
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	"It may happen that there is only slight twisting or a small fissure, so it is not necessary to move it with your hand and compress all of it. Rather, pause on this place with the medicines about which remembrance will come at that moment which is appropriate for the place; and especially let there be strictness by means of subtle constriction."
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	"And know that the place when it is arched and not split into two or other than those that occur in the jawbone, if all the parts of its companion are removed, then you should begin from your own hour to rectify it having applied a cauterizing plaster to it."
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	"And if a cauterizing plaster is applied to it, then leave it alone for several days until the plaster stops. And then move it according to each manner that you are able by raising and moving."
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	"And know that the restoration and alignment of it is easier than for the bone in which a jawbone fracture has occurred."
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	"And then strengthen it according to what will come later its remembrance."
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	"But if it is the jawbone, then it will be necessary to extend this broken member from both parts, if it is the hand or foot. Or with your hand if the member is small. Or with two ropes or one rope and your hand."
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	"And let your position be such that you place the affected limb according to its natural shape, while ensuring that the parts are extended as much as possible. Then proceed to remove any excess fluid in accordance with each manner that you may find in their places."
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	"And be careful according to your skill that you do not harm the patient through your operation of their limbs or cause them any injury. And proceed according to your ability, applying one bone with another according to their best forms."
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	"And see that at this opportune moment you touch the patient with your hand gently and if there should be any other cause, correct it and reduce it according to the amount of your strength."
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	"And avoid violent extension and compression, as do many foolish physicians who often cause an abscess to form through their operation, or cause contraction in the limb, as we have seen happen many times."
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	"And apply annexes, appropriate extension and gentle operation with strapping of the limb, and rest and tranquility. Instruct the patient about this and warn them not to move that member during their waking hours or sleeping, nor twist it nor cause any disturbance to its movement nor evacuation. And await until the position of the limb is such that there is no pain; for when they feel discomfort in the disposition of the limb due to their injury, then you must change it to another disposition where there is no pain. And ensure that the position of that member is correct and even so that the limb does not become twisted upon its restoration."
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	"And the quality of strapping for a tranquil limb is what I recommend; because you should know that broken limbs are diverse in their smallness and greatness, and in their form."
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	"And for those that are small, such as the arm, hand, and foot, and similar ones, then the wrapping should be made of very soft cloth."
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	"But those that are large, such as the thigh or calf, should have a firm and hard wrapping; because the tight wrapping connects the limb strongly on all sides with equal strapping, so that there is no gap."
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	"And first, begin your evacuation of the hematoma by placing suitable linen on that location for three or four wrappings according to the size of the limb. And bind it tightly with your hand using the linen."
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	"And then, above that at the beginning of the location of the fracture, bind again with another wrapping so that your previous strapping is not loosened from where you have strapped the fracture."
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	"And then extend your wrapping of the location of the fracture a little further downwards and slowly loosen the strapping a bit at a time until you reach its upper part."
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	"And then take another bandage and wrap it again over the location of the fracture with a wrapping, and then proceed upwards with the wrappings away from the fracture; and your operation should be in the tightening of the wrapping and loosening of it according to what has been said regarding the first wrapping."
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	"And then insert between the wrappings a wisp of wool or cloth with which to correct any twisting of the fracture if there is any twisting in it. And if not, do not place anything in it for any reason."
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	"And then place another bandage on top and bind it gently over these wrappings with proper care, if there is no inflammation or abscess in that location. And if there is an inflammation or abscess, then place the bandage over what covers the inflammation or sits on the abscess; and leave it for a few days. And then you should tighten the wrappings."
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	"And the splints should be made of soft, fine-grained cane, well-formed; or they may be made of hazelwood; or branches of palm tree. And each splint should be of this width and shape:"
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	"However, the splint placed over that fracture should be thicker and broader than the other splints, and its length should correspond to the size of the limb. And then bind over the splints with another bandage according to your first strapping. And then tie it gently on top according to what has been said about strapping; and ensure that your strapping is according to the location of the fracture, and the further away from the fracture, the looser should be the strapping."
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	"And the threads should be soft and fine in thickness. And if the threads are thick, as I have seen some people do when they use cords of twisted flax, it is a great mistake because it makes the strapping uneven."
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	"And very fine threads are not suitable either because you will not be able to tighten as much with them as you want. And there should not be less than a finger's width between splint and splint."
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	"And if the patient feels discomfort at the ends of the splints near the strapping, then place some wool or lamb's wool between them until it ceases to cause injury."
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	"Some fractures are with displacement, such as in the elbow joint, and this happens occasionally. I have spoken about this in Chapter II on Particularities."
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	"And know that not every fractured limb should be immobilized with splints on the first day. The reason for this is that when a limb is large, it does not require splints to be placed over it immediately, but rather after 2, 3 or more days depending on your assurance of whether an abscess will form."
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	"And this is the method used by plasterers with which the Ancients used to treat fractures and dislocations and twists."
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	"Method of plastering commonly used for treating fractures, suitable especially for complicated cases and mainly for women and children because it does not allow heat or friction. And this is how you should proceed: Take some powder from the mill, which is the bran left behind after sifting the flour."
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	"And then sieve it with album of egg whites and make a paste that is neither too thick nor too thin. And then use this."
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	"Another method of plastering for treating fractures and dislocations and twists: Take assafetida, ladanum, acacia, enula, and millet flour, which is ground from wild grains; mix them together with mirrh and aloe in equal parts. Then sift everything thoroughly and combine it with chicory water or egg whites if the condition is scalded. And then use this plaster because it has a good composition and treats lightly fractured bones well. It benefits many people."
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	"Another method of plastering that is suitable for treating fractures and twists: Take millet flour and white wheat flour in equal parts, 10 drachms each; mirrh and aloe, one-half drachm each; acacia, six drachms; and bol armenic, twenty drachms."
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	"All these are ground together in a mortar with great care and sifted. Then they are mixed with water or egg whites and applied."
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	"Method of plastering for joints and bones separated from their places, which cause pain in those areas and for cracks and fractures: Take raw wool, immerse it in sour wine and cooked oil, and place it over the location."
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	"But this plaster is not useful for restoring broken bones or drawing out pus. It only serves to relieve pain."
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	"Another method of plastering that restores broken bones: Take fig leaves and wild poppy leaves; combine them together and make a plaster from them."
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	"A plaster for healing and treating fractures of the bone and to resolve any remaining abscess: take roots of mallow, chamomile flowers, violet flowers, flour from oats, all in equal parts; all ground together and cooked with wine. If the member is not cut."
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	"If it is scratched, then wash it with cold water or with water from a bunch of celery, and use it."
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	"Another plaster for healing abscesses that is stronger than the first one, when an abscess occurs during the restoration of a member: take roots of mallow and its seeds, and balm, melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, all ground together; all are ground together and cooked with water from walnut trees or with sweet water or with wine, all according to the quality of the member and the restfulness of its color."
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	"But Hippocrates does not specify in his book that it should be placed on the member when the restoration of it is broken, but rather a plaster made from wax and oil and nothing else; and he recommends that it should be mixed between thickness and fineness."
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	"However, Galen says that they should be placed on the broken member during its restoration and he gives as causes of drying with little heat, like myrrh, incense and similar things, those same causes which we have recommended."
