Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	"A way to make a plaster that relieves injury and pain: take ground frankincense, aloes, peeled human skin or chicken feathers, mallow, salt, all ground together; they should be sieved and sifted and cooked, and made into a plaster."
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	"However, the quantity that should remain on the bandage and which should be gradually removed is this: if there is no pain or swelling nor is the bone broken, then you do not need to remove it for many days."
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	"And if pain or swelling or inflammation occurs in the place, then you should immediately remove it and discard that plaster."
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	"And take a cloth and wet sea sponge, and immerse that in hot water, and with it wash the inner part of the place until that swelling has ceased and the pain has been soothed; and then let the member rest for an hour; and then apply over it clean wool immersed in sour wine and oil or rose oil, and wrap it around it for a night so that you are sure of cauterizing the abscess and that the inflammation of the member is removed and the pain from it has gone away."
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And then apply that fine dressing and plaster again in small quantity and do not tighten too much with your first binding, but rather bind it more subtly until it is healed."
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	"And if at some point the abscess and heat and pain and inflammation and all accidents have been removed entirely, and you need plaster and binding again, then you should apply it in the same way as you did at the beginning."
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	"And if no cause of those that we have mentioned occurs to the member, then you should not remove it but rather leave it on for three or four or five or seven days; and sometimes all of this is left on for twenty days according to how it appears to you through the removal of the bandage from the member, as we have said, until the fracture adheres and approaches the coagulation of the flesh over it."
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	"And then tighten the binding more than your first binding all around, and adjust it according to the swelling of the wound of the sick person, as it is recalled."
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	"But if you see that the place of the fracture has dried out and become shriveled more than it should, then you should know that nourishment is prohibited from coming to that place; therefore, immerse that in hot water every time you remove it, and do this for all three days; and loosen the binding a little, and by this operation the member will receive nourishment, and it will be healed easily."
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	"But what foolish restorers of the fracture of the member do again when it is not restored at first, according to what is necessary, and is restored crookedly, is error according to their operation, great fear, and if they had been right this would have enlarged the Ancients in their books and taught with that operated."
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	"And I have not seen any of them do this, so it is more reasonable that they should not do it."
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	"Chapter according to: On fracture when it occurs in the head."
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	"The kinds of fractures are many, and their figures are diverse, and their causes are distinct. For some fractures happen by percussion of a blow, and the percussion leaves all the bone inside the head, which is left behind like the wood in the tree trunk, and for this reason this species is called 'asciacion.' Or the blow cuts through some part of the bone, cutting into the flesh but not passing through to the other side. This species of fracture is called 'levation absolute.'"
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	"And the plague of these two fractures is great or little, and of fracture that is contusion or abrasion. The cause of it is percussion with heavy blow or impact on stone, and things similar to them."
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	"And this fracture is penetrating and approaches the periosteum, which is left behind with the bone, or it is on the surface of the bone. The plague of these two fractures is great or little."
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	"And there is fracture that is jammed into the bone in the thinness of a hair's breadth, and for this reason this species is called 'capillary fracture.'"
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	"And it is fracture that happens by impact or blow of stone and things similar to it, which causes some lamina of the bone to enter into its parts from within, as happens to the wings of birds when they suffer percussion and their bones are driven in from within."
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	"And this happens especially in the bodies of moist bones, like those of elephants' heads."
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	"And therefore for all these species of fractures sought after, they are painful like separated stars."
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	"And I will come back with remembrance of all this in its place."
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	"And you should know all these species of fracture by detection of those and by inquiry about them with touch and inspection of rotting flesh that is over them."
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	"And the capillary species is known by this: it is discovered on the bone and cleaned, and touched with a thread, because the fracture appears black."
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	"But in the treatment of fracture, first consider the accidents of the illness. And then if you see through those accidents that it signifies by clear indication about fear, like vomiting from cholera and extension and loss of consciousness and fainting and syncope and acute fever and discharge of eyes and redness of them and similar things to these in the major dispositions, it is not cured."
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	"And if you see accidents that are not usual, then hope for health, and then begin the treatment of it."
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	"And this is because if the plague has come to you at first as it was and that happened in winter days, then you should study the inspection of the bone before the fourteenth day according to all disposition."
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	"And if it is in summer days, then you should have the bone inspected on the seventh day, having that which is left behind with the bone corrupted by the periosteum, and let those accidents happen that we have recommended."
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	"And if the fracture has already reached the periosteum covering the brain and is with small partitions and attrition, then you should incise the committed and crushed partition, according to what I will recommend to you."
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	"It is necessary that you raise the head of the sick person gently, uncover it according to custom and manner as much as possible in accordance with the shape of the plague, and that it be light upon the sick."
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	"If you detect the swelling, fluxes of blood or hard abscess, then you should pause and prepare what is necessary, and if possible, place cloths infused in wine and rose oil on it, and let the swelling rest until the abscess has sedated, being sure that there are no fluxes of blood; and immediately begin with the circumcision of the swelling and its ablation."
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	"This is according to one or two methods of operation."
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And the first method is that you cut the swelling with a straight incision thus: And immediately administer another incision somewhat further on than this one..."
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	"And immediately administer another incision further yet."
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	"And it is necessary that you make diverse incisions of various lengths, some of which are further apart than others; and some of them are shorter than others and sharp at their ends, made with a knife or scalpel."
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	"And use them with ease in percussion upon the incisions so that you do not wound the head and harm him."
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	"And if the swelling is hard and tough, then you should first make a perforation around it before administering the incisions with the tweezers, which are called non-penetrating tweezers."
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	"And they are not called thus because those do not reach the end of the swelling near where it is thickest, so that the tweezers have a rounded extremity or margin over that which leaves the head sharp like a margin or small circle, which should be submerged and pass through the thickness of the swelling."
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	"And it is convenient that you take from these tweezers a large number of them, each one convenient for the thickness of each swelling, so that there may be present in all swellings of the brain an extremity which is sharp, and its quantity in length and breadth will be according to the quantity of thickness of this swelling."
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	"And this is the manner of three kinds of tweezers: The quality of perforating around the broken swelling is that you place the tweezer on the swelling and turn it with your fingers until you know that the swelling has been penetrated; and immediately move the tweezer to another place, and pause when there is between everything the quantity of the thickness of a ray or environ."
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	"And immediately incise with incisions that which is between each tract of the swelling, and make it as subtle as possible by means of levitation, as we have said before, until you eradicate the swelling, or with your hand, or with some other cause through certain instruments which you will have prepared for this purpose, such as forceps and delicate tweezers."
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	"And it is necessary that you guard with all caution that the incisions do not touch any cause of the pharynx."
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	"And then when you have circumcised the swelling with perforations, and if it is separate from the pharynx if it is continuous with it, you will extract it, taking care to raise and separate it in the thickness of it from that which is in the swelling with another instrument similar to incisions, but nevertheless it should be more thin and subtle than other incisions."
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	"And if any fragment of the little bones remains and sticks out, then take it with ease with that which you have to use among the instruments; and immediately cure the wound with stitches and dressings which we have mentioned."
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	"And the other manner of operation is light and distant from fear, which is praised by Galen and Avicenna for great praise; and this is their speech: It is necessary for you at the beginning that you begin to uncover the fracture of the bone in the place where it is most violent and manifest, until when you have uncovered that fracture and paused beside it, you will place the extremity of this lent and gentle incision of which this is the form:"
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	"And it is that the lenticular incision is long and does not incise any cause, and the acute incision is of it on both sides forward in length, as times are; so that the lenticular incision is adapted to the pharynx with the face of the incident acute bone."
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	"And then strike with a small hammer on the incision with one blow so that you incise all the bone with ease as it revolves, and you are sure of the paniculus that does not occur in it accidentally that you fear in any manner, and if the patient was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly he was asleep."
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	"Then if any cause is attached to the bone of the paniculus in some places of the bone, incise it with the extremity of this lenticular incision and detach it from it with ease because it has been detached from it without harm and without fear."
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	"And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate into the paniculus, and that which is cut off or remains on the bone is its face, and remains in it thickness and subtle adherences, then you should raise this thickness and eradicate those adherences with delicate razors by means of which you have prepared a number of different quantities so that you can use them in all places the most convenient for them and the most upright according to what you perceive about your operation on that broken bone and its figure."
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	"And you should administer in your operation with which you scrape the bone at the beginning the widest of those razors, and immediately use the most subtle of them, and do not cease to do this continuously until you arrive at administering the thinnest and the most subtle of all of them."
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	"But in each of the other little capillary fractures and subtle fractures, you should administer cure according to what you perceive regarding their correction."
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	"And this is because it is not agreed upon by all those who have studied that art."
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	"And we have shown in large fractures regarding this that was mentioned above."
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	"And if the paniculus is torn when you eradicate the bone, then you should take cloth according to the quantity of the wound and immerse it in rose oil and place it on the opening of the wound; and immediately take another folded or tripled cloth and immerse it in wine and rose oil and place it on the first cloth and do this as lightly as possible so that you do not press the pharynx and immediately apply a wide bandage, and do not stretch it except by the quantity that the wound has alone."
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	"And leave it with this cure for one or two days until you are sure of the formation of cauterization; and then untie it and immediately apply medicines with which there is superfluous dryness, such as rose water and barley flour, powder of hyssop and aristolochia, and similar things to them."
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	"And it is that you make these medicines into powder that is finely powdered on the wound as they are dry; and generally, apply to it every medicine with the property of cleaning without biting."
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	"And guard yourself according to your skill that the wound in your treatment is clean and not in its dirtiness of dressing or other; nor do you allow virulence to gather on it, for when it settles on the brain's paniculus, it corrupts it and makes it putrefy, and immediately brings about severe illness."
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	"And it happens in the pharynx of the head, especially when the bone is scraped and most when its cure is neglected, and blackness appears on its surface; therefore consider immediately if it happens to the patient the accidents that we have mentioned, you would know that they are fatal without doubt."
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	If blackness occurs only from the medicine applied above and it is due to that medicine causing this blackness, then you should take some honey and three parts of rose oil, line a cloth with them, place it on the head, and cure it with appropriate remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Here comes another sentence:
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	"On restoring a crushed nose."
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	"You should know that it is not broken but rather two fractures occurring simultaneously and then healing, or one of those injuries seen sometimes, for which reason in the nose there are two bones, since the fracture leaves behind cartilage, not bone, and therefore what happens here is merely a bruise with tortuosity and sinuosity."
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	"But if one of the two fractures in the nose is broken, then you must insert your little finger into its nasal cavity and use it to push back that fracture with your thumb inside and index finger outside until the nose returns to its natural shape."
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	"And may you accomplish this with ease, but guard against causing any harm to that person in your operation."
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	"And if the fracture is in the previously healed part of the nose and your finger cannot reach it, then you should use the tip of a needle with a small thickness."
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	"And if there are fractures on both sides, then proceed as follows:"
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	"And strive for restoration of it on the first day following the fracture, if possible; otherwise, you should apply a poultice of boiled linseed or oil, as is appropriate, to avoid an abscess."
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	"And appropriate to the fracture, insert a wick of cloth into the tip of the nose if it is on one side, or two wicks if it is on both sides, and make them thick enough that they fill the space in the nose."
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	"And some of the ancient restorers say that the wicks should be wound at the edges and changed daily, but this is not seen by me. However, it is necessary that the wick be wrapped in album honey comfits with powdered myrrh; and appropriate that the wick remains until the bone is firm and the cartilage has hardened."
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	"And sometimes, instead of wicks, pieces of linen cloth are inserted into the nose, which can cause an accumulation of pus to form and be wrapped in linen. This is especially true if the fracture of the nose is very violent and the patient cannot breathe."
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	"And this cause is not necessary for you; do as you wish, either use wicks or cloths."
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	"And if there occurs another abscess, plaster the nose with wax or with cotton soaked in vinegar and rose oil, or with diachylon."
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	"But if no abscess occurs, then you should plaster it externally with a mixture of barley flour and powdered comfits of iris with honey; appropriate to pause on it with linen bandages, and do not touch the nose for any reason."
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	"But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or comminuted, then you should split them open and remove them using appropriate instruments; appropriate to suture the wound and heal it with what binds and consolidates, and apply appropriate plasters."
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	"And if inflammation occurs inside the nose, then you should treat it with wicks and insert lead cannulae until it is completely healed."
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter IV
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	On the restoration of the jawbone when it is broken.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the lower jawbone is broken and there is no inflammation in the fracture, observe whether it is broken only externally, not in two pieces and curved at the ends inside; then its recognition will be easy.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, you should insert your left index finger into the mouth of the patient; and similarly if the fracture is on the left jawbone, then insert the right index finger; and press gently with that finger on the prominence of the fracture inside with facility at the edges outside, using your other hand to hold the edge of the bone outside; do this carefully.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jawbone is already separated into two pieces, then you should apply extension to both parts according to a straight line until it is possible to achieve reduction.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there is commotion of teeth with disruption, then strengthen those that you expect to break with gold or silver wire or thread; appropriate to plaster the broken jawbone with wax and also plaster it externally with doubled cloth and plaster it externally with a large linen bandage carefully done, or a splint of bone along the length of the jawbone; appropriate to bind it above according to how you have prepared the bandage and what is convenient for its application, until it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to rest and remain quiet, and avoid drinking hot liquids.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you estimate that the figure has already been altered in some way, then wait and remove it on the third day; appropriate to correct what is altered about it and plaster it with powdered myrrh, honey, or barley flour, since you will have removed the wax from it, and apply a linen bandage over the plaster.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then with this annexed and properly adjusted plaster on it, if the position of the bone is not altered, leave it in place until it is healed and strengthened; for many times this fracture heals in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another time an abscess occurs, then apply what has been said many times in its seduction until it is healed and the abscess is removed.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is with inflammation, then consider whether it is a piece of bone separated or displaced; then be careful to remove those displacements using what is appropriate for that purpose among the instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the opening of the inflammation is narrow, then you should dilate it with a trocar according to your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And appropriate when you have removed those displacements and if there remains no remainder from them, then close the opening of the inflammation if it is wide; and if not, plaster that with one of the plasters that are suitable for that purpose and heal it until it is healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	On the restoration of the collarbone when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Many times the collarbone is broken at its anterior part near the muscle, and this fracture occurs in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	For it may be broken, or separated, or separated into two parts without displacements; and this is easy to restore. Or it may be such that displacements occur in it, and this is difficult to restore. Or it may be such that the fracture is with inflammation.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in that case, when the fracture is without inflammation, is for you to have two assistants present, so that one holds the collarbone with forceps and follows the broken bone, and the other extends the neck at that part.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And appropriate to align the fracture with your fingers until it has been properly shaped according to what is necessary, and there remains neither prominence nor concavity.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, then it is necessary to place a pad of cloth or wool on the patient's chin according to its size based on your need; elevate and extend the collarbone and compress the pad with your hand while aligning the fracture properly.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot draw the end of the collarbone to its external part because it has been pushed forward towards the sternum, then it is necessary for the patient to be seated upright on his neck and place a large folded pad over that muscle.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the assistant presses on that muscle at its external part until the bone of the collarbone is elevated and brought back to its normal position; then you should correct the fracture and align it with your fingers.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	"If you feel pulsations in the collarbone and they are disturbing, then it is necessary to cut over that area and remove those pulsations with ease."
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And if it is retained in the bone, then you should make an incision on that area with one of the incising knives that you have prepared for this purpose, since you had already placed aside the collarbone, which serves as a lever; and it is a tool made of wood or iron, whose shape is thus:"
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	"And it resembles a spatula, the concave side of which corresponds to this shape; and its width should be according to your needs, depending on the size of the bone or the thickness of it."
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	"But its length should be according to what is possible for you in the operation; it should have two extremities thus, one of which is wide and the other is narrow."
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	"And if the disruption of the wound that you have incised when you extracted the pulsation from the bone is large, and you are certain that it will heal without infection, then you should approximate the two lips of the wound with suturing."
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	"And if the disruption is small, or you fear infection, then you should fill the wound with dressings and powders according to the quantity of the opening of the wound."
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	"And if an abscess occurs, then take a cloth soaked in vinegar and rose oil and wine, and place it on that area."
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	"But the compression of the bone when the wound and section are closed is that you should apply a plaster made of flour from the mill mixed with egg white, and place it on top of the lion's skin, and also place the bandage around the joint of it if necessary, and also take humectant, which is the long cloth that the Saracens use, which should be about the width of a palm or somewhat less; and also apply doubled powders over the plaster and the bandage; and also take a thin table steel whose width is three digits and similarly in length; and wrap it in cloth and also wrap that cloth with the steel on the location over the location of the fracture; and also apply humectant thus as it revolves, and roll it around the neck of it and around the joint of it above and below, and reduce it over all parts, and whenever the compression of the fracture is reduced by compression."
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	"And all of that, that the steel not be placed on top of the broken bone; and also so that you may see the injury every day, when the bandage becomes moist or you see that the steel is already loosened, then you should correct this and tighten the bandage."
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	"And also place the sleeping of the injured on top of his neck, and place it somewhat away from his side at night; so that with that the adjutors of him are elevated from the side of him, and therefore the fracture of the clavicle is elevated due to the elevation of the muscle; or the arm of him is tied to his neck."
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	"And do not remove the bandage until after twelve days if there is no swelling or abscess in that location."
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	"And also renew the plaster if you see the face of him become moist from that, and adjust it in the compression and restore that until it is restored and the fracture of the clavicle has coagulated."
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	"And it is strengthened and comforted in about twenty-eight days, and sometimes in some men it can be done in less time than that."
Capitol .vi.	**Chapter VI.**
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	"For the restoration of a shoulder fracture."
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	"The spatula is broken at its lateral side and not completely but only on its edges."
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	"And therefore when it is broken at its middle side — and it is broken in the middle of it — and not known except by touch, then according to the figure of the fracture forcefully prepare it and reduce it according to its natural shape in every way that you can."
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	"And appropriately pause over the location of powdered chalk with egg white and cover it with linen; and also pause with doubled cloth powder; and also pause over the selected side of the subtle table according to the quantity of the entire spatula or a little more."
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	"But if you leave the selected side with concavity in some of the locations of the spatula, then you fill that concavity with linen and appropriately press the selected side evenly."
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	"And also strengthen it from above with a long bandage with appropriate compression and with firmness of the selected side so that it is not displaced from its location."
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	"And check the bandage every day; and whenever it becomes softened, apply another layer and strengthen it and press the selected side if it has become displaced from its location."
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	"And apply the plaster over its own side."
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	"And the bandage is restored in 20 days or 25 days."
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	"And therefore when this number is completed, then you dissolve the bandage, and be assured that it is of those bones from which the beginning was not feared nor their dissolution."
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	"And if you proceed from the location of the bone of the elbow and leave the upper arm, then incise over it, evacuate it, and do according to what we have said in the fracture of the collarbone concerning the removal of an abscess if one should occur here."
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	On the restoration of a fracture of the foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	"The feet sometimes break in the middle of the body, but this is less common. The extremities are more often lame and shattered."
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	"When the middle of the body is broken by accident, it declines towards the parts within and causes great pain, difficulty in breathing, coughing, and vomiting blood. The fracture is evident in the cavity of the bone and cannot be hidden from sensation."
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	"And the restoration of it is that the sick person should be laid upon their back on a couch; and between the shoulders of them let there be placed a cushion. And gently press upon the muscles of them, and adjust the bones of them with the hands of two persons, handling the operation with subtilty, and adjusting according to all manner of way that is possible and convenient, until the figure of the bone returneth again into its proper place."
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	"And then apply plaster and lint, and place them on a subtle table of saunders or of chalk, and let them lie in levitation until you wrap them in cloth. And then handle that upon the broken bone with subtilty, taking care that it be not moved. And sometimes bind it around the back according to its roundness, and strengthen that with decent straitness; and always consider the bandage at every hour, and when it is softened, strengthen it."
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	"And if there is occasion to remove that bandage through breaking or pressing, pain, swelling, or apostume happening in the place, then thou shalt cut and loose that, and eradicate the plaster, and rectify whatsoever happened thereby with manner of cure thereof. And then again reduce the plaster, sometimes upon the face; and adjust the straitness until it be whole."
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	"Of the restoration of the ribs when they are broken."
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	"Know that fractures of the ribs occur only in large spaces that lie along the back, and at the extremities of their ends, no injury occurs except for this one because they are cartilage."
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	"You will recognize it by feeling during its inquiry with your fingers."
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	"And the restoration should be done by setting the fracture with your fingers according to the most possible manner, ensuring that it is well aligned depending on what is necessary, and then apply plaster and strengthen the broken bone with steel if needed."
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	"And if the rib fracture is displaced inward, then it causes violent pain and puncture, like the puncture that occurs in those who have coughed up blood, because the bone pierces the pleura. It also causes difficulty breathing, coughing, and vomiting of much blood; this is difficult to treat."
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	"And already the Ancients knew how to treat it with many devices."
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	"And they said that one should pause from eating for the duration of the illness that causes inflammation and windiness, so that the abdomen may be inflated and extended, and thus the fracture may be pushed outward."
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	"But we should not do this because it could easily cause an abscess to form if it is not done carefully. And if one has already formed, then it would be too late."
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	"And some of them said that one should pause from the windiness and then suck it with force. This is similar reasoning, but however it is feared that the windiness drives the impurities to the place through weakness."
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	"And some of them said: one should cover the place with wool that has already been immersed in hot oil, and then pause while powders are placed between the ribs until it is full. Then wrap it according to its roundness; and finally treat the illness with food and medicine for pleurisy."
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	"And if the illness causes violent constriction that cannot be endured, and the bone pierces the pleura with painful puncture, then one fears for the illness. Therefore, it is necessary to cut over the place, uncovering the broken rib, and then place on top of that instrument which retains the cyathiscus, whose memory is recalled earlier, in order to facilitate removing the bone and extracting it."
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	"And then join the two lips of the wound, if it is large, with suturing, and treat it with plasters until it heals."
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	"And if an abscess forms inside, then you can also apply powdered rose oil and pause over the place. And treat the illness with what is appropriate for an internal abscess."
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	"And let him be propped up on pillows while he lies in bed until he is healed."
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the Restoration of Fractures of the Spine and Neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Sometimes fractures occur in the bones of the neck, and sometimes they cause attrition there, and similarly with the spines of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	"And when this happens to someone and you want to know whether it will heal or not, then consider this: if the sinews are already softened, stunned, deadened, and cannot be moved or extended or stretched, and when you constrict them with your fingers or prick them with a needle they do not feel pain, then you know that it will not heal, and in such cases it is mortal."
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	"And if they can be moved and feel constriction with your fingers or puncture, then you know that the nape of the neck is safe and the illness will be cured with treatment."
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	"And if it seems similar to fractures of the spines of the neck, then consider their weight."
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	"And then if you find that they are already softened like the sinews discussed earlier, and moreover when he lies on his back he feels windiness and expulsion without his will, and sometimes he is propped up on his back and wants to urinate but cannot, then you know that it is mortal, and do not attempt treatment for it."
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	"But if none of these causes are found, then the cause is better and easier to treat."
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	"And the treatment for it is to apply hot compresses made with powdered rose oil or hot poultices of wheat flour and honey; pause over that place several times a day until the hard abscess is sedated."
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	"And then apply one of the comforting and stimulating plasters, and stretch it over that place with linen; and command the patient to use rest and tranquility, and not to sleep on the part where he feels pain until he is healed."
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	"And if you find deviances or some other cause that has already separated from it, then you must cut over the spine and remove that bone; and moreover join the two lips of the wound with suturing if it is large; and treat it with some medication for inflammation until it heals."
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	"But if the end of the bone is broken off, and it is the end of the coccyx, then you must insert your left hand's little finger into the anus, and grasp the broken bone with your other hand according to what is possible for balance's sake; and moreover pause over that place with plaster and bandage if necessary, and also stretch it."
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	"And if you feel deviant breaks in it, then make an incision over that place, remove that, and treat the wound with the treatment that has been mentioned until it heals."
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De restauracio de la ancha.	"Of the restoration of health."
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	"The bones of the thighs are often broken, and if they break, the fracture of them is but a communication in the extremities thereof and are inserted in the longitude and decline into the interior parts; and it happens to the patient pain in the place and puncture, and the limb is stunned when it is fractured."
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	"And the restoration of it is that you stretch your hand over that which is above the fracture which is its figure."
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	"And if the fracture is only in the extremity thereof, then you shall join it according as it appeareth unto you by Equity, joining together that which is assembled to its natural figure."
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	"But if the fracture is in the long or that which hath declined to the interior parts thereof, then thou shalt make the patient lie upon his belly within such preparation as thou hast for the restoration of that fracture."
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	"And then when you have joined it, lay upon it a plaster, and apply also upon that asthma of wood or bone, and strengthen it by straitness so that thou needest not fear puncture of fracture nor removal of the splint."
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	"And join also the concavity with that which filleth it within, and then let him take the straitness according to equality; and command the patient to sleep upon his back or upon his side."
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	"But if thou shalt perceive an aposteme hard or hot, then cease from the extension and restoration thereof until such time as that aposteme be assuaged, and lay upon it that which assuageth it according as is before spoken; and then return to the restoration of it, and strengthen it even as it behoveth."
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	"And if thou shalt perceive such in the bone set or comminuted, then thou shall make them whole."
Capitol .xi.	"Chapter xi"
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	"Of the restoration of a fracture of the thumb."
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	"The thumb is that which is between the elbow and the head of the shoulder."
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	"And if it be broken, then the restoration of it is in one of two manners: and the first manner is this, thou shalt take a flat piece of wood of medium thickness of this fashion:"
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	There are two bands at both extremes, and it should be suspended from a raised place.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	The patient should lie on a chair, and extend their broken arm over the backrest so that it reaches the tip of the backrest where the curve of the backrest is attached.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And suspend some heavy weight over that, or the servant stretches it out towards its parts; and then the doctor places his hands on the fracture with his fingers together, so that the fracture returns according to what is necessary.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	Another method is for the patient to be propped up on their back and their arm suspended from a sling around their neck. Then, two servants are commanded: one holds what is above the fracture with both hands, while the other holds what is below it; each extends their part accordingly.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, then tie another bandage over the fracture and also tie one onto that, and each of the two servants extends their part accordingly.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And if the fracture is close to the end of the muscle, then one half of the bandage should be placed on the tip and the other below the fracture towards the elbow.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	"If a fracture extends to the hip joint, then it is necessary to place a bandage over that area and around the hip."
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	"If it heals easily and without difficulty, and especially when it is healing properly with good application, then stretch it a little if there is no inflammation."
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	"However, if inflammation occurs, then leave the bandage in place for about 7 days and change it frequently with warm water and rose oil compresses until the inflammation subsides."
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	"The method of stretching it is to apply a plaster cast over the fracture and also place a napkin wrap over the plaster cast. Then adjust the arm with that device and place your hand gently on their muscle."
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	"And pause the napkin and stretch over the arm support device so that the arm is in a fixed position, unless prohibited due to some cause by the broken bone."
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	"Then use splints."
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	"And it is necessary to apply that splint which is placed on the inside and fits tightly with the others; place between each splint a pad of suitable width and make the length of the splints according to the fracture, adding three fingers' breadth beyond either side of the break."
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	"And also stretch over the splints with the tension which has been mentioned at the beginning of this chapter."
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	"And it is necessary that your tension be stronger at the site of the fracture."
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	"The longer the fracture, the less tension should be applied."
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	"Therefore, if you find yourself in the situation of having placed the splints and tension as we have said when restoring the member to its normal position, then do it."
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if you suspect inflammation is developing, then leave the tension and splints on for about 7 days as we have said."
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	"And also consider the limb in all cases for three days so that no pressure or inflammation occurs; or if food cannot reach the member due to excess tension, then correct everything as we have said."
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	"But if you are uncertain whether this might cause some harm, do not remove the bandage for at least three days or more."
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	"And let his bed be inclined upwards at the head so that he may sleep comfortably and have his hands on his stomach."
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	"And place over the cooking support a full pot of wool wadding and consider every hour of the night or day that the figure of the broken limb is not displaced nor dissolved, or if the limb is softened, then correct everything with your skill."
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	"And place food for the patient according to the order which we have mentioned earlier, ensuring that the food is finely chopped at first so that it can be swallowed easily; and then gradually make the food coarser."
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	"However, it is customary for the splint and bandage to be left on for 40 days, after which they should be removed and a warm bath administered along with medicines that will correct any remaining issues."
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	"And if the fracture is still unhealed, do not remove the limb and splints for up to 10 days or even up to two months."
Capitol .xii.	"Chapter XII."
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	"On the reduction of fractures of the arm."
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	"The arm consists of two bones called the 'two forks'; one is small and it is this that supports the thumb, while the other is large and is situated below the small finger."
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	"And sometimes only the larger fork may be fractured, or just the smaller one, but it also happens that they are both broken together."
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	"And when the small fork is fractured above, its reduction will be easier and its healing will also be quicker."
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	"However, when the fork of the arm below the fracture is broken, its reduction is difficult and its healing is slow."
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	"And it is even worse when both bones are fractured together."
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	"Therefore, if the bone that is fractured is the small fork above, it is appropriate for the physician to perform its reduction by gently pulling on it until it becomes straight."
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	"But if it is the large fork that is broken, then more forceful traction must be applied."
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	"And if both forks are broken together, then you must apply traction with even greater force."
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	"And during the reduction and traction of the arm, it is necessary for the hand to be placed on a pillow with the palm facing upwards, and for the thumb to be kept above all the other fingers and for the patient to be centered on a well-cushioned chair."
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	"And place a pillow in front of him at the level of his elbow or shoulder, so that he does not exert himself."
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	"Then one assistant should extend the arm from below with their hand or a bandage, while another assistant extends it from above in the same manner."
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	"And then the physician should align the bone so that it can be reduced to its best possible position."
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	"If during the reduction of the bone any resistance is felt, then you must use all your skill to overcome it and reduce it completely into its place."
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	"And if during reduction it appears that the elbow joint is dislocated and this was not expected, then you must reduce it according to the method which we have described above."
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	"But if the fracture is accompanied by inflammation, I have already spoken of this in another chapter, so take care to treat it accordingly."
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.
