De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of the treatment of dislocation of those [joints].
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes these joints become dislocated all at once.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any of these fingers is dislocated on the back or palm side of the hand, then stretch that finger and push the dislocation back with your thumbs until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And afterwards support the head of the finger and suspend it from the part where it was dislocated, leaving it thus for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And later suspend that [finger] again and stretch it until it is completely straightened within that same day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when night falls, bind that [finger] according to this description, and do not cease loosening it during the day and exercising it with movements, and bind it at night. Do this for several days until it is straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do likewise if it is dislocated on the palm of the hand, and bind it at that part and perform your first operation until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	Similarly, do this in all other cases of dislocation.
Capitol .xxx.	**Chapter 30.**
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Of the treatment of dislocation of the spinal joints.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When dislocation of one or more spinal joints occurs in the back or neck, and many vertebrae are displaced from their proper places, then there is no hope for cure at that time because death usually ensues.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And the sign of this is that evacuation of the bowels occurs involuntarily and cannot be retained. Many times some limbs become paralyzed on one side or both sides, either one leg or both arms, or one arm. Sometimes one vertebra is displaced from its proper place because many times displacement occurs in four directions.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore, it has already been displaced to the back and is called scoliosis (curvature of the spine).
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But its treatment is as follows: first consider if scoliosis occurred in childhood because then there is no cure and it cannot be completely healed.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But those who come later with treatment by plaster or percussion or other similar methods have already discussed the ways of treatment in lengthy speeches. However, I will briefly discuss it as follows because it is appropriate to my intended purpose and I have already explained and demonstrated many instruments for this purpose.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	I say that scoliosis which occurs on the anterior side of the spine cannot be corrected nor healed. Similarly, that which is made to both sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And only those can be cured whose scoliosis occurs specifically in the posterior part as I will recount later.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And let the patient lie on their face with their head close to a wall. Let them be covered with soft pillows so that the spine does not get injured.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And place a straight stick on the ground near the head of the patient and another stick under their feet at the other end.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And let one assistant hold the stick near the head but not in a pit, and another assistant hold the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And place a cap on the patient's head and tie it firmly with soft cloth. Extend the end of one bandage to the stick placed above the patient's head, attach it there, and extend another bandage over the hips and knees of the patient towards both sides. Then adjust all the bandages and attach them to the other stick placed near the patient's feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then each assistant extends the bandages to their respective sticks. The two sticks and the bandages should not be removed from their places but should remain there without being too tightly fastened as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor places his palms on the spine with firmness until it returns to its proper position. Or he may place one foot on that part and adjust himself there. Then he places his feet on the table so that he can return.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return by this method, then take a table whose width or length is about three braccia. Then make a hole in the wall near the patient where the end of the table can fit into it.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And place the middle of the table on the spine. The doctor places his feet on the other end and presses firmly until the spine is corrected and returns to its proper position.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, use a wrench to turn it back with your hand. Lie on the ground near the patient's head between two sticks whose length is one braccio each and place another stick of the same length under their head in the same way. Make sure that there is a palm's width between each stick and make a groove in each stick for the cord to pass through. Ensure that each stick is firmly fixed on the ground so that it does not move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And place a round stick in which the wrench is inserted into both grooves of the two sticks.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And on one end of it there is a hole in which the stick is formed. The length of this stick is one palm with a groove for turning. The other two sticks have similar holes.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then tighten the bandages that you have stretched over the spine of the patient on the stick near their head. And also tighten the bandages that you have stretched over their hips and knees onto the stick near their feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then on each stick place an assistant who will turn the wrench with their hand while the doctor presses the spine back into its proper position as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is how to use the wrench:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And once the spine has been corrected and returned to its proper position, then apply a plaster consisting of chalk and album ground together with egg whites. Then place gauze on it and place the plaster on a table whose width is about three digits or somewhat more. The length should be equal to the size of the swelling and placed over the affected part of the spine.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then wrap it with bandages as we have said and feed the patient a subtle diet until they are healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there is still some swelling at the end of the healing process, then apply medicines that soften and cleanse using the application of the table for a long time. We have already recommended this method, and it should be applied to that area with a lead plate.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And sometimes swelling occurs at the back of the lower spine due to that dislocation. That bone already threatens death and therefore no pressure should be applied to it with this medicine because it will cause great harm.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXI
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of the treatment of a dislocated hip joint.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the thigh meet only by dislocation alone. This does not occur at other joints with small movements or concavities.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the hip joint can become dislocated in four ways: either inward or outward at its front parts or backward at its rear parts.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	It is most commonly dislocated inwardly, and less frequently anteriorly or posteriorly.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	The sign of hip dislocation inwardly is that when you compare the length of the healthy limb with the sick one, the sick one appears shorter and its thighbone sticks out more prominently than the healthy one. The patient cannot bend their leg or knee inward, and this area becomes inflamed as if there were a hot abscess. This indicates that the head of the femur has moved into this position.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The sign of dislocation occurring at its outer parts is that its symptoms are opposite to those mentioned previously.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	"The sign of one who has suffered a dislocation in front is when the chamber expands according to its nature, yet that part does not bend without pain; if one tries to walk, they cannot do so without discomfort. The urine is retained and the swelling is inflamed, and movement causes pain in the heel."
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	"The sign of one who has suffered a dislocation in the back is that the knee does not straighten and cannot bend without pain; the chamber of it is shorter than the other one, the swelling is softened, and the head of the matter is turned towards that place."
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	"But reduction of the species of this dislocation is that you should consider whether the dislocation is ancient and old, which has already become accustomed to having that approach. You then administer reduction according to its condition, but it does not enter into total cure; therefore no traction should be made in that case."
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	"But in one who has recently suffered a dislocation of any of the four species, you should quickly turn the joint back into place and extend it on both front and rear parts. Then move it to the right and left until it returns completely; then no other treatment is necessary."
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	"But if it does not return in this manner, then you should prepare a strong bandage and extend the chamber of it from the farthest part, or with its own muscles, or by attaching a bandage above the bone. Then another assistant should extend the arm of that person upwards so that their hands are placed behind their buttocks. And again stretch tightly with a bandage on the root of the matter, and have another assistant hold the extremity of the bandage."
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	"And stretch it either from its front part to its angle at the collarbone or from its rear part to its angle at the shoulder blade."
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	"And all these stretches should be done in one session while the patient is lying on their back with their buttocks elevated and knees hanging down."
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	"This species of extension applies generally to all four species [of dislocation]."
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	"And therefore if the dislocation returns with what we have said, it will be well. But if not, then it is necessary for each species to undergo its own specific treatment."
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	"For reduction of its own kind, when it is dislocated from the front parts, the patient should be made to sit up on their left side. Then bind the bandages tightly over the root of the matter at that point between the head of the bone and the angle of the collarbone. And then extend the bandage upwards from the angle of the collarbone towards the upper part of the shoulder blade."
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	"And then another strong assistant should take hold of both of his arms and press the thick part of the bone against it while stretching forcefully outward so that it returns to its proper place."
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	"And this species is that which requires the easiest reduction by which this member is returned, compared to the other species [of dislocation]."
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	"But if it is not reduced by this species of treatment and does not obey the return, then you should lift both legs of the patient together with a light, loose bandage over both thighs and buttocks."
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	"And let the length of each be as much as four fingerbreadths, and let the bandage be extended further than the other by two fingerbreadths."
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	"And then suspend the patient over the head of the bed, with their feet on the floor and their legs extended. The distance from the ground should be about two spans."
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	"And then command a strong youth to press down on the head of the bone and suspend himself together with the patient. And another youth should forcefully press down on the bone so that the joint returns quickly to its proper place."
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	"But in the proper reduction when it is dislocated outward, the patient should lie on their back as we have recommended in cases of dislocation with swelling. And let the bandage be stretched over the dislocated part itself and over its lower edge."
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	"And then two posts should be placed, one under the foot and one under the head. And another post should be adjusted in the middle of the elbow with damp cloths wrapped around it so that the patient is not harmed by the post being between their bones, for fear that the extension towards the outer part might pull on it."
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	"And then each assistant should extend to his part, and the physician with his hand should guide the reduction according to the art."
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	"So if it obeys by returning, it will be very good. And if not, pause over that diligently and so do as we have said in case of swelling for that guidance."
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	"But the patient should lie on their side quietly."
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	"But when the dislocation is at the inner part, then let the bandage be extended lightly. And this is how it is done on the elbow: and the physician places the palm of his right hand on the dislocated collarbone and then presses that with his other hand while extending it towards the outer part towards the shoulder blade."
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	"But when the dislocation is at the back part, then it is not necessary for the patient to be extended towards the outer part, but rather they should be elevated on the ground. And it must be placed on a hard surface, just as in the case of an ankle dislocation outward, according to what we have said about the elevation of it onto two ankles; and this is done with their face downwards and the bandages extended as we have said."
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	"And compression should be administered with a board over the place where the joint goes."
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	"So when the reduction is complete, you will know that it has been done correctly if when you extend both bandages and the patient pulls on them and extends their arm without difficulty, then you will know that the member has been returned properly. And then you should adjust two splints and apply pressure firmly while extending with a bandage so that the ankle is not moved from either part; and let the patient remain at rest for three or four days."
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	"And then untie the bandages and the pressure, and compare one splint with the other."
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	"Then if you find that those joints are firm, then you will know that the dislocation has been fixed, and at that point you should let the patient go."
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	"And if you find any sign of loosening, then return and splint it again, extend it according to your first traction, and let it remain for three days."
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	"And then release that, and let the patient walk about on each foot alternately for several days until they are strengthened."
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter XXXII
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of the treatment of dislocation of the shoulder blade.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The shoulder blade can be dislocated in three ways: outward, inward, and more often toward the outer side than towards the back part. It is not dislocated towards the front part."
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	The sign of dislocation of it is that when you command the patient to apply their arm with the elbow, then you will know that the shoulder blade is dislocated."
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all three kinds is that you make the patient sit upright so that they can extend their arm if possible; then press your two hands on its face and place the patient's foot between your feet. Then bring the shoulder blade back with both palms, holding it between your hands strongly until the other minister extends the patient's foot until the shoulder blade returns to its proper place."
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	"It is a sign of recovery that their bed adheres to them without labor."
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	"And then, apply this plaster and make the bed adhere to them. Also, tie those wounds with a bandage for three or four days, and then untie them."
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	"The patient should not use their legs for some days until they are healed and strengthened."
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	"However, if the reduction of this one is excused, you should then administer a strong extension with traction from those ligaments which were involved in the previous hip operation."
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	About the treatment of ankle dislocation.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle sometimes becomes displaced with slight motion and sometimes becomes dislocated upon completion; its dislocation occurs either inward or outward.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of ankle dislocation is that sometimes the ankle appears swollen at the site where it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	"The cure for moving him is easy to accomplish: he should be gently extended with his hands and turned until he returns."
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	"However, in the case of a dislocation treated according to all the rules, it is necessary that you keep the patient on their right side, and one assistant must be strong and skilled at placing his hand behind the patient's back in the middle of it."
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	"And with your right hand grasp the upper part of the thigh near the hip, and with your left hand grasp the lower part of the thigh near the knee."
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	"And then pull the thigh towards you with your right hand, and hold it there with your left hand for two or three times, and then extend it with your left hand; and press the head of the bone against the hip socket without shaking."
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	"And perform this procedure twice as we have described."
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	"And then press the head of the bone into the hip socket on the third attempt, and you are at the ilium."
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore if this method is returned to once or twice again, and if the foot swells, that's good; otherwise, then repeat the operation, because that returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if you are forbidden from reducing the hernia with what we have mentioned, then make the patient lie on their side on the ground, and insert a small stone between their thighs, secured firmly to prevent slipping. Then wrap a cloth around them so that they do not move.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And then the minister of the testicles should hold their scrotum, and another minister should extend the leg with its thigh or bandage that lies on the thigh; and each minister should stretch out their own side, and the stone should remain between the thighs of the sick person holding it, so that the body does not move towards its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And then the doctor reduces the dislocation with their hands, and another minister holds the healthy thigh on the outside to prevent displacement.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And then when the dislocation returns and it is declared to you that the reduction has been successful, then apply plaster and secure it with bandages very tightly. Then tie the thigh with bandages at the knee.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	Be careful or guard yourself from the nerves which are behind the heel, for if you bind it tightly there it will cause pain and hurt them greatly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And then leave him like that for two or three days; and if the bandage becomes softened, remove it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And then on the third day or the fourth day, remove the splint from him, and forbid the patient to move for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if he is forced to walk during that time, it is not guaranteed that the dislocation will not be dissolved and corrupted again, and thus would not receive proper treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	But if an abscess forms from the wound, then you should apply the remedies that were mentioned earlier in this narrative regarding cure and embrocation until it is removed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter XXXIV
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of the treatment of dislocation of the said feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	It is necessary that one who has suffered a dislocation should be reduced with little extension without struggle; and it should not be difficult to accomplish this, for the leg is lighter.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in some joints of the toes of the foot, then you should have the patient lie on their back on the ground or on a table, and hold their leg extended as if they were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you stand on your feet, and place your hand beneath the protruding joints, and press down with your foot with force until it returns into its proper position, and make sure that it is properly reduced and does not protrude again.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then place the sole of the foot on a table that takes up all the leg, which has two ends. Then stretch it properly and firmly with bandages for three days. Then remove them and have him rest from walking for many days until he is healed and the reduction is secure.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	"Of dislocation injuries that occur with bruising or fracture or in combination."
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When some cause of those occurs, and you perform the cure of that and the restoration of it, many times death succeeds.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	"And therefore it is not necessary that one presume about its cure, but rather he who is wise in the art, experienced through long practice, merciful and compassionate, careful, not reckless or presumptuous; and let him begin with medicines that draw out only abscesses, and leave the patient to divine judgment, but also to him whom you hope for healing from destruction, with alleviation of the illness, and in which some hope appears."
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And therefore strive immediately to reduce it at the beginning of the cause, before an abscess forms.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the limb returns as we wish, afterwards administer regimen which draws out abscess and heals the bruising with whatever is convenient to it of the dried remedies.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if dislocation occurs with fracture and the broken ends of the bone are displaced, then you perform the reduction of them, and do in this what we have said in the simple cases of that which is precedent in the places of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And guard and avoid according to your ability that which enters through the paths of fear, as my prediction has preceded for you; because this is better for your Creator than you deserve, and more lasting for your glory, and more healthy for your true body in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus endeth the words of Albucasis perfectly, may God bless them!
Amen.	Amen.
